analyzed: bhrātaram tam agastyasya āmantrayata rāghavaḥ
translated: Raghava took leave of his brother Agastya.

original: abhivādaye tvā bhagavan sukham adhyuṣito niśām /
analyzed: abhivādaye tvā bhagavan sukham adhyuṣitaḥ niśām
translated: I greet you, O revered one. I have spent the night happily.

original: āmantraye tvāṃ gacchāmi guruṃ te draṣṭum agrajam // / / //
analyzed: āmantraye tvām gacchāmi gurum te draṣṭum agrajam
translated: I take leave of you. I am going to see your elder brother, the Guru.

original: gamyatām iti tenokto jagāma raghunandanaḥ /
analyzed: gamyatām iti tena uktaḥ jagāma raghunandanaḥ
translated: He said, Go, and the descendant of Raghu went.

original: yathoddiṣṭena mārgeṇa vanaṃ tac cāvalokayan // / / //
analyzed: yathā uddiṣṭena mārgeṇa vanam tat ca avalokayan
translated: Looking at that forest along the path indicated,

original: nīvārān panasāṃs tālāṃs timiśān vañjulān dhavān /
analyzed: nīvārān panasān tālān timiśān vañjulān dhavān
translated: he saw nīvāra grains, jackfruit trees, palm trees, tiriviḍa trees, vanjula trees, dhava trees,

original: ciribilvān madhūkāṃś ca bilvān api ca tindukān // / / //
analyzed: ciribilvān madhūkān ca bilvān api ca tindukān
translated: ciribīlva trees, madhuka trees, bilva trees, and tinduka trees,

original: puṣpitān puṣpitāgrābhir latābhir anuveṣṭitān /
analyzed: puṣpitān puṣpita agrābhiḥ latābhiḥ anuveṣṭitān
translated: covered with flowering creepers, their tops covered with flowers.

original: dadarśa rāmaḥ śataśas tatra kāntārapādapān // / / //🔽hastihastair vimṛditān vānarair upaśobhitān /
analyzed: dadarśa rāmaḥ śataśas tatra kāntāra pādapān  hasti hastaiḥ vimṛditān vānaraiḥ upaśobhitān
translated: Rāma saw hundreds of such desert trees there.🔽Crushed by the trunks of elephants, adorned by monkeys,

original: mattaiḥ śakunisaṃghaiś ca śataśaḥ pratināditān // / / //🔽tato 'bravīt samīpasthaṃ rāmo rājīvalocanaḥ /
analyzed: mattaiḥ śakuni saṃghaiḥ ca śataśas pratināditān  tatas bravīt samīpa stham rāmaḥ rājīva locanaḥ
translated: and resounding with the cries of flocks of intoxicated birds, in hundreds.

original: pṛṣṭhato 'nugataṃ vīraṃ lakṣmaṇaṃ lakṣmivardhanam // / / //
analyzed: pṛṣṭhatas nugatam vīram lakṣmaṇam lakṣmi vardhanam
translated: Then the lotus-eyed Rāma said to the hero Lakṣmaṇa, the enhancer of prosperity, who was following behind him.

original: snigdhapattrā yathā vṛkṣā yathā kṣāntā mṛgadvijāḥ /
analyzed: snigdha pattrāḥ yathā vṛkṣāḥ yathā kṣāntāḥ mṛga dvijāḥ
translated: Just as the trees have glossy leaves, and the deer and birds are patient,

original: āśramo nātidūrastho maharṣer bhāvitātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: āśramaḥ na ati dūra sthaḥ mahā ṛṣeḥ bhāvitātmanaḥ
translated: the hermitage of the great sage of purified soul is not far away.

original: agastya iti vikhyāto loke svenaiva karmaṇā /
analyzed: agastyaḥ iti vikhyātaḥ loke svena eva karmaṇā
translated: He is known in the world by his own deeds as Agastya.

original: āśramo dṛśyate tasya pariśrāntaśramāpahaḥ // / / //
analyzed: āśramaḥ dṛśyate tasya pariśrānta śrama apahaḥ
translated: His hermitage is seen, removing the fatigue of the weary.

original: prājyadhūmākulavanaś cīramālāpariṣkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: prājya dhūma ākula vanaḥ cīra mālā pariṣkṛtaḥ
translated: The forest is filled with thick smoke, adorned with garlands of bark garments,

original: praśāntamṛgayūthaś ca nānāśakunināditaḥ // / / //
analyzed: praśānta mṛga yūthaḥ ca nānā śakuni nāditaḥ
translated: peaceful herds of deer, and the sounds of various birds.

original: nigṛhya tarasā mṛtyuṃ lokānāṃ hitakāmyayā /
analyzed: nigṛhya tarasā mṛtyum lokānām hita kāmyayā
translated: Having quickly conquered death, with a desire for the welfare of the worlds,

original: dakṣiṇā dik kṛtā yena śaraṇyā puṇyakarmaṇā // / / //
analyzed: dakṣiṇā diś kṛtā yena śaraṇyā puṇya karmaṇā
translated: this southern direction, which is a refuge, has been made by the one of meritorious deeds.

original: tasyedam āśramapadaṃ prabhāvād yasya rākṣasaiḥ /
analyzed: tasya idam āśrama padam prabhāvāt yasya rākṣasaiḥ
translated: This is his hermitage, by whose power

original: dig iyaṃ dakṣiṇā trāsād dṛśyate nopabhujyate // / / //
analyzed: diś iyam dakṣiṇā trāsāt dṛśyate na upabhujyate
translated: this southern direction is seen to be avoided out of fear by the demons.

original: yadāprabhṛti cākrāntā dig iyaṃ puṇyakarmaṇā /
analyzed: yadā prabhṛti ca ākrāntā diś iyam puṇya karmaṇā
translated: Since this direction has been conquered by the one of meritorious deeds,

original: tadā prabhṛti nirvairāḥ praśāntā rajanīcarāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tadā prabhṛti nirvairāḥ praśāntāḥ rajanīcarāḥ
translated: since then the night-wandering demons have become peaceful and free from enmity.

original: nāmnā ceyaṃ bhagavato dakṣiṇā dik pradakṣiṇā /
analyzed: nāmnā ca iyam bhagavataḥ dakṣiṇā diś pradakṣiṇā
translated: This southern direction of the Blessed One is known as Pradakshina,

original: prathitā triṣu lokeṣu durdharṣā krūrakarmabhiḥ // / / //🔽mārgaṃ niroddhuṃ satataṃ bhāskarasyācalottamaḥ /
analyzed: prathitā triṣu lokeṣu durdharṣā krūra karmabhiḥ  mārgam niroddhum satatam bhāskarasya acala uttamaḥ
translated: famous in the three worlds, difficult to be approached by those of cruel deeds.🔽This best of mountains, Vindhya, always obstructs the path of the sun,

original: saṃdeśaṃ pālayaṃs tasya vindhyaḥ śailo na vardhate // / / //
analyzed: saṃdeśam pālayan tasya vindhyaḥ śailaḥ na vardhate
translated: but does not grow, obeying his command.

original: ayaṃ dīrghāyuṣas tasya loke viśrutakarmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: ayam dīrgha āyuṣaḥ tasya loke viśruta karmaṇaḥ
translated: This is the hermitage of the long-lived one, of him whose deeds are famous in the world,

original: agastyasyāśramaḥ śrīmān vinītamṛgasevitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: agastyasya āśramaḥ śrīmān vinīta mṛga sevitaḥ
translated: the glorious Agastya, frequented by well-behaved deer.

original: eṣa lokārcitaḥ sādhur hite nityaṃ rataḥ satām /
analyzed: eṣa loka arcitaḥ sādhuḥ hite nityam rataḥ satām
translated: This virtuous one is worshipped by the world and is always engaged in the welfare of the good.

original: asmān adhigatān eṣa śreyasā yojayiṣyati // / / //
analyzed: asmān adhigatān eṣa śreyasā yojayiṣyati
translated: He will surely unite us with prosperity.

original: ārādhayiṣyāmy atrāham agastyaṃ taṃ mahāmunim /
analyzed: ārādhayiṣyāmi atrā aham agastyam tam mahā munim
translated: Here I shall propitiate that great sage Agastya.

original: śeṣaṃ ca vanavāsasya saumya vatsyāmy ahaṃ prabho // / / //
analyzed: śeṣam ca vana vāsasya saumya vatsyāmi aham prabho
translated: O gentle one, O lord, I shall spend the remaining part of my forest life here.

original: atra devāḥ sagandharvāḥ siddhāś ca paramarṣayaḥ /
analyzed: atra devāḥ sa gandharvāḥ siddhāḥ ca parama ṛṣayaḥ
translated: Here gods, Gandharvas, Siddhas and great sages,

original: agastyaṃ niyatāhāraṃ satataṃ paryupāsate // / / //🔽nātra jīven mṛṣāvādī krūro vā yadi vā śaṭhaḥ /
analyzed: agastyam niyata āhāram satatam paryupāsate  na atra jīvet mṛṣāvādī krūraḥ vā yadi vā śaṭhaḥ
translated: always attend upon Agastya who is restrained in diet.🔽Here a liar, a cruel person, a deceitful person,

original: nṛśaṃsaḥ kāmavṛtto vā munir eṣa tathāvidhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: nṛśaṃsaḥ kāma vṛttaḥ vā muniḥ eṣa tathāvidhaḥ
translated: a harsh person or one who acts out of desire cannot live. This sage is of a different kind.

original: atra devāś ca yakṣāś ca nāgāś ca patagaiḥ saha /
analyzed: atra devāḥ ca yakṣāḥ ca nāgāḥ ca patagaiḥ saha
translated: Here gods, Yakshas, Nagas and birds,

original: vasanti niyatāhārā dharmam ārādhayiṣṇavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vasanti niyata āhārāḥ dharmam ārādhayiṣṇavaḥ
translated: reside, restrained in diet, seeking to propitiate Dharma.

original: atra siddhā mahātmāno vimānaiḥ sūryasaṃnibhaiḥ /
analyzed: atra siddhāḥ mahātmānaḥ vimānaiḥ sūrya saṃnibhaiḥ
translated: Here great-souled Siddhas, having attained perfection, in aerial cars resembling the sun,

original: tyaktvā dehān navair dehaiḥ svaryātāḥ paramarṣayaḥ // / / //🔽yakṣatvam amaratvaṃ ca rājyāni vividhāni ca /
analyzed: tyaktvā dehāt navaiḥ dehaiḥ svaryātāḥ parama ṛṣayaḥ  yakṣa tvam amara tvam ca rājyāni vividhāni ca
translated: having abandoned their old bodies, have gone to heaven in new bodies.

original: atra devāḥ prayacchanti bhūtair ārādhitāḥ śubhaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: atra devāḥ prayacchanti bhūtaiḥ ārādhitāḥ śubhaiḥ
translated: Here gods, when propitiated by auspicious beings, grant🔽Yakshahood, immortality and various kinds of kingdoms.

original: āgatāḥ smāśramapadaṃ saumitre praviśāgrataḥ /
analyzed: āgatāḥ sma āśrama padam saumitre praviśa agratas
translated: O son of Sumitra, we have come to the hermitage. Enter first.

original: nivedayeha māṃ prāptam ṛṣaye saha sītayā // / / //
analyzed: nivedaya iha mām prāptam ṛṣaye saha sītayā
translated: And inform the Rishi that I have come with Sita.

original: sa praviśyāśramapadaṃ lakṣmaṇo rāghavānujaḥ /
analyzed: sa praviśya āśrama padam lakṣmaṇaḥ rāghava anujaḥ
translated: Lakshmana, the younger brother of Rama, having entered the hermitage,

original: agastyaśiṣyam āsādya vākyam etad uvāca ha // / / //
analyzed: agastya śiṣyam āsādya vākyam etat uvāca ha
translated: approached Agastya's disciple and spoke these words:

original: rājā daśaratho nāma jyeṣṭhas tasya suto balī /
analyzed: rājā daśarathaḥ nāma jyeṣṭhaḥ tasya sutaḥ balī
translated: There was a king named Dasharatha. His eldest son, the powerful one,

original: rāmaḥ prāpto muniṃ draṣṭuṃ bhāryayā saha sītayā // / / //
analyzed: rāmaḥ prāptaḥ munim draṣṭum bhāryayā saha sītayā
translated: Rama, has come with his wife Sita to see the sage.

original: lakṣmaṇo nāma tasyāhaṃ bhrātā tv avarajo hitaḥ /
analyzed: lakṣmaṇaḥ nāma tasya aham bhrātā tu avarajaḥ hitaḥ
translated: I am his younger brother named Lakshmana, devoted to his welfare.

original: anukūlaś ca bhaktaś ca yadi te śrotram āgataḥ // / / //
analyzed: anukūlaḥ ca bhaktaḥ ca yadi te śrotram āgataḥ
translated: If you have heard of me, I am his obedient and devoted follower.

original: te vayaṃ vanam atyugraṃ praviṣṭāḥ pitṛśāsanāt /
analyzed: te vayam vanam ati ugram praviṣṭāḥ pitṛ śāsanāt
translated: We have entered this terrible forest at the command of our father.

original: draṣṭum icchāmahe sarve bhagavantaṃ nivedyatām // / / //
analyzed: draṣṭum icchāmahe sarve bhagavantam nivedyatām
translated: We all wish to see the illustrious one. Please inform him.

original: tasya tadvacanaṃ śrutvā lakṣmaṇasya tapodhanaḥ /
analyzed: tasya tat vacanam śrutvā lakṣmaṇasya tapodhanaḥ
translated: Having heard the words of Lakshmana, the ascetic,

original: tathety uktvāgniśaraṇaṃ praviveśa niveditum // / / //
analyzed: tathā iti uktvā agni śaraṇam praviveśa niveditum
translated: saying So be it, entered the sacrificial chamber to inform the sage.

original: sa praviśya muniśreṣṭhaṃ tapasā duṣpradharṣaṇam /
analyzed: sa praviśya muni śreṣṭham tapasā duṣpradharṣaṇam
translated: Having entered, he saw the best of sages, invincible through austerities,

original: kṛtāñjalir uvācedaṃ rāmāgamanam añjasā // / / //
analyzed: kṛta añjaliḥ uvāca idam rāma āgamanam añjasā
translated: and with folded hands, he promptly informed him of Rama's arrival.

original: putrau daśarathasyemau rāmo lakṣmaṇa eva ca /
analyzed: putrau daśarathasya imau rāmaḥ lakṣmaṇaḥ eva ca
translated: These two sons of Dasharatha, Rama and Lakshmana,

original: praviṣṭāv āśramapadaṃ sītayā saha bhāryayā // / / //
analyzed: praviṣṭau āśrama padam sītayā saha bhāryayā
translated: have entered the hermitage with their wife Sita.

original: draṣṭuṃ bhavantam āyātau śuśrūṣārtham ariṃdamau /
analyzed: draṣṭum bhavantam āyātau śuśrūṣā artham ariṃdamau
translated: They have come to see you, to serve you, those two subduers of enemies.

original: yad atrānantaraṃ tattvam ājñāpayitum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: yat atra anantaram tat tvam ājñāpayitum arhasi
translated: You should command what should be done next in this matter.

original: tataḥ śiṣyād upaśrutya prāptaṃ rāmaṃ salakṣmaṇam /
analyzed: tatas śiṣyāt upaśrutya prāptam rāmam sa lakṣmaṇam
translated: Then, having heard from his disciple that Rama had arrived with Lakshmana,

original: vaidehīṃ ca mahābhāgām idaṃ vacanam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: vaidehīm ca mahābhāgām idam vacanam abravīt
translated: he spoke these words to the greatly fortunate Vaidehi:

original: diṣṭyā rāmaś cirasyādya draṣṭuṃ māṃ samupāgataḥ /
analyzed: diṣṭyā rāmaḥ cirasya adya draṣṭum mām samupāgataḥ
translated: By good fortune, Rama has come to see me after a long time.

original: manasā kāṅkṣitaṃ hy asya mayāpy āgamanaṃ prati // / / //
analyzed: manasā kāṅkṣitam hi asya mayā api āgamanam prati
translated: I too have been mentally longing for his arrival.

original: gamyatāṃ satkṛto rāmaḥ sabhāryaḥ sahalakṣmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: gamyatām satkṛtaḥ rāmaḥ sa bhāryaḥ saha lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Go and receive Rama with due honors, along with his wife and Lakshmana.

original: praveśyatāṃ samīpaṃ me kiṃ cāsau na praveśitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: praveśyatām samīpam me kim ca asau na praveśitaḥ
translated: Why was he not brought in? Let him be brought into my presence.

original: evam uktas tu muninā dharmajñena mahātmanā /
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tu muninā dharma jñena mahātmanā
translated: Thus addressed by the great sage who knew dharma,

original: abhivādyābravīc chiṣyas tatheti niyatāñjaliḥ // / / //
analyzed: abhivādya abravīt śiṣyaḥ tathā iti niyata añjaliḥ
translated: the disciple, with folded hands, paid his respects and replied, As you say.

original: tato niṣkramya saṃbhrāntaḥ śiṣyo lakṣmaṇam abravīt /
analyzed: tatas niṣkramya saṃbhrāntaḥ śiṣyaḥ lakṣmaṇam abravīt
translated: Then, having come out in a hurry, the disciple said to Lakshmana:

original: kvāsau rāmo muniṃ draṣṭum etu praviśatu svayam // / / //
analyzed: kva asau rāmaḥ munim draṣṭum etu praviśatu svayam
translated: Where is Rama? Let him come to see the sage and enter himself.

original: tato gatvāśramapadaṃ śiṣyeṇa sahalakṣmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: tatas gatvā āśrama padam śiṣyeṇa saha lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Then Lakshmana went to the hermitage with his disciple,

original: darśayāmāsa kākutsthaṃ sītāṃ ca janakātmajām // / / //
analyzed: darśayāmāsa kākutstham sītām ca janakātmajām
translated: and showed Kakutstha and Sita, the daughter of Janaka.

original: taṃ śiṣyaḥ praśritaṃ vākyam agastyavacanaṃ bruvan /
analyzed: tam śiṣyaḥ praśritam vākyam agastya vacanam bruvan
translated: The disciple, speaking humbly, conveyed the words of Agastya,

original: prāveśayad yathānyāyaṃ satkārārthaṃ susatkṛtam // / / //
analyzed: prāveśayat yathānyāyam satkāra artham su satkṛtam
translated: and duly ushered in the well-honored Rama for the sake of hospitality.

original: praviveśa tato rāmaḥ sītayā sahalakṣmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: praviveśa tatas rāmaḥ sītayā saha lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Then Rama entered with Sita and Lakshmana,

original: praśāntahariṇākīrṇam āśramaṃ hy avalokayan // / / //
analyzed: praśānta hariṇa ākīrṇam āśramam hi avalokayan
translated: looking at the hermitage filled with peaceful deer.

original: sa tatra brahmaṇaḥ sthānam agneḥ sthānaṃ tathaiva ca /
analyzed: sa tatra brahmaṇaḥ sthānam agneḥ sthānam tathā eva ca
translated: There he saw the abode of Brahma, the abode of Agni,

original: viṣṇoḥ sthānaṃ mahendrasya sthānaṃ caiva vivasvataḥ // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ sthānam mahā indrasya sthānam ca eva vivasvataḥ
translated: the abode of Vishnu, the abode of the great Indra, and the abode of Vivasvat.

original: somasthānaṃ bhagasthānaṃ sthānaṃ kauberam eva ca /
analyzed: soma sthānam bhaga sthānam sthānam kauberam eva ca
translated: The abode of Soma, the abode of Bhaga, the abode of Kubera,

original: dhātur vidhātuḥ sthānaṃ ca vāyoḥ sthānaṃ tathaiva ca // / / //
analyzed: dhātuḥ vidhātuḥ sthānam ca vāyoḥ sthānam tathā eva ca
translated: the abode of Dhatri and Vidhatri, and the abode of Vayu.

original: tataḥ śiṣyaiḥ parivṛto munir apy abhiniṣpatat /
analyzed: tatas śiṣyaiḥ parivṛtaḥ muniḥ api abhiniṣpatat
translated: Then the sage, surrounded by his disciples, came out.

original: taṃ dadarśāgrato rāmo munīnāṃ dīptatejasam /
analyzed: tam dadarśa agratas rāmaḥ munīnām dīpta tejasam
translated: Rama saw him in front, the sage of blazing splendor, among the sages.

original: abravīd vacanaṃ vīro lakṣmaṇaṃ lakṣmivardhanam // / / //
analyzed: abravīt vacanam vīraḥ lakṣmaṇam lakṣmi vardhanam
translated: spoke these words to the heroic Lakshmana, the enhancer of prosperity:

original: eṣa lakṣmaṇa niṣkrāmaty agastyo bhagavān ṛṣiḥ /
analyzed: eṣa lakṣmaṇa niṣkrāmati agastyaḥ bhagavān ṛṣiḥ
translated: O Lakshmana, this is the illustrious sage Agastya coming out.

original: audāryeṇāvagacchāmi nidhānaṃ tapasām imam // / / //🔽evam uktvā mahābāhur agastyaṃ sūryavarcasam /
analyzed: audāryeṇa avagacchāmi nidhānam tapasām imam  evam uktvā mahā bāhuḥ agastyam sūrya varcasam
translated: By his magnanimity, I understand him to be a treasure of austerities.🔽Having said this, the mighty-armed one, the scorcher of enemies,

original: jagrāha paramaprītas tasya pādau paraṃtapaḥ // / / //
analyzed: jagrāha parama prītaḥ tasya pādau paraṃtapaḥ
translated: with great delight grasped the feet of Agastya, who had the radiance of the sun.

original: abhivādya tu dharmātmā tasthau rāmaḥ kṛtāñjaliḥ /
analyzed: abhivādya tu dharma ātmā tasthau rāmaḥ kṛta añjaliḥ
translated: Having paid homage, the righteous Rama stood with folded hands,

original: sītayā saha vaidehyā tadā rāmaḥ salakṣmaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sītayā saha vaidehyā tadā rāmaḥ sa lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Rama, along with Sita of Videha and Lakshmana,

original: pratigṛhya ca kākutstham arcayitvāsanodakaiḥ /
analyzed: pratigṛhya ca kākutstham arcayitvā āsana udakaiḥ
translated: having accepted Kakutstha and honored him with a seat and water,

original: kuśalapraśnam uktvā ca āsyatām iti so 'bravīt // / / //
analyzed: kuśalapraśnam uktvā ca āsyatām iti saḥ bravīt
translated: and having asked about his welfare, he said, Please be seated.

original: agniṃ hutvā pradāyārghyam atithiṃ pratipūjya ca /
analyzed: agnim hutvā pradāya arghyam atithim pratipūjya ca
translated: Having offered oblations into the fire, having given the guest a welcome offering,

original: vānaprasthena dharmeṇa sa teṣāṃ bhojanaṃ dadau // / / //
analyzed: vānaprasthena dharmeṇa sa teṣām bhojanam dadau
translated: he gave them food according to the dharma of a forest-dweller.

original: prathamaṃ copaviśyātha dharmajño munipuṃgavaḥ /
analyzed: prathamam ca upaviśya atha dharma jñaḥ muni puṃgavaḥ
translated: And the foremost of sages, who knew dharma, having sat down first,

original: uvāca rāmam āsīnaṃ prāñjaliṃ dharmakovidam // / / //
analyzed: uvāca rāmam āsīnam prāñjalim dharma kovidam
translated: spoke to Rama, who was seated with folded hands and knowledgeable in dharma:

original: anyathā khalu kākutstha tapasvī samudācaran /
analyzed: anyathā khalu kākutstha tapasvī samudācaran
translated: O Kakutstha, a sage who behaves in a different way,

original: duḥsākṣīva pare loke svāni māṃsāni bhakṣayet // / / //
analyzed: duḥsākṣī iva pare loke svāni māṃsāni bhakṣayet
translated: In the other world, he would have to eat his own flesh, like a bad witness.

original: rājā sarvasya lokasya dharmacārī mahārathaḥ /
analyzed: rājā sarvasya lokasya dharma cārī mahā rathaḥ
translated: The king, following dharma, is a great chariot for all the people.

original: pūjanīyaś ca mānyaś ca bhavān prāptaḥ priyātithiḥ // / / //🔽evam uktvā phalair mūlaiḥ puṣpaiś cānyaiś ca rāghavam /
analyzed: pūjanīyaḥ ca mānyaḥ ca bhavān prāptaḥ priya atithiḥ  evam uktvā phalaiḥ mūlaiḥ puṣpaiḥ ca anyaiḥ ca rāghavam
translated: You are worthy of worship and respect, having arrived as a dear guest.

original: pūjayitvā yathākāmaṃ punar eva tato 'bravīt // / / //
analyzed: pūjayitvā yathākāmam punar eva tatas bravīt
translated: Having thus spoken and worshipped Raghava with fruits, roots, flowers and other things, as he desired, he again spoke.

original: idaṃ divyaṃ mahac cāpaṃ hemavajravibhūṣitam /
analyzed: idam divyam mahat cāpam hema vajra vibhūṣitam
translated: This great divine bow, adorned with gold and diamonds,

original: vaiṣṇavaṃ puruṣavyāghra nirmitaṃ viśvakarmaṇā // / / //
analyzed: vaiṣṇavam puruṣa vyāghra nirmitam viśvakarmaṇā
translated: is Vishnu's, O tiger among men, created by Vishvakarma.

original: amoghaḥ sūryasaṃkāśo brahmadattaḥ śarottamaḥ /
analyzed: amoghaḥ sūrya saṃkāśaḥ brahma dattaḥ śara uttamaḥ
translated: The infallible best arrow, resembling the sun, given by Brahma,

original: datto mama mahendreṇa tūṇī cākṣayasāyakau // / / //
analyzed: dattaḥ mama mahā indreṇa tūṇī ca akṣaya sāyakau
translated: and the two quivers with inexhaustible arrows were given to me by the great Indra.

original: sampūrṇau niśitair bāṇair jvaladbhir iva pāvakaiḥ /
analyzed: sampūrṇau niśitaiḥ bāṇaiḥ jvaladbhiḥ iva pāvakaiḥ
translated: They are filled with sharp arrows, like blazing fires.

original: mahārajatakośo 'yam asir hemavibhūṣitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mahārajata kośaḥ yam asiḥ hema vibhūṣitaḥ
translated: This sword, in a great silver scabbard, is adorned with gold.

original: anena dhanuṣā rāma hatvā saṃkhye mahāsurān /
analyzed: anena dhanuṣā rāma hatvā saṃkhye mahā asurān
translated: With this bow, Rama, having killed the great demons in battle,

original: ājahāra śriyaṃ dīptāṃ purā viṣṇur divaukasām // / / //
analyzed: ājahāra śriyam dīptām purā viṣṇuḥ divaukasām
translated: Vishnu in ancient times obtained the blazing glory of the dwellers of heaven.

original: tad dhanus tau ca tūṇīrau śaraṃ khaḍgaṃ ca mānada /
analyzed: tat dhanuḥ tau ca tūṇīrau śaram khaḍgam ca mānada
translated: That bow, those two quivers, the arrow and the sword, O giver of honor,

original: jayāya pratigṛhṇīṣva vajraṃ vajradharo yathā // / / //
analyzed: jayāya pratigṛhṇīṣva vajram vajradharaḥ yathā
translated: Accept this thunderbolt for the sake of victory, just as the wielder of the thunderbolt (Indra) does.

original: evam uktvā mahātejāḥ samastaṃ tad varāyudham /
analyzed: evam uktvā mahā tejāḥ samastam tat vara āyudham
translated: Having said this, the greatly radiant one,

original: dattvā rāmāya bhagavān agastyaḥ punar abravīt // / / //
analyzed: dattvā rāmāya bhagavān agastyaḥ punar abravīt
translated: having given all those excellent weapons to Rama, the illustrious Agastya spoke again:

original: rāma prīto 'smi bhadraṃ te parituṣṭo 'smi lakṣmaṇa /
analyzed: rāma prītaḥ smi bhadram te parituṣṭaḥ smi lakṣmaṇa
translated: Rama, I am pleased with you, good be to you. I am satisfied, O Lakshmana.

original: abhivādayituṃ yan māṃ prāptau sthaḥ saha sītayā // / / //
analyzed: abhivādayitum yat mām prāptau sthaḥ saha sītayā
translated: That you have come to me with Sita to pay homage,

original: adhvaśrameṇa vāṃ khedo bādhate pracuraśramaḥ /
analyzed: adhva śrameṇa vām khedaḥ bādhate pracura śramaḥ
translated: your fatigue from the journey must be causing you great exhaustion.

original: vyaktam utkaṇṭhate cāpi maithilī janakātmajā // / / //
analyzed: vyaktam utkaṇṭhate ca api maithilī janakātmajā
translated: It is clear that Maithili, the daughter of Janaka, is also anxious.

original: eṣā hi sukumārī ca duḥkhaiś ca na vimānitā /
analyzed: eṣā hi sukumārī ca duḥkhaiḥ ca na vimānitā
translated: For she is delicate and has not been afflicted by sorrows,

original: prājyadoṣaṃ vanaṃ prāptā bhartṛsnehapracoditā // / / //
analyzed: prājya doṣam vanam prāptā bhartṛ sneha pracoditā
translated: and yet, impelled by love for her husband, she has come to the forest full of hardships.

original: yathaiṣā ramate rāma iha sītā tathā kuru /
analyzed: yathā eṣā ramate rāmaḥ iha sītā tathā kuru
translated: Do that by which Sita will find delight in this place, O Rama.

original: duṣkaraṃ kṛtavaty eṣā vane tvām anugacchatī // / / //
analyzed: duṣkaram kṛtavatī eṣā vane tvām anugacchatī
translated: She has done a difficult task in following you to the forest.

original: eṣā hi prakṛtiḥ strīṇām āsṛṣṭe raghunandana /
analyzed: eṣā hi prakṛtiḥ strīṇām āsṛṣṭe raghunandana
translated: For this is the nature of women, O descendant of Raghu, from the beginning of creation:

original: samastham anurajyante viṣamasthaṃ tyajanti ca // / / //
analyzed: sama stham anurajyante viṣama stham tyajanti ca
translated: They are attracted to one who is well-off and abandon one who is in distress.

original: śatahradānāṃ lolatvaṃ śastrāṇāṃ tīkṣṇatāṃ tathā /
analyzed: śatahradānām lola tvam śastrāṇām tīkṣṇa tām tathā
translated: The fickleness of lightning and the sharpness of weapons are natural to them,

original: garuḍānilayoḥ śaighryam anugacchanti yoṣitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: garuḍa anilayoḥ śaighryam anugacchanti yoṣitaḥ
translated: Women follow the speed of Garuda and the wind.

original: iyaṃ tu bhavato bhāryā doṣair etair vivarjitā /
analyzed: iyam tu bhavataḥ bhāryā doṣaiḥ etaiḥ vivarjitā
translated: But this wife of yours is free from these faults,

original: ślāghyā ca vyapadeśyā ca yathā devī hy arundhatī // / / //🔽alaṃkṛto 'yaṃ deśaś ca yatra saumitriṇā saha /
analyzed: ślāghyā ca vyapadeśyā ca yathā devī hi arundhatī  alaṃkṛtaḥ yam deśaḥ ca yatra saumitriṇā saha
translated: And is praiseworthy and worthy of renown, like the goddess Arundhati.🔽O Rama, this place where you will live with Saumitri and Vaidehi,

original: vaidehyā cānayā rāma vatsyasi tvam ariṃdama // / / //🔽evam uktas tu muninā rāghavaḥ saṃyatāñjaliḥ /
analyzed: vaidehyā ca anayā rāma vatsyasi tvam ariṃdama  evam uktaḥ tu muninā rāghavaḥ saṃyata añjaliḥ
translated: Is adorned, O chastiser of enemies.🔽Thus addressed by the sage, Raghava, with folded hands,

original: uvāca praśritaṃ vākyam ṛṣiṃ dīptam ivānalam // / / //🔽dhanyo 'smy anugṛhīto 'smi yasya me munipuṃgavaḥ /
analyzed: uvāca praśritam vākyam ṛṣim dīptam iva analam  dhanyaḥ smi anugṛhītaḥ smi yasya me muni puṃgavaḥ
translated: Spoke these humble words to the sage, who was blazing like fire.🔽I am blessed, I am favored, that the best of sages,

original: guṇaiḥ sabhrātṛbhāryasya varadaḥ parituṣyati // / / //
analyzed: guṇaiḥ sa bhrātṛ bhāryasya vara daḥ parituṣyati
translated: The bestower of boons, is satisfied with me, my brother and wife, who possess virtues.

original: kiṃ tu vyādiśa me deśaṃ sodakaṃ bahukānanam /
analyzed: kim tu vyādiśa me deśam sa udakam bahu kānanam
translated: But tell me about a place with water and many forests,

original: yatrāśramapadaṃ kṛtvā vaseyaṃ nirataḥ sukham // / / //
analyzed: yatra āśrama padam kṛtvā vaseyam nirataḥ sukham
translated: Where, having made a hermitage, I can live happily and devotedly.

original: tato 'bravīn muniśreṣṭhaḥ śrutvā rāmasya bhāṣitam /
analyzed: tatas bravīt muni śreṣṭhaḥ śrutvā rāmasya bhāṣitam
translated: Then the best of sages, having heard Rama's words,

original: dhyātvā muhūrtaṃ dharmātmā dhīro dhīrataraṃ vacaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dhyātvā muhūrtam dharma ātmā dhīraḥ dhīrataram vacaḥ
translated: Meditated for a moment, and the righteous one, with a steady mind, spoke these words, even steadier:

original: ito dviyojane tāta bahumūlaphalodakaḥ /
analyzed: itas dvi yojane tāta bahu mūla phala udakaḥ
translated: Here, my son, two yojanas from here, there is a place with plenty of roots, fruits and water,🔽Here, my son, two yojanas from here, there is a place with plenty of roots, fruits and water,

original: deśo bahumṛgaḥ śrīmān pañcavaṭy abhiviśrutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: deśaḥ bahu mṛgaḥ śrīmān pañcavaṭī abhiviśrutaḥ
translated: The country is full of deer, prosperous, and well-known as Panchavati.

original: tatra gatvāśramapadaṃ kṛtvā saumitriṇā saha /
analyzed: tatra gatvā āśrama padam kṛtvā saumitriṇā saha
translated: Having gone there, make an hermitage along with Sumitra's son.

original: ramasva tvaṃ pitur vākyaṃ yathoktam anupālayan // / / //
analyzed: ramasva tvam pituḥ vākyam yathā uktam anupālayan
translated: Enjoy yourself, following the words of your father as spoken.

original: vidito hy eṣa vṛttānto mama sarvas tavānagha /
analyzed: viditaḥ hi eṣa vṛttāntaḥ mama sarvaḥ tava anagha
translated: O sinless one, I know all this account of yours.

original: tapasaś ca prabhāvena snehād daśarathasya ca // / / //
analyzed: tapasaḥ ca prabhāvena snehāt daśarathasya ca
translated: And by the power of penance and out of affection for Dasharatha,

original: hṛdayasthaś ca te chando vijñātas tapasā mayā /
analyzed: hṛdaya sthaḥ ca te chandaḥ vijñātaḥ tapasā mayā
translated: I have understood your desire residing in your heart.

original: iha vāsaṃ pratijñāya mayā saha tapovane // / / //
analyzed: iha vāsam pratijñāya mayā saha tapaḥ vane
translated: Having promised to stay here with me in the penance grove,

original: ataś ca tvām ahaṃ brūmi gaccha pañcavaṭīm iti /
analyzed: atas ca tvām aham brūmi gaccha pañcavaṭīm iti
translated: Therefore, I tell you, go to Panchavati.

original: sa hi ramyo vanoddeśo maithilī tatra raṃsyate // / / //
analyzed: sa hi ramyaḥ vana uddeśaḥ maithilī tatra raṃsyate
translated: That is a delightful forest region, where Maithili will enjoy herself.

original: sa deśaḥ ślāghanīyaś ca nātidūre ca rāghava /
analyzed: sa deśaḥ ślāghanīyaḥ ca na atidūre ca rāghava
translated: That place is praiseworthy and not too far, O Raghava.

original: godāvaryāḥ samīpe ca maithilī tatra raṃsyate // / / //
analyzed: godāvaryāḥ samīpe ca maithilī tatra raṃsyate
translated: Near the Godavari, Maithili will enjoy herself there.

original: prājyamūlaphalaiś caiva nānādvijagaṇair yutaḥ /
analyzed: prājya mūla phalaiḥ ca eva nānā dvija gaṇaiḥ yutaḥ
translated: Abounding in plenty of roots and fruits, and inhabited by various flocks of birds,

original: viviktaś ca mahābāho puṇyo ramyas tathaiva ca // / / //
analyzed: viviktaḥ ca mahā bāho puṇyaḥ ramyaḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Secluded, O mighty-armed one, and also sacred and delightful.

original: bhavān api sadāraś ca śaktaś ca parirakṣaṇe /
analyzed: bhavān api sa dāraḥ ca śaktaḥ ca parirakṣaṇe
translated: You too, with your wife, are capable of protecting.

original: api cātra vasan rāmas tāpasān pālayiṣyasi // / / //
analyzed: api ca atra vasan rāmaḥ tāpasān pālayiṣyasi
translated: And living here, you will protect the ascetics.

original: etad ālakṣyate vīra madhūkānāṃ mahad vanam /🔽uttareṇāsya gantavyaṃ nyagrodham abhigacchatā // / / //
analyzed: etat ālakṣyate vīra madhūkānām mahat vanam  uttareṇa asya gantavyam nyagrodham abhigacchatā
translated: O hero, this great forest of Madhuka trees is seen.🔽Going north of this, one should go to the banyan tree.

original: tataḥ sthalam upāruhya parvatasyāvidūrataḥ /
analyzed: tatas sthalam upāruhya parvatasya avidūrataḥ
translated: Then, having climbed the land not far from the mountain,

original: khyātaḥ pañcavaṭīty eva nityapuṣpitakānanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: khyātaḥ pañcavaṭī iti eva nitya puṣpita kānanaḥ
translated: known as Panchavati, with a forest always in bloom.

original: agastyenaivam uktas tu rāmaḥ saumitriṇā saha /
analyzed: agastyena evam uktaḥ tu rāmaḥ saumitriṇā saha
translated: Thus addressed by Agastya, Rama, along with Lakshmana,

original: satkṛtyāmantrayāmāsa tam ṛṣiṃ satyavādinam // / / //🔽tau tu tenābhyanujñātau kṛtapādābhivandanau /
analyzed: satkṛtya āmantrayāmāsa tam ṛṣim satya vādinam  tau tu tena abhyanujñātau kṛta pāda abhivandanau
translated: having honored and taken leave of the truthful sage,🔽having been permitted by him and having bowed at his feet,

original: tadāśramāt pañcavaṭīṃ jagmatuḥ saha sītayā // / / //
analyzed: tad āśramāt pañcavaṭīm jagmatuḥ saha sītayā
translated: left the hermitage for Panchavati with Sita.

original: gṛhītacāpau tu narādhipātmajau viṣaktatūṇī samareṣv akātarau /
analyzed: gṛhīta cāpau tu narādhipa ātmajau viṣakta tūṇī samareṣu akātarau
translated: The princes, the sons of the king, with bows in hand, quivers strapped on, fearless in battle,

original: yathopadiṣṭena pathā maharṣiṇā prajagmatuḥ pañcavaṭīṃ samāhitau // / / //
analyzed: yathā upadiṣṭena pathā mahā ṛṣiṇā prajagmatuḥ pañcavaṭīm samāhitau
translated: proceeded with concentration to Panchavati, along the path instructed by the great sage.

original: atha pañcavaṭīṃ gacchann antarā raghunandanaḥ /
analyzed: atha pañcavaṭīm gacchan antarā raghunandanaḥ
translated: Then, while going to Panchavati, the descendant of Raghu,

original: āsasāda mahākāyaṃ gṛdhraṃ bhīmaparākramam // / / //
analyzed: āsasāda mahā kāyam gṛdhram bhīma parākramam
translated: encountered a vulture of great body and terrible prowess.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā tau mahābhāgau vanasthaṃ rāmalakṣmaṇau /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā tau mahābhāgau vana stham rāma lakṣmaṇau
translated: Seeing him in the forest, the two illustrious ones, Rama and Lakshmana,

original: menāte rākṣasaṃ pakṣiṃ bruvāṇau ko bhavān iti // / / //
analyzed: menāte rākṣasam pakṣim bruvāṇau kaḥ bhavān iti
translated: Recognized him as a rakshasa bird and asked, Who are you?

original: sa tau madhurayā vācā saumyayā prīṇayann iva /
analyzed: sa tau madhurayā vācā saumyayā prīṇayan iva
translated: He, with a sweet voice, as if pleasing them,

original: uvāca vatsa māṃ viddhi vayasyaṃ pitur ātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: uvāca vatsa mām viddhi vayasyam pituḥ ātmanaḥ
translated: Said, Consider me as a friend of your father, O child.

original: sa taṃ pitṛsakhaṃ buddhvā pūjayāmāsa rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: sa tam pitṛ sakham buddhvā pūjayāmāsa rāghavaḥ
translated: Raghava, knowing him to be a friend of his father, worshipped him,

original: sa tasya kulam avyagram atha papraccha nāma ca // / / //🔽rāmasya vacanaṃ śrutvā kulam ātmānam eva ca /
analyzed: sa tasya kulam avyagram atha papraccha nāma ca  rāmasya vacanam śrutvā kulam ātmānam eva ca
translated: And then asked about his lineage and name without any anxiety.🔽Hearing Rama's words, the brahmin

original: ācacakṣe dvijas tasmai sarvabhūtasamudbhavam // / / //
analyzed: ācacakṣe dvijaḥ tasmai sarva bhūta samudbhavam
translated: Told him his own lineage and that of all beings.

original: pūrvakāle mahābāho ye prajāpatayo 'bhavan /
analyzed: pūrva kāle mahā bāho ye prajāpatayaḥ bhavan
translated: In the past, O mighty-armed one, there were Prajapatis.

original: tān me nigadataḥ sarvān āditaḥ śṛṇu rāghava // / / //
analyzed: tān me nigadataḥ sarvān āditas śṛṇu rāghava
translated: Listen to me, O Raghava, as I tell you all of them in order.

original: kardamaḥ prathamas teṣāṃ vikṛtas tadanantaram /
analyzed: kardamaḥ prathamaḥ teṣām vikṛtaḥ tad anantaram
translated: Kardama was the first of them, then Vikrita,

original: śeṣaś ca saṃśrayaś caiva bahuputraś ca vīryavān // / / //
analyzed: śeṣaḥ ca saṃśrayaḥ ca eva bahuputraḥ ca vīryavān
translated: Shesha, Samshaya, and the powerful Bahuputra,

original: sthāṇur marīcir atriś ca kratuś caiva mahābalaḥ /
analyzed: sthāṇuḥ marīciḥ atriḥ ca kratuḥ ca eva mahā balaḥ
translated: Sthanu, Marichi, Atri, and the greatly powerful Kratu,

original: pulastyaś cāṅgirāś caiva pracetāḥ pulahas tathā // / / //
analyzed: pulastyaḥ ca aṅgirāḥ ca eva pracetāḥ pulahaḥ tathā
translated: Pulastya, Angiras, Pracheta, and Pulaha,

original: dakṣo vivasvān aparo 'riṣṭanemiś ca rāghava /
analyzed: dakṣaḥ vivasvān aparaḥ riṣṭanemiḥ ca rāghava
translated: Daksha, Vivasvat, the other one, Arishtanemi, O Raghava,

original: kaśyapaś ca mahātejās teṣām āsīc ca paścimaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kaśyapaḥ ca mahā tejāḥ teṣām āsīt ca paścimaḥ
translated: and the greatly radiant Kashyapa were the last of them.

original: prajāpates tu dakṣasya babhūvur iti naḥ śrutam /
analyzed: prajāpateḥ tu dakṣasya babhūvuḥ iti naḥ śrutam
translated: We have heard that Daksha, the lord of creatures,

original: ṣaṣṭir duhitaro rāma yaśasvinyo mahāyaśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ṣaṣṭiḥ duhitaraḥ rāma yaśasvinyaḥ mahā yaśaḥ
translated: had sixty daughters, O Rama, of great fame.

original: kaśyapaḥ pratijagrāha tāsām aṣṭau sumadhyamāḥ /
analyzed: kaśyapaḥ pratijagrāha tāsām aṣṭau sumadhyamāḥ
translated: Kashyapa accepted eight of those slender-waisted ones,

original: aditiṃ ca ditiṃ caiva danum api ca kālakām // / / //
analyzed: aditim ca ditim ca eva danum api ca kālakām
translated: Aditi, Diti, Danu, and also Kalaka,

original: tāmrāṃ krodhavaśāṃ caiva manuṃ cāpy analām api /
analyzed: tāmrām krodhavaśām ca eva manum ca api analām api
translated: Tamra, Krodhavasha, Manu, and also Anala.

original: tās tu kanyās tataḥ prītaḥ kaśyapaḥ punar abravīt // / / //
analyzed: tāḥ tu kanyāḥ tatas prītaḥ kaśyapaḥ punar abravīt
translated: Then Kashyapa, being pleased, again said to those maidens,

original: putrāṃs trailokyabhartṝn vai janayiṣyatha matsamān /
analyzed: putrān trailokya bhartṝn vai janayiṣyatha mad samān
translated: You will give birth to sons who are the lords of the three worlds, equal to me.

original: aditis tanmanā rāma ditiś ca danur eva ca // / / //
analyzed: aditiḥ tanmanāḥ rāma ditiḥ ca danuḥ eva ca
translated: O Rama, Aditi, Diti, and Danu alone,

original: kālakā ca mahābāho śeṣās tv amanaso 'bhavan /
analyzed: kālakā ca mahā bāho śeṣāḥ tu amanasaḥ bhavan
translated: O mighty-armed one, were intent on that, while the others were not.

original: adityāṃ jajñire devās trayastriṃśad ariṃdama // / / //
analyzed: adityām jajñire devāḥ trayastriṃśat ariṃdama
translated: From Aditi were born the thirty-three gods, O chastiser of enemies,

original: ādityā vasavo rudrā aśvinau ca paraṃtapa /
analyzed: ādityāḥ vasavaḥ rudrāḥ aśvinau ca paraṃtapa
translated: the Adityas, the Vasus, the Rudras, and the Ashvins, O scorcher of enemies.

original: ditis tv ajanayat putrān daityāṃs tāta yaśasvinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ditiḥ tu ajanayat putrān daityān tāta yaśasvinaḥ
translated: And Diti, O son, gave birth to illustrious sons, the Daityas,

original: teṣām iyaṃ vasumatī purāsīt savanārṇavā /
analyzed: teṣām iyam vasumatī purā āsīt sa vana arṇavā
translated: In the days of yore, this earth with her forests and oceans, belonged to them.

original: danus tv ajanayat putram aśvagrīvam ariṃdama // / / //🔽narakaṃ kālakaṃ caiva kālakāpi vyajāyata /
analyzed: danuḥ tu ajanayat putram aśvagrīvam ariṃdama  narakam kālakam ca eva kālakā api vyajāyata
translated: Danu gave birth to a son named Ashvagriva, O chastiser of foes.🔽And Kalaka.

original: krauñcīṃ bhāsīṃ tathā śyenīṃ dhṛtarāṣṭrīṃ tathā śukīm // / / //
analyzed: krauñcīm bhāsīm tathā śyenīm dhṛtarāṣṭrīm tathā śukīm
translated: Krounchi, Bhasi, Syeini, Dhritarashtri and Suki.

original: tāmrāpi suṣuve kanyāḥ pañcaitā lokaviśrutāḥ /🔽ulūkāñ janayat krauñcī bhāsī bhāsān vyajāyata // / / //
analyzed: tāmrā api suṣuve kanyāḥ pañca etāḥ loka viśrutāḥ  ulūkām janayat krauñcī bhāsī bhāsān vyajāyata
translated: Tamra gave birth to five daughters, all famous in the world.🔽Krounchi gave birth to owls, Bhasi gave birth to glow-worms,

original: śyenī śyenāṃś ca gṛdhrāṃś ca vyajāyata sutejasaḥ /🔽dhṛtarāṣṭrī tu haṃsāṃś ca kalahaṃsāṃś ca sarvaśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śyenī śyenān ca gṛdhrān ca vyajāyata su tejasaḥ  dhṛtarāṣṭrī tu haṃsān ca kalahaṃsān ca sarvaśas
translated: Syeini gave birth to hawks and vultures of great splendour.🔽Dhritarashtri gave birth to swans and Brahmani ducks of every kind.

original: cakravākāṃś ca bhadraṃ te vijajñe sāpi bhāminī /
analyzed: cakravākān ca bhadram te vijajñe sā api bhāminī
translated: And also to ruddy geese, O blessed one. That beautiful lady gave birth to them all.

original: śukī natāṃ vijajñe tu natāyā vinatā sutā // / / //
analyzed: śukī natām vijajñe tu natāyāḥ vinatā sutā
translated: Suki gave birth to Nata, and Nata gave birth to Vinata.

original: daśa krodhavaśā rāma vijajñe 'py ātmasambhavāḥ /
analyzed: daśa krodha vaśāḥ rāma vijajñe pi ātma sambhavāḥ
translated: O Rama, Krodhavasha gave birth to ten daughters of her own.

original: mṛgīṃ ca mṛgamandāṃ ca harīṃ bhadramadām api // / / //
analyzed: mṛgīm ca mṛgamandām ca harīm bhadramadām api
translated: Mrigi, Mrigamanda, Hari, Bhadramada,

original: mātaṃgīm atha śārdūlīṃ śvetāṃ ca surabhīṃ tathā /
analyzed: mātaṃgīm atha śārdūlīm śvetām ca surabhīm tathā
translated: Matangi, Sharaduli, Shveta, Surabhi,

original: sarvalakṣaṇasampannāṃ surasāṃ kadrukām api // / / //
analyzed: sarva lakṣaṇa sampannām surasām kadrukām api
translated: And also Kadru, all endowed with every auspicious mark.

original: apatyaṃ tu mṛgāḥ sarve mṛgyā naravarottama /
analyzed: apatyam tu mṛgāḥ sarve mṛgyāḥ nara vara uttama
translated: O best of men, all the deer were the offspring of Mriga,

original: ṛkṣāś ca mṛgamandāyāḥ sṛmarāś camarās tathā // / / //
analyzed: ṛkṣāḥ ca mṛgamandāyāḥ sṛmarāḥ camarāḥ tathā
translated: and the bears, the Srimara and the Chamara were the offspring of Mrigamanda.

original: tatas tv irāvatīṃ nāma jajñe bhadramadā sutām /
analyzed: tatas tu irāvatīm nāma jajñe bhadramadā sutām
translated: Then Bhadramada gave birth to a daughter named Iravati.

original: tasyās tv airāvataḥ putro lokanātho mahāgajaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasyāḥ tu airāvataḥ putraḥ loka nāthaḥ mahāgajaḥ
translated: And Airavata, the great elephant, the lord of the world, was her son.

original: haryāś ca harayo 'patyaṃ vānarāś ca tapasvinaḥ /
analyzed: haryāḥ ca harayaḥ patyam vānarāḥ ca tapasvinaḥ
translated: The offspring of Harya were the monkeys and the ascetic apes,

original: golāṅgūlāṃś ca śārdūlī vyāghrāṃś cājanayat sutān // / / //
analyzed: golāṅgūlān ca śārdūlī vyāghrān ca ajanayat sutān
translated: and Sharduli gave birth to the sons, the Golangulas and the tigers.

original: mātaṃgyās tv atha mātaṃgā apatyaṃ manujarṣabha /
analyzed: mātaṃgyāḥ tu atha mātaṃgāḥ apatyam manuja ṛṣabha
translated: O best of men, the offspring of Matangi were the elephants,

original: diśāgajaṃ tu śvetākṣaṃ śvetā vyajanayat sutam // / / //
analyzed: diśāgajam tu śvetākṣam śvetā vyajanayat sutam
translated: and Shveta gave birth to the son, the elephant of the quarters, Shvetakacha.

original: tato duhitarau rāma surabhir devy ajāyata /🔽rohiṇīṃ nāma bhadraṃ te gandharvīṃ ca yaśasvinīm // / / //
analyzed: tatas duhitarau rāma surabhiḥ devī ajāyata  rohiṇīm nāma bhadram te gandharvīm ca yaśasvinīm
translated: Then, O Rama, the divine Surabhi gave birth to two daughters,🔽Rohini and the famous Gandharvi. May you fare well.

original: rohiṇy ajanayad gā vai gandharvī vājinaḥ sutān /
analyzed: rohiṇī ajanayat gāḥ vai gandharvī vājinaḥ sutān
translated: Rohini gave birth to the cows, and Gandharvi gave birth to the sons, the horses.

original: surasājanayan nāgān rāma kadrūś ca pannagān // / / //
analyzed: surasā janayat nāgān rāma kadrūḥ ca pannagān
translated: O Rama, Surasa gave birth to the Nagas, and Kadru to the Pannagas.

original: manur manuṣyāñ janayat kaśyapasya mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: manuḥ manuṣyām janayat kaśyapasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: Manu gave birth to men, the offspring of the great-souled Kashyapa.

original: brāhmaṇān kṣatriyān vaiśyāñ śūdrāṃś ca manujarṣabha // / / //
analyzed: brāhmaṇān kṣatriyān vaiśyām śūdrān ca manuja ṛṣabha
translated: Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras, O best of men.

original: mukhato brāhmaṇā jātā urasaḥ kṣatriyās tathā /
analyzed: mukhataḥ brāhmaṇāḥ jātāḥ urasaḥ kṣatriyāḥ tathā
translated: Brahmins were born from the mouth, Kshatriyas from the chest,

original: ūrubhyāṃ jajñire vaiśyāḥ padbhyāṃ śūdrā iti śrutiḥ // / / //
analyzed: ūrubhyām jajñire vaiśyāḥ padbhyām śūdrāḥ iti śrutiḥ
translated: Vaishyas from the thighs, and Shudras from the feet, this is the ancient tradition.

original: sarvān puṇyaphalān vṛkṣān analāpi vyajāyata /
analyzed: sarvān puṇya phalān vṛkṣān analā api vyajāyata
translated: Anala also gave birth to all the sacred fruit trees.

original: vinatā ca śukī pautrī kadrūś ca surasā svasā // / / //
analyzed: vinatā ca śukī pautrī kadrūḥ ca surasā svasā
translated: Vinata, Shuki, and Kadru were her granddaughters, and Surasa was her sister.

original: kadrūr nāgaṃ sahasraṃ tu vijajñe dharaṇīdharam /
analyzed: kadrūḥ nāgam sahasram tu vijajñe dharaṇīdharam
translated: Kadru gave birth to a thousand serpents, the supporters of the earth.

original: dvau putrau vinatāyās tu garuḍo 'ruṇa eva ca // / / //
analyzed: dvau putrau vinatāyāḥ tu garuḍaḥ ruṇaḥ eva ca
translated: Vinata had two sons: Garuda and Aruna.

original: tasmāj jāto 'ham aruṇāt sampātiś ca mamāgrajaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt jātaḥ ham aruṇāt sampātiḥ ca mama agrajaḥ
translated: I was born from Aruna, and Sampati was my elder brother.

original: jaṭāyur iti māṃ viddhi śyenīputram ariṃdama // / / //
analyzed: jaṭāyuḥ iti mām viddhi śyenī putram ariṃdama
translated: Know me as Jatayu, the son of Shyeni, O conqueror of enemies.

original: so 'haṃ vāsasahāyas te bhaviṣyāmi yadīcchasi /
analyzed: saḥ ham vāsa sahāyaḥ te bhaviṣyāmi yadi icchasi
translated: If you wish, I will be your companion in the forest.

original: sītāṃ ca tāta rakṣiṣye tvayi yāte salakṣmaṇe // / / //
analyzed: sītām ca tāta rakṣiṣye tvayi yāte sa lakṣmaṇe
translated: And, father, I will protect Sita while you and Lakshmana are gone.

original: jaṭāyuṣaṃ tu pratipūjya rāghavo mudā pariṣvajya ca saṃnato 'bhavat /
analyzed: jaṭāyuṣam tu pratipūjya rāghavaḥ mudā pariṣvajya ca saṃnataḥ bhavat
translated: Having honored Jatayu, Raghava joyfully embraced him and bowed down.

original: pitur hi śuśrāva sakhitvam ātmavāñ jaṭāyuṣā saṃkathitaṃ punaḥ punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pituḥ hi śuśrāva sakhi tvam ātmavān jaṭāyuṣā saṃkathitam punar punar
translated: For the self-controlled one had heard from Jatayu again and again the friendship of his father.

original: sa tatra sītāṃ paridāya maithilīṃ sahaiva tenātibalena pakṣiṇā /
analyzed: sa tatra sītām paridāya maithilīm saha eva tena atibalena pakṣiṇā
translated: Having entrusted Sita, the princess of Mithila, to that extremely powerful bird,

original: jagāma tāṃ pañcavaṭīṃ salakṣmaṇo ripūn didhakṣañ śalabhān ivānalaḥ // / / //
analyzed: jagāma tām pañcavaṭīm sa lakṣmaṇaḥ ripūn didhakṣam śalabhān iva analaḥ
translated: he went to Panchavati along with Lakshmana, like a fire consuming moths, ready to consume his enemies.

original: tataḥ pañcavaṭīṃ gatvā nānāvyālamṛgāyutām /
analyzed: tatas pañcavaṭīm gatvā nānā vyāla mṛga āyutām
translated: Then, having gone to Panchavati, filled with many wild animals and beasts,

original: uvāca bhrātaraṃ rāmo lakṣmaṇaṃ dīptatejasam // / / //
analyzed: uvāca bhrātaram rāmaḥ lakṣmaṇam dīpta tejasam
translated: Rama spoke to his brother Lakshmana, of blazing splendor:

original: āgatāḥ sma yathoddiṣṭam amuṃ deśaṃ maharṣiṇā /
analyzed: āgatāḥ sma yathā uddiṣṭam amum deśam mahā ṛṣiṇā
translated: We have come to this place as indicated by the great sage.

original: ayaṃ pañcavaṭīdeśaḥ saumya puṣpitakānanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ayam pañcavaṭī deśaḥ saumya puṣpita kānanaḥ
translated: O gentle one, this is the land of Panchavati, with blossoming forests.

original: sarvataś cāryatāṃ dṛṣṭiḥ kānane nipuṇo hy asi /
analyzed: sarvatas cāryatām dṛṣṭiḥ kānane nipuṇaḥ hi asi
translated: Look all around, for you are skilled in the forest.

original: āśramaḥ katarasmin no deśe bhavati saṃmataḥ // / / //
analyzed: āśramaḥ katarasmin naḥ deśe bhavati saṃmataḥ
translated: In which place do you think would be a suitable hermitage for us?

original: ramate yatra vaidehī tvam ahaṃ caiva lakṣmaṇa /
analyzed: ramate yatra vaidehī tvam aham ca eva lakṣmaṇa
translated: Where Vaidehi, you and I, Lakshmana, find pleasure,

original: tādṛśo dṛśyatāṃ deśaḥ saṃnikṛṣṭajalāśayaḥ // / / //🔽vanarāmaṇyakaṃ yatra jalarāmaṇyakaṃ tathā /
analyzed: tādṛśaḥ dṛśyatām deśaḥ saṃnikṛṣṭa jalāśayaḥ  vana rāmaṇyakam yatra jala rāmaṇyakam tathā
translated: look for such a place, not far from a water source.🔽Where there is beauty in the forest and beauty in the water,

original: saṃnikṛṣṭaṃ ca yatra syāt samitpuṣpakuśodakam // / / //
analyzed: saṃnikṛṣṭam ca yatra syāt samidh puṣpa kuśa udakam
translated: and where there is nearby fuel, flowers, kusha grass and water.

original: evam uktas tu rāmeṇa lakṣmaṇaḥ saṃyatāñjaliḥ /
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tu rāmeṇa lakṣmaṇaḥ saṃyata añjaliḥ
translated: Thus addressed by Rama, Lakshmana, with folded hands,

original: sītāsamakṣaṃ kākutstham idaṃ vacanam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: sītā samakṣam kākutstham idam vacanam abravīt
translated: in the presence of Sita, spoke these words to Kakutstha:

original: paravān asmi kākutstha tvayi varṣaśataṃ sthite /
analyzed: paravān asmi kākutstha tvayi varṣa śatam sthite
translated: I am dependent on you, O Kakutstha, even if you were to remain for a hundred years.

original: svayaṃ tu rucire deśe kriyatām iti māṃ vada // / / //
analyzed: svayam tu rucire deśe kriyatām iti mām vada
translated: Tell me, choose a delightful place yourself, where it should be done.

original: suprītas tena vākyena lakṣmaṇasya mahādyutiḥ /
analyzed: su prītaḥ tena vākyena lakṣmaṇasya mahā dyutiḥ
translated: Delighted by those words of Lakshmana, the greatly radiant one,

original: vimṛśan rocayāmāsa deśaṃ sarvaguṇānvitam // / / //🔽sa taṃ ruciram ākramya deśam āśramakarmaṇi /
analyzed: vimṛśan rocayāmāsa deśam sarva guṇa anvitam  sa tam ruciram ākramya deśam āśrama karmaṇi
translated: considering it, chose a place endowed with all good qualities.🔽Having occupied that delightful place for the hermitage work,

original: hastau gṛhītvā hastena rāmaḥ saumitrim abravīt // / / //
analyzed: hastau gṛhītvā hastena rāmaḥ saumitrim abravīt
translated: taking Soumitri's hand in his own hand, Rama said:

original: ayaṃ deśaḥ samaḥ śrīmān puṣpitais tarubhir vṛtaḥ /
analyzed: ayam deśaḥ samaḥ śrīmān puṣpitaiḥ tarubhiḥ vṛtaḥ
translated: This place is even, prosperous, surrounded by flowering trees.

original: ihāśramapadaṃ saumya yathāvat kartum arhasi // / / //🔽iyam ādityasaṃkāśaiḥ padmaiḥ surabhigandhibhiḥ /
analyzed: iha āśrama padam saumya yathāvat kartum arhasi  iyam āditya saṃkāśaiḥ padmaiḥ surabhi gandhibhiḥ
translated: Here, O gentle one, you should properly make the hermitage.

original: adūre dṛśyate ramyā padminī padmaśobhitā // / / //
analyzed: adūre dṛśyate ramyā padminī padma śobhitā
translated: This beautiful lotus pond, adorned with lotuses, is seen not far away, delightful with lotuses fragrant like the sun.

original: yathākhyātam agastyena muninā bhāvitātmanā /
analyzed: yathā ākhyātam agastyena muninā bhāvitātmanā
translated: As described by the sage Agastya of purified soul,

original: iyaṃ godāvarī ramyā puṣpitais tarubhir vṛtā // / / //
analyzed: iyam godāvarī ramyā puṣpitaiḥ tarubhiḥ vṛtā
translated: this Godavari is delightful, surrounded by flowering trees.

original: haṃsakāraṇḍavākīrṇā cakravākopaśobhitā /
analyzed: haṃsa kāraṇḍava ākīrṇā cakravāka upaśobhitā
translated: Filled with swans and karandavas, and adorned with chakravakas,

original: nātidūre na cāsanne mṛgayūthanipīḍitā // / / //🔽mayūranāditā ramyāḥ prāṃśavo bahukandarāḥ /
analyzed: na ati dūre na ca āsanne mṛga yūtha nipīḍitā  mayūra nāditāḥ ramyāḥ prāṃśavaḥ bahu kandarāḥ
translated: Not too far or too near, crowded with herds of deer,

original: dṛśyante girayaḥ saumya phullais tarubhir āvṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: dṛśyante girayaḥ saumya phullaiḥ tarubhiḥ āvṛtāḥ
translated: The mountains are seen, O gentle one, covered with flowering trees, resounding with the cries of peacocks, delightful, lofty, and having many caves.

original: sauvarṇe rājatais tāmrair deśe deśe ca dhātubhiḥ /
analyzed: sauvarṇe rājataiḥ tāmraiḥ deśe deśe ca dhātubhiḥ
translated: In various places, with golden, silver, and copper ores,

original: gavākṣitā ivābhānti gajāḥ paramabhaktibhiḥ // / / //🔽sālais tālais tamālaiś ca kharjūraiḥ panasāmrakaiḥ /
analyzed: gavākṣitāḥ iva ābhānti gajāḥ parama bhaktibhiḥ  sālaiḥ tālaiḥ tamālaiḥ ca kharjūraiḥ panasa āmrakaiḥ
translated: They appear as if pierced with windows, with the best ores of elephants.🔽Adorned with sal, tala, tamala, date, jackfruit, mango,

original: nīvārais timiśaiś caiva puṃnāgaiś copaśobhitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: nīvāraiḥ timiśaiḥ ca eva puṃnāgaiḥ ca upaśobhitāḥ
translated: Nivaraka, timisha, and punnaga trees,

original: cūtair aśokais tilakaiś campakaiḥ ketakair api /
analyzed: cūtaiḥ aśokaiḥ tilakaiḥ campakaiḥ ketakaiḥ api
translated: With mango, ashoka, tilaka, champaka, and ketaki trees,

original: puṣpagulmalatopetais tais tais tarubhir āvṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: puṣpa gulma latā upetaiḥ taiḥ taiḥ tarubhiḥ āvṛtāḥ
translated: Covered with various flowering shrubs and creepers,

original: candanaiḥ syandanair nīpaiḥ panasair lakucair api /
analyzed: candanaiḥ syandanaiḥ nīpaiḥ panasaiḥ lakucaiḥ api
translated: With sandalwood, syandana, nipa, jackfruit, and lakucha trees,

original: dhavāśvakarṇakhadiraiḥ śamīkiṃśukapāṭalaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: dhava aśvakarṇa khadiraiḥ śamī kiṃśuka pāṭalaiḥ
translated: With dhava, ashvakarna, khadira, shami, kimshuka, and palasha trees,

original: idaṃ puṇyam idaṃ medhyam idaṃ bahumṛgadvijam /
analyzed: idam puṇyam idam medhyam idam bahu mṛga dvijam
translated: This is holy, this is pure, this is full of many deer and birds.

original: iha vatsyāma saumitre sārdham etena pakṣiṇā // / / //
analyzed: iha vatsyāma saumitre sārdham etena pakṣiṇā
translated: Here we will live, O son of Sumitra, with this bird.

original: evam uktas tu rāmeṇa lakṣmaṇaḥ paravīrahā /🔽acireṇāśramaṃ bhrātuś cakāra sumahābalaḥ // / / //
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tu rāmeṇa lakṣmaṇaḥ para vīra hā  acireṇa āśramam bhrātuḥ cakāra su mahā balaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by Rama, Lakshmana, the slayer of enemy heroes,🔽the immensely strong one, in no time, built a hermitage for his brother.

original: parṇaśālāṃ suvipulāṃ tatra saṃghātamṛttikām /
analyzed: parṇa śālām su vipulām tatra saṃghāta mṛttikām
translated: A large leaf-hut made of clay and mud,

original: sustambhāṃ maskarair dīrghaiḥ kṛtavaṃśāṃ suśobhanām // / / //
analyzed: su stambhām maskaraiḥ dīrghaiḥ kṛta vaṃśām su śobhanām
translated: with sturdy pillars, long bamboo rafters, and very beautiful.

original: sa gatvā lakṣmaṇaḥ śrīmān nadīṃ godāvarīṃ tadā /
analyzed: sa gatvā lakṣmaṇaḥ śrīmān nadīm godāvarīm tadā
translated: Then the prosperous Lakshmana went to the Godavari river,

original: snātvā padmāni cādāya saphalaḥ punar āgataḥ // / / //
analyzed: snātvā padmāni ca ādāya sa phalaḥ punar āgataḥ
translated: bathed, collected lotuses, and returned with fruit.

original: tataḥ puṣpabaliṃ kṛtvā śāntiṃ ca sa yathāvidhi /
analyzed: tatas puṣpa balim kṛtvā śāntim ca sa yathāvidhi
translated: Then, having offered a flower oblation and peace offerings according to the rules,

original: darśayāmāsa rāmāya tad āśramapadaṃ kṛtam // / / //
analyzed: darśayāmāsa rāmāya tat āśrama padam kṛtam
translated: he showed Rama the hermitage that was built.

original: sa taṃ dṛṣṭvā kṛtaṃ saumyam āśramaṃ saha sītayā /
analyzed: sa tam dṛṣṭvā kṛtam saumyam āśramam saha sītayā
translated: Seeing that pleasant hermitage built along with Sita,

original: rāghavaḥ parṇaśālāyāṃ harṣam āhārayat param // / / //
analyzed: rāghavaḥ parṇa śālāyām harṣam āhārayat param
translated: Raghava felt great joy in the leaf-hut.

original: susaṃhṛṣṭaḥ pariṣvajya bāhubhyāṃ lakṣmaṇaṃ tadā /
analyzed: su saṃhṛṣṭaḥ pariṣvajya bāhubhyām lakṣmaṇam tadā
translated: Extremely delighted, he embraced Lakshmana with his arms

original: atisnigdhaṃ ca gāḍhaṃ ca vacanaṃ cedam abravīt // / / //🔽prīto 'smi te mahat karma tvayā kṛtam idaṃ prabho /
analyzed: ati snigdham ca gāḍham ca vacanam ca idam abravīt  prītaḥ smi te mahat karma tvayā kṛtam idam prabho
translated: and spoke these very affectionate and heartfelt words:🔽I am pleased with you, O lord, for this great deed you have done.

original: pradeyo yannimittaṃ te pariṣvaṅgo mayā kṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pradeyaḥ yad nimittam te pariṣvaṅgaḥ mayā kṛtaḥ
translated: The embrace I have given you is in return for what you have done.

original: bhāvajñena kṛtajñena dharmajñena ca lakṣmaṇa /
analyzed: bhāva jñena kṛtajñena dharma jñena ca lakṣmaṇa
translated: O Lakshmana, you are conversant with the nature of things, you are grateful, and you are acquainted with the rules of morality.

original: tvayā putreṇa dharmātmā na saṃvṛttaḥ pitā mama // / / //
analyzed: tvayā putreṇa dharma ātmā na saṃvṛttaḥ pitā mama
translated: By having a son like you, O righteous one, my father has not been deprived of his object.

original: evaṃ lakṣmaṇam uktvā tu rāghavo lakṣmivardhanaḥ /
analyzed: evam lakṣmaṇam uktvā tu rāghavaḥ lakṣmi vardhanaḥ
translated: Having thus spoken to Lakshmana, Raghava, the enhancer of prosperity,

original: tasmin deśe bahuphale nyavasat sa sukhaṃ vaśī // / / //
analyzed: tasmin deśe bahu phale nyavasat sa sukham vaśī
translated: Dwelt happily in that place abounding in fruits, having his passions under control.

original: kaṃcit kālaṃ sa dharmātmā sītayā lakṣmaṇena ca /
analyzed: kaṃcid kālam sa dharma ātmā sītayā lakṣmaṇena ca
translated: For some time, that righteous one, attended by Sita and Lakshmana,

original: anvāsyamāno nyavasat svargaloke yathāmaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: anvāsyamānaḥ nyavasat svarga loke yathā amaraḥ
translated: Dwelt there, like a celestial in the celestial region.

original: asatas tasya tu sukhaṃ rāghavasya mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: asataḥ tasya tu sukham rāghavasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: But the happiness of that illustrious Raghava, who was without (Sita),

original: śaradvyapāye hemanta ṛtur iṣṭaḥ pravartate // / / //
analyzed: śarad vyapāye hemante ṛtuḥ iṣṭaḥ pravartate
translated: Passed away, and the delightful season of winter set in, after the autumn was over.

original: sa kadācit prabhātāyāṃ śarvaryāṃ raghunandanaḥ /
analyzed: sa kadācid prabhātāyām śarvaryām raghunandanaḥ
translated: One day, at dawn, the descendant of Raghu,

original: prayayāv abhiṣekārthaṃ ramyāṃ godāvarīṃ nadīm // / / //
analyzed: prayayau abhiṣeka artham ramyām godāvarīm nadīm
translated: Went to the beautiful Godavari river, for his ablutions.

original: prahvaḥ kalaśahastas taṃ sītayā saha vīryavān /
analyzed: prahvaḥ kalaśa hastaḥ tam sītayā saha vīryavān
translated: The valiant one, with Sita, his head bent low, with a water-pot in his hand,

original: pṛṣṭhato 'nuvrajan bhrātā saumitrir idam abravīt // / / //🔽ayaṃ sa kālaḥ samprāptaḥ priyo yas te priyaṃvada /🔽alaṃkṛta ivābhāti yena saṃvatsaraḥ śubhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pṛṣṭhatas nuvrajan bhrātā saumitriḥ idam abravīt 🔽ayam sa kālaḥ samprāptaḥ priyaḥ yaḥ te priyaṃvada 🔽alaṃkṛtaḥ iva ābhāti yena saṃvatsaraḥ śubhaḥ
translated: His brother, the son of Sumitra, following behind, said this:

original: nīhāraparuṣo lokaḥ pṛthivī sasyamālinī /
analyzed: nīhāra paruṣaḥ lokaḥ pṛthivī sasya mālinī
translated: The world is harsh with frost, the earth is adorned with crops,

original: jalāny anupabhogyāni subhago havyavāhanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: jalāni an upabhogyāni subhagaḥ havyavāhanaḥ
translated: The waters are unfit for enjoyment, the auspicious fire-bearer (sun) is...

original: navāgrayaṇapūjābhir abhyarcya pitṛdevatāḥ /
analyzed: nava āgrayaṇa pūjābhiḥ abhyarcya pitṛ devatāḥ
translated: Having worshipped the ancestral deities with the new-grain offerings,

original: kṛtāgrayaṇakāḥ kāle santo vigatakalmaṣāḥ // / / //
analyzed: kṛta āgrayaṇakāḥ kāle santaḥ vigata kalmaṣāḥ
translated: The virtuous ones, having performed the new-grain rites in due time, are free from sin...

original: prājyakāmā janapadāḥ sampannataragorasāḥ /
analyzed: prājya kāmāḥ janapadāḥ sampannatara gorasāḥ
translated: The countries are full of desires, the cow-products are more abundant,

original: vicaranti mahīpālā yātrārthaṃ vijigīṣavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vicaranti mahīpālāḥ yātrā artham vijigīṣavaḥ
translated: The kings roam for the sake of conquest, desiring victory...

original: sevamāne dṛḍhaṃ sūrye diśam antakasevitām /
analyzed: sevamāne dṛḍham sūrye diśam antaka sevitām
translated: When the sun is firmly serving the direction frequented by the god of death,

original: vihīnatilakeva strī nottarā dik prakāśate // / / //🔽prakṛtyā himakośāḍhyo dūrasūryaś ca sāmpratam /
analyzed: vihīna tilakā iva strī nā uttarā diś prakāśate  prakṛtyā hima kośa āḍhyaḥ dūra sūryaḥ ca sāmpratam
translated: The northern direction does not shine, as if bereft of its tilaka mark...🔽By nature, it is rich with snow-mountains, and now the sun is far away,

original: yathārthanāmā suvyaktaṃ himavān himavān giriḥ // / / //
analyzed: yathārtha nāmā su vyaktam himavān himavān giriḥ
translated: The Himalaya mountain is clearly named appropriately, as it is full of snow...

original: atyantasukhasaṃcārā madhyāhne sparśataḥ sukhāḥ /🔽divasāḥ subhagādityāś chāyāsaliladurbhagāḥ // / / //
analyzed: atyanta sukha saṃcārāḥ madhyāhne sparśataḥ sukhāḥ  divasāḥ subhaga ādityāḥ chāyā salila durbhagāḥ
translated: The days are very pleasant to move around in, pleasant to touch at midday,🔽With auspicious suns, but unfortunate with shade and water...

original: mṛdusūryāḥ sanīhārāḥ paṭuśītāḥ samārutāḥ /🔽śūnyāraṇyā himadhvastā divasā bhānti sāmpratam // / / //
analyzed: mṛdu sūryāḥ sa nīhārāḥ paṭu śītāḥ sa mārutāḥ  śūnya araṇyāḥ hima dhvastāḥ divasāḥ bhānti sāmpratam
translated: With mild suns, covered with frost, sharp and cold, with moderate winds,🔽The days now shine, empty of forests, afflicted by snow...

original: nivṛttākāśaśayanāḥ puṣyanītā himāruṇāḥ /
analyzed: nivṛtta ākāśa śayanāḥ puṣya nītāḥ hima aruṇāḥ
translated: Having turned away from sleeping in the sky, led by Pushya, reddened by snow,

original: śītā vṛddhatarāyāmās triyāmā yānti sāmpratam // / / //
analyzed: śītāḥ vṛddhatara āyāmāḥ triyāmāḥ yānti sāmpratam
translated: The three watches of the night, now that they have grown old, are passing slowly.

original: ravisaṃkrāntasaubhāgyas tuṣārāruṇamaṇḍalaḥ /🔽niḥśvāsāndha ivādarśaś candramā na prakāśate // / / //🔽jyotsnā tuṣāramalinā paurṇamāsyāṃ na rājate /
analyzed: ravi saṃkrānta saubhāgyaḥ tuṣāra aruṇa maṇḍalaḥ  niḥśvāsa andhaḥ iva ādarśaḥ candramāḥ na prakāśate  jyotsnā tuṣāra malinā paurṇamāsyām na rājate
translated: The moon, with its orb reddened by frost, has lost its good fortune with the sun's passage.🔽Like a mirror blinded by breath, the moon does not shine.🔽The moonlight, soiled by frost, does not shine on the full moon night.

original: sīteva cātapaśyāmā lakṣyate na tu śobhate // / / //🔽prakṛtyā śītalasparśo himaviddhaś ca sāmpratam /
analyzed: sītā iva ca ātapa śyāmā lakṣyate na tu śobhate  prakṛtyā śītala sparśaḥ hima viddhaḥ ca sāmpratam
translated: Like a pale Sita in the sun, it is seen but does not shine.🔽The western wind, naturally cool to the touch and now pierced by snow,

original: pravāti paścimo vāyuḥ kāle dviguṇaśītalaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pravāti paścimaḥ vāyuḥ kāle dviguṇa śītalaḥ
translated: blows twice as cold in this season.

original: bāṣpacchannānyaraṇyāni yavagodhūmavanti ca /
analyzed: bāṣpa channāni araṇyāni yava godhūmavanti ca
translated: The forests, covered with mist, and with barley and wheat,

original: śobhante 'bhyudite sūrye nadadbhiḥ krauñcasārasaiḥ // / / //🔽kharjūrapuṣpākṛtibhiḥ śirobhiḥ pūrṇataṇḍulaiḥ /
analyzed: śobhante bhyudite sūrye nadadbhiḥ krauñca sārasaiḥ  kharjūra puṣpa ākṛtibhiḥ śirobhiḥ pūrṇa taṇḍulaiḥ
translated: shine with the rising sun, with the trumpeting of cranes and storks.🔽The rice plants, with their heads shaped like date flowers and filled with grain,

original: śobhante kiṃcidālambāḥ śālayaḥ kanakaprabhāḥ // / / //🔽mayūkhair upasarpadbhir himanīhārasaṃvṛtaiḥ /
analyzed: śobhante kiṃcid ālambāḥ śālayaḥ kanaka prabhāḥ  mayūkhaiḥ upasarpadbhiḥ hima nīhāra saṃvṛtaiḥ
translated: shine, slightly bent, with the golden luster of gold.🔽The rising sun, covered with snow and mist,

original: dūram abhyuditaḥ sūryaḥ śaśāṅka iva lakṣyate // / / //
analyzed: dūram abhyuditaḥ sūryaḥ śaśāṅkaḥ iva lakṣyate
translated: is seen from afar like the moon.

original: agrāhyavīryaḥ pūrvāhṇe madhyāhne sparśataḥ sukhaḥ /
analyzed: agrāhya vīryaḥ pūrvāhṇe madhyāhne sparśataḥ sukhaḥ
translated: Unbearable in the morning, pleasant to the touch at midday,

original: saṃraktaḥ kiṃcid āpāṇḍur ātapaḥ śobhate kṣitau // / / //🔽avaśyāyanipātena kiṃcit praklinnaśādvalā /
analyzed: saṃraktaḥ kiṃcid āpāṇḍuḥ ātapaḥ śobhate kṣitau  avaśyāya nipātena kiṃcid praklinna śādvalā
translated: The sun, slightly red and pale, shines beautifully on the ground.🔽The earth is slightly moist with dew, and the grass is a little withered.

original: vanānāṃ śobhate bhūmir niviṣṭataruṇātapā // / / //🔽avaśyāyatamonaddhā nīhāratamasāvṛtāḥ /
analyzed: vanānām śobhate bhūmiḥ niviṣṭa taruṇa ātapā  avaśyāya tamaḥ naddhāḥ nīhāra tamasā āvṛtāḥ
translated: The ground in the forests shines with the rising sun.🔽The forest groves, covered with dew and mist,

original: prasuptā iva lakṣyante vipuṣpā vanarājayaḥ // / / //🔽bāṣpasaṃchannasalilā rutavijñeyasārasāḥ /
analyzed: prasuptāḥ iva lakṣyante vipuṣpāḥ vana rājayaḥ  bāṣpa saṃchanna salilāḥ ruta vijñeya sārasāḥ
translated: appear as if asleep, without flowers.🔽The lakes, with water covered with mist, and with swans to be known by their cries,

original: himārdravālukais tīraiḥ sarito bhānti sāmpratam // / / //
analyzed: hima ārdra vālukaiḥ tīraiḥ saritaḥ bhānti sāmpratam
translated: the rivers now shine with banks wet with frost and sand.

original: tuṣārapatanāc caiva mṛdutvād bhāskarasya ca /
analyzed: tuṣāra patanāt ca eva mṛdu tvāt bhāskarasya ca
translated: And because of the fall of frost, and the mildness of the sun,

original: śaityād agāgrastham api prāyeṇa rasavaj jalam // / / //
analyzed: śaityāt aga agra stham api prāyeṇa rasavat jalam
translated: and the cold, the water, though not yet fully grown, is mostly tasty.

original: jarājarjaritaiḥ parṇaiḥ śīrṇakesarakarṇikaiḥ /
analyzed: jarā jarjaritaiḥ parṇaiḥ śīrṇa kesara karṇikaiḥ
translated: The lotus beds, with leaves withered by old age, with filaments and pericarps fallen,

original: nālaśeṣā himadhvastā na bhānti kamalākarāḥ // / / //🔽asmiṃs tu puruṣavyāghra kāle duḥkhasamanvitaḥ /
analyzed: nāla śeṣāḥ hima dhvastāḥ na bhānti kamala ākarāḥ  asmin tu puruṣa vyāghra kāle duḥkha samanvitaḥ
translated: and with only stalks remaining, are destroyed by frost and do not shine.🔽But at this time, O tiger among men, the righteous Bharata,

original: tapaś carati dharmātmā tvadbhaktyā bharataḥ pure // / / //
analyzed: tapaḥ carati dharma ātmā tvad bhaktyā bharataḥ pure
translated: full of sorrow, practices austerities in the city out of devotion to you.

original: tyaktvā rājyaṃ ca mānaṃ ca bhogāṃś ca vividhān bahūn /
analyzed: tyaktvā rājyam ca mānam ca bhogān ca vividhān bahūn
translated: Having renounced the kingdom, honor, and many kinds of enjoyments,

original: tapasvī niyatāhāraḥ śete śīte mahītale // / / //
analyzed: tapasvī niyata āhāraḥ śete śīte mahī tale
translated: He is an ascetic, with controlled diet, sleeping on the cold ground.

original: so 'pi velām imāṃ nūnam abhiṣekārtham udyataḥ /
analyzed: saḥ pi velām imām nūnam abhiṣeka artham udyataḥ
translated: He too, no doubt, is rising at this time for the purpose of consecration.

original: vṛtaḥ prakṛtibhir nityaṃ prayāti sarayūṃ nadīm // / / //
analyzed: vṛtaḥ prakṛtibhiḥ nityam prayāti sarayūm nadīm
translated: Always surrounded by the subjects, he goes to the river Sarayu.

original: atyantasukhasaṃvṛddhaḥ sukumāro himārditaḥ /
analyzed: atyanta sukha saṃvṛddhaḥ sukumāraḥ hima arditaḥ
translated: He who was brought up in extreme comfort, delicate, afflicted by cold,

original: kathaṃ tv apararātreṣu sarayūm avagāhate // / / //
analyzed: katham tu apararātreṣu sarayūm avagāhate
translated: how does he bathe in the Sarayu in the latter part of the night?

original: padmapattrekṣaṇaḥ śyāmaḥ śrīmān nirudaro mahān /
analyzed: padma pattra īkṣaṇaḥ śyāmaḥ śrīmān nirudaraḥ mahān
translated: He who has eyes like lotus petals, is dark, prosperous, with a slender belly, and great,

original: dharmajñaḥ satyavādī ca hrīniṣedho jitendriyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dharma jñaḥ satya vādī ca hrī niṣedhaḥ jita indriyaḥ
translated: who knows dharma, is truthful, has modesty and self-control, and has conquered his senses.

original: priyābhibhāṣī madhuro dīrghabāhur ariṃdamaḥ /
analyzed: priya abhibhāṣī madhuraḥ dīrgha bāhuḥ ariṃdamaḥ
translated: He who speaks affectionately, is sweet, has long arms, and is a conqueror of enemies,

original: saṃtyajya vividhān bhogān āryaṃ sarvātmanāśritaḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃtyajya vividhān bhogān āryam sarva ātmanā āśritaḥ
translated: having given up various enjoyments, has resorted to the noble path in every way.

original: jitaḥ svargas tava bhrātrā bharatena mahātmanā /
analyzed: jitaḥ svargaḥ tava bhrātrā bharatena mahātmanā
translated: Heaven has been conquered by your great brother Bharata,

original: vanastham api tāpasye yas tvām anuvidhīyate // / / //🔽na pitryam anuvartante mātṛkaṃ dvipadā iti /
analyzed: vanastham api tāpasye yaḥ tvām anuvidhīyate  na pitryam anuvartante mātṛkam dvipadāḥ iti
translated: who follows you even in your forest life and asceticism.🔽It is a well-known saying in the world that two-legged beings do not follow their father's path or their mother's.

original: khyāto lokapravādo 'yaṃ bharatenānyathākṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: khyātaḥ loka pravādaḥ yam bharatena anyathā kṛtaḥ
translated: This has been done otherwise by Bharata.

original: bhartā daśaratho yasyāḥ sādhuś ca bharataḥ sutaḥ /
analyzed: bhartā daśarathaḥ yasyāḥ sādhuḥ ca bharataḥ sutaḥ
translated: Whose husband is Dasharatha and whose good son is Bharata,

original: kathaṃ nu sāmbā kaikeyī tādṛśī krūradarśinī // / / //
analyzed: katham nu sā ambā kaikeyī tādṛśī krūra darśinī
translated: How could Sāmba's mother, Kaikeyī, be so cruel?

original: ity evaṃ lakṣmaṇe vākyaṃ snehād bruvati dhārmike /
analyzed: iti evam lakṣmaṇe vākyam snehāt bruvati dhārmike
translated: Thus, when the righteous Lakṣmaṇa was speaking these words out of affection,

original: parivādaṃ jananyās tam asahan rāghavo 'bravīt // / / //
analyzed: parivādam jananyāḥ tam asahan rāghavaḥ bravīt
translated: Rāghava, unable to bear the slander of his mother, said:

original: na te 'mbā madhyamā tāta garhitavyā kathaṃcana /
analyzed: na te mbā madhyamā tāta garhitavyā kathaṃcana
translated: O father, that middle mother of yours should never be blamed in any way.

original: tām evekṣvākunāthasya bharatasya kathāṃ kuru // / / //
analyzed: tām eva ikṣvāku nāthasya bharatasya kathām kuru
translated: Speak to me only about Bharata, the lord of the Ikshvāku lineage.

original: niścitāpi hi me buddhir vanavāse dṛḍhavratā /
analyzed: niścitā api hi me buddhiḥ vana vāse dṛḍha vratā
translated: Although my mind is firmly set on dwelling in the forest, my vow being firm,

original: bharatasnehasaṃtaptā bāliśī kriyate punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bharata sneha saṃtaptā bāliśī kriyate punar
translated: I am again made foolish by the affection for Bharata.

original: ity evaṃ vilapaṃs tatra prāpya godāvarīṃ nadīm /
analyzed: iti evam vilapan tatra prāpya godāvarīm nadīm
translated: Thus lamenting there, having reached the Godāvarī river,

original: cakre 'bhiṣekaṃ kākutsthaḥ sānujaḥ saha sītayā // / / //
analyzed: cakre bhiṣekam kākutsthaḥ sa anujaḥ saha sītayā
translated: Rāma, the descendant of Kakutstha, performed the ablution along with his younger brothers and Sītā.

original: tarpayitvātha salilais te pitṝn daivatāni ca /
analyzed: tarpayitvā atha salilaiḥ te pitṝn daivatāni ca
translated: Having offered libations of water to the ancestors and deities,

original: stuvanti smoditaṃ sūryaṃ devatāś ca samāhitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: stuvanti sma uditam sūryam devatāḥ ca samāhitāḥ
translated: they praised the rising sun and the deities with focused minds.

original: kṛtābhiṣekaḥ sa rarāja rāmaḥ sītādvitīyaḥ saha lakṣmaṇena /
analyzed: kṛta abhiṣekaḥ sa rarāja rāmaḥ sītā dvitīyaḥ saha lakṣmaṇena
translated: Having performed the ablution, Rāma shone forth, with Sītā as his second and with Lakṣmaṇa,

original: kṛtābhiṣekas tv agarājaputryā rudraḥ sanandī bhagavān iveśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kṛta abhiṣekaḥ tu aga rāja putryā rudraḥ sa nandī bhagavān iva īśaḥ
translated: like Lord Śiva, the son of the lord of mountains, with the daughter of the lord of mountains after her ablution.

original: kṛtābhiṣeko rāmas tu sītā saumitrir eva ca /
analyzed: kṛta abhiṣekaḥ rāmaḥ tu sītā saumitriḥ eva ca
translated: Rama, Sita, and Lakshmana, having performed their ablutions,

original: tasmād godāvarītīrāt tato jagmuḥ svam āśramam // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt godāvarī tīrāt tatas jagmuḥ svam āśramam
translated: then left the banks of the Godavari and went to their own hermitage.

original: āśramaṃ tam upāgamya rāghavaḥ sahalakṣmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: āśramam tam upāgamya rāghavaḥ sahalakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Having reached the hermitage, Raghava together with Lakshmana,

original: kṛtvā paurvāhṇikaṃ karma parṇaśālām upāgamat // / / //
analyzed: kṛtvā paurvāhṇikam karma parṇa śālām upāgamat
translated: having performed the morning rituals, went to the leaf-hut.

original: sa rāmaḥ parṇaśālāyām āsīnaḥ saha sītayā /
analyzed: sa rāmaḥ parṇa śālāyām āsīnaḥ saha sītayā
translated: Rama, seated in the leaf-hut with Sita,

original: virarāja mahābāhuś citrayā candramā iva /🔽lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā cakāra vividhāḥ kathāḥ // / / //
analyzed: virarāja mahā bāhuḥ citrayā candramāḥ iva  lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā cakāra vividhāḥ kathāḥ
translated: shone forth with Chitra, like the moon.🔽With his brother Lakshmana, he engaged in various conversations.

original: tadāsīnasya rāmasya kathāsaṃsaktacetasaḥ /
analyzed: tadā āsīnasya rāmasya kathā saṃsakta cetasaḥ
translated: While Rama was seated thus, his mind engrossed in the stories,

original: taṃ deśaṃ rākṣasī kācid ājagāma yadṛcchayā // / / //🔽sā tu śūrpaṇakhā nāma daśagrīvasya rakṣasaḥ /
analyzed: tam deśam rākṣasī kācid ājagāma yadṛcchayā  sā tu śūrpaṇakhā nāma daśagrīvasya rakṣasaḥ
translated: a certain demoness happened to come to that place.🔽She was the sister of the demon Dashagriva,

original: bhaginī rāmam āsādya dadarśa tridaśopamam // / / //🔽siṃhoraskaṃ mahābāhuṃ padmapattranibhekṣaṇam /
analyzed: bhaginī rāmam āsādya dadarśa tridaśa upamam  siṃha uraskam mahā bāhum padma pattra nibha īkṣaṇam
translated: named Shurpanakha. Having approached Rama, she saw him, who was like a god.🔽He had a chest like a lion, long arms, eyes like lotus petals,

original: sukumāraṃ mahāsattvaṃ pārthivavyañjanānvitam // / / //
analyzed: sukumāram mahāsattvam pārthiva vyañjana anvitam
translated: was delicate, of great spirit, and bore the marks of a king.

original: rāmam indīvaraśyāmaṃ kandarpasadṛśaprabham /
analyzed: rāmam indīvara śyāmam kandarpa sadṛśa prabham
translated: Rama was dark like a blue lotus, his radiance like that of Cupid,

original: babhūvendropamaṃ dṛṣṭvā rākṣasī kāmamohitā // / / //
analyzed: babhūva indra upamam dṛṣṭvā rākṣasī kāma mohitā
translated: Seeing him, who was like Indra, the demoness became infatuated with desire.

original: sumukhaṃ durmukhī rāmaṃ vṛttamadhyaṃ mahodarī /🔽viśālākṣaṃ virūpākṣī sukeśaṃ tāmramūrdhajā // / / //🔽priyarūpaṃ virūpā sā susvaraṃ bhairavasvarā /
analyzed: su mukham durmukhī rāmam vṛtta madhyam mahā udarī  viśāla akṣam virūpa akṣī sukeśam tāmra mūrdhajā  priya rūpam virūpā sā su svaram bhairava svarā
translated: The ugly-faced one with a large belly saw the handsome Rama with a slender waist.🔽The one with disfigured eyes saw the one with large eyes, the one with tawny hair saw the one with beautiful hair.

original: taruṇaṃ dāruṇā vṛddhā dakṣiṇaṃ vāmabhāṣiṇī // / / //
analyzed: taruṇam dāruṇā vṛddhā dakṣiṇam vāma bhāṣiṇī
translated: The one with a terrible voice saw the one with a sweet voice, the one with a terrible appearance saw the one with a pleasant appearance.🔽The one who speaks to the left saw the one who speaks to the right, the one with a terrible form saw the young one.

original: nyāyavṛttaṃ sudurvṛttā priyam apriyadarśanā /
analyzed: nyāya vṛttam su durvṛttā priyam apriya darśanā
translated: The one with a very bad conduct saw the one with good conduct, the one with an unpleasant appearance saw the one with a pleasant appearance.

original: śarīrajasamāviṣṭā rākṣasī rāmam abravīt // / / //🔽jaṭī tāpasarūpeṇa sabhāryaḥ śaracāpadhṛk /
analyzed: śarīraja samāviṣṭā rākṣasī rāmam abravīt  jaṭī tāpasa rūpeṇa sa bhāryaḥ
translated: Possessed by passion, the demoness spoke to Rama.

original: āgatas tvam imaṃ deśaṃ kathaṃ rākṣasasevitam // / / //
analyzed: āgataḥ tvam imam deśam katham rākṣasa sevitam
translated: You have come to this place inhabited by demons, with matted hair, in the form of an ascetic, with your wife, holding a bow and arrows.

original: evam uktas tu rākṣasyā śūrpaṇakhyā paraṃtapaḥ /
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tu rākṣasyā śūrpaṇakhyā paraṃtapaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by the demoness Shurpanakha, the scorcher of enemies.

original: ṛjubuddhitayā sarvam ākhyātum upacakrame // / / //
analyzed: ṛju buddhi tayā sarvam ākhyātum upacakrame
translated: Out of straightforwardness, he began to tell everything.

original: āsīd daśaratho nāma rājā tridaśavikramaḥ /
analyzed: āsīt daśarathaḥ nāma rājā tridaśa vikramaḥ
translated: There was a king named Dasharatha, with the valor of the thirty gods.

original: tasyāham agrajaḥ putro rāmo nāma janaiḥ śrutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasya aham agrajaḥ putraḥ rāmaḥ nāma janaiḥ śrutaḥ
translated: I am his eldest son, known to the people as Rama.

original: bhrātāyaṃ lakṣmaṇo nāma yavīyān mām anuvrataḥ /
analyzed: bhrātā ayam lakṣmaṇaḥ nāma yavīyān mām anuvrataḥ
translated: This is my younger brother named Lakshmana, who follows me.

original: iyaṃ bhāryā ca vaidehī mama sīteti viśrutā // / / //
analyzed: iyam bhāryā ca vaidehī mama sītā iti viśrutā
translated: This is my wife, Vaidehi, known as Sita.

original: niyogāt tu narendrasya pitur mātuś ca yantritaḥ /
analyzed: niyogāt tu narendrasya pituḥ mātuḥ ca yantritaḥ
translated: But at the command of the king, my father, and controlled by my mother,

original: dharmārthaṃ dharmakāṅkṣī ca vanaṃ vastum ihāgataḥ // / / //🔽tvāṃ tu veditum icchāmi kathyatāṃ kāsi kasya vā /
analyzed: dharma artham dharma kāṅkṣī ca vanam vastum iha āgataḥ  tvām tu veditum icchāmi kathyatām kā asi kasya vā
translated: I have come to this forest to live for the sake of dharma, desiring dharma.🔽But I wish to know you. Tell me who you are and whose you are.

original: iha vā kiṃnimittaṃ tvam āgatā brūhi tattvataḥ // / / //
analyzed: iha vā kiṃnimittam tvam āgatā brūhi tattvataḥ
translated: Or for what reason have you come here? Tell me the truth.

original: sābravīd vacanaṃ śrutvā rākṣasī madanārditā /
analyzed: sā bravīt vacanam śrutvā rākṣasī madana arditā
translated: Having heard his words, the demoness, afflicted by passion,

original: śrūyatāṃ rāma vakṣyāmi tattvārthaṃ vacanaṃ mama // / / //
analyzed: śrūyatām rāma vakṣyāmi tattva artham vacanam mama
translated: replied, Listen, O Rama! I will tell you the truth.

original: ahaṃ śūrpaṇakhā nāma rākṣasī kāmarūpiṇī /
analyzed: aham śūrpaṇakhā nāma rākṣasī kāmarūpiṇī
translated: I am a demoness named Shurpanakha, able to assume any form at will.

original: araṇyaṃ vicarāmīdam ekā sarvabhayaṃkarā // / / //
analyzed: araṇyam vicarāmi idam ekā sarva bhayaṃkarā
translated: I roam this forest alone, terrifying everyone.

original: rāvaṇo nāma me bhrātā rākṣaso rākṣaseśvaraḥ /
analyzed: rāvaṇaḥ nāma me bhrātā rākṣasaḥ rākṣaseśvaraḥ
translated: My brother is named Ravana, a demon king of demons.

original: pravṛddhanidraś ca sadā kumbhakarṇo mahābalaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pravṛddha nidraḥ ca sadā kumbhakarṇaḥ mahā balaḥ
translated: And the greatly strong Kumbhakarna always sleeps a lot.

original: vibhīṣaṇas tu dharmātmā na tu rākṣasaceṣṭitaḥ /
analyzed: vibhīṣaṇaḥ tu dharma ātmā na tu rākṣasa ceṣṭitaḥ
translated: But the righteous Vibhishana does not act like a demon.

original: prakhyātavīryau ca raṇe bhrātarau kharadūṣaṇau // / / //
analyzed: prakhyāta vīryau ca raṇe bhrātarau khara dūṣaṇau
translated: And the brothers Khara and Dushana are renowned for their valor in battle.

original: tān ahaṃ samatikrāntā rāma tvā pūrvadarśanāt /
analyzed: tān aham samatikrāntā rāma tvā pūrva darśanāt
