translated: I have fallen in love with you, O Rama, at first sight.

original: samupetāsmi bhāvena bhartāraṃ puruṣottamam /
analyzed: samupetā asmi bhāvena bhartāram puruṣottamam
translated: I have come to you in love, to the best of men, to be your wife.

original: cirāya bhava bhartā me sītayā kiṃ kariṣyasi // / / //
analyzed: cirāya bhava bhartā me sītayā kim kariṣyasi
translated: Be my husband for a long time. What will you do with Sita?

original: vikṛtā ca virūpā ca na seyaṃ sadṛśī tava /
analyzed: vikṛtā ca virūpā ca na sā iyam sadṛśī tava
translated: She is ugly and deformed. She is not a suitable wife for you.

original: aham evānurūpā te bhāryā rūpeṇa paśya mām // / / //🔽imāṃ virūpām asatīṃ karālāṃ nirṇatodarīm /
analyzed: aham eva anurūpā te bhāryā rūpeṇa paśya mām  imām virūpām asatīm karālām nirṇatodarīm
translated: I alone am a suitable wife for you. Look at me.

original: anena saha te bhrātrā bhakṣayiṣyāmi mānuṣīm // / / //🔽tataḥ parvataśṛṅgāṇi vanāni vividhāni ca /
analyzed: anena saha te bhrātrā bhakṣayiṣyāmi mānuṣīm  tatas parvata śṛṅgāṇi vanāni vividhāni ca
translated: I will eat this ugly, unchaste, terrible woman with a flat stomach, along with your brother, this human.

original: paśyan saha mayā kānta daṇḍakān vicariṣyasi // / / //🔽ity evam uktaḥ kākutsthaḥ prahasya madirekṣaṇām /
analyzed: paśyan saha mayā kānta daṇḍakān vicariṣyasi  iti evam uktaḥ kākutsthaḥ prahasya madirā īkṣaṇām
translated: Then, seeing the mountain peaks and various forests, you will wander in the Dandaka forest with me, my beloved.

original: idaṃ vacanam ārebhe vaktuṃ vākyaviśāradaḥ // / / //🔽tāṃ tu śūrpaṇakhāṃ rāmaḥ kāmapāśāvapāśitām /
analyzed: idam vacanam ārebhe vaktum vākya viśāradaḥ  tām tu śūrpaṇakhām rāmaḥ kāma pāśa avapāśitām
translated: Thus addressed, Kakutstha, skilled in speech, smilingly began to speak these words to the intoxicated-eyed one.

original: svacchayā ślakṣṇayā vācā smitapūrvam athābravīt // / / //
analyzed: svacchayā ślakṣṇayā vācā smita pūrvam atha abravīt
translated: Rama, to whom Shurpanakha was bound by the noose of desire, then spoke to her with clear and smooth words, preceded by a smile.

original: kṛtadāro 'smi bhavati bhāryeyaṃ dayitā mama /
analyzed: smi bhavati bhāryā iyam dayitā mama
translated: I am married, O lady, and this is my beloved wife.

original: tvadvidhānāṃ tu nārīṇāṃ suduḥkhā sasapatnatā // / / //
analyzed: tvadvidhānām tu nārīṇām su duḥkhā sa sapatna tā
translated: But for women like you, co-wifehood is very painful.

original: anujas tv eṣa me bhrātā śīlavān priyadarśanaḥ /
analyzed: anujaḥ tu eṣa me bhrātā śīlavān priya darśanaḥ
translated: This younger brother of mine is virtuous, handsome,

original: śrīmān akṛtadāraś ca lakṣmaṇo nāma vīryavān // / / //
analyzed: śrīmān a kṛta dāraḥ ca lakṣmaṇaḥ nāma vīryavān
translated: prosperous, and unmarried, the valiant Lakṣmaṇa by name.

original: apūrvī bhāryayā cārthī taruṇaḥ priyadarśanaḥ /
analyzed: apūrvī bhāryayā ca arthī taruṇaḥ priya darśanaḥ
translated: He is young, handsome, and desires a wife he has never had before.

original: anurūpaś ca te bhartā rūpasyāsya bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: anurūpaḥ ca te bhartā rūpasya asya bhaviṣyati
translated: He will be a suitable husband for you, befitting this beauty of yours.

original: enaṃ bhaja viśālākṣi bhartāraṃ bhrātaraṃ mama /
analyzed: enam bhaja viśāla akṣi bhartāram bhrātaram mama
translated: Serve him, O large-eyed one, as your husband, my brother.

original: asapatnā varārohe merum arkaprabhā yathā // / / //
analyzed: asapatnā varārohe merum arka prabhā yathā
translated: O beautiful one, be without a rival, like the light of the sun on Mount Meru.

original: iti rāmeṇa sā proktā rākṣasī kāmamohitā /
analyzed: iti rāmeṇa sā proktā rākṣasī kāma mohitā
translated: Thus addressed by Rāma, the demoness, infatuated by lust,

original: visṛjya rāmaṃ sahasā tato lakṣmaṇam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: visṛjya rāmam sahasā tatas lakṣmaṇam abravīt
translated: suddenly dismissed Rāma and then spoke to Lakṣmaṇa.

original: asya rūpasya te yuktā bhāryāhaṃ varavarṇinī /
analyzed: asya rūpasya te yuktā bhāryā aham varavarṇinī
translated: I, a woman of excellent complexion, am a suitable wife for you, whose beauty is like this.

original: mayā saha sukhaṃ sarvān daṇḍakān vicariṣyasi // / / //
analyzed: mayā saha sukham sarvān daṇḍakān vicariṣyasi
translated: With me, you will happily roam through all the Dāndakas.

original: evam uktas tu saumitrī rākṣasyā vākyakovidaḥ /
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tu saumitriḥ rākṣasyā vākya kovidaḥ
translated: Thus addressed, the son of Sumitrā, skilled in speech,

original: tataḥ śūrpaṇakhīṃ smitvā lakṣmaṇo yuktam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: tatas śūrpaṇakhīm smitvā lakṣmaṇaḥ yuktam abravīt
translated: then smiled at Śūrpanakhā and spoke appropriately.

original: kathaṃ dāsasya me dāsī bhāryā bhavitum icchasi /
analyzed: katham dāsasya me dāsī bhāryā bhavitum icchasi
translated: How can you, a slave, wish to be the wife of my master?

original: so 'ham āryeṇa paravān bhrātrā kamalavarṇini // / / //
analyzed: saḥ ham āryeṇa paravān bhrātrā kamala varṇini
translated: I am under the control of my noble brother, O lotus-complexioned one.

original: samṛddhārthasya siddhārthā muditāmalavarṇinī /
analyzed: samṛddha arthasya siddhārthā mudita amala varṇinī
translated: O you of pure complexion, you are prosperous and successful.

original: āryasya tvaṃ viśālākṣi bhāryā bhava yavīyasī // / / //
analyzed: āryasya tvam viśāla akṣi bhāryā bhava yavīyasī
translated: O you of large eyes, be the younger wife of this noble one.

original: etāṃ virūpām asatīṃ karālāṃ nirṇatodarīm /
analyzed: etām virūpām asatīm karālām nirṇata udarīm
translated: Abandoning this ugly, unchaste, terrible, flat-bellied old wife,🔽he will serve only you.

original: bhāryāṃ vṛddhāṃ parityajya tvām evaiṣa bhajiṣyati // / / //🔽ko hi rūpam idaṃ śreṣṭhaṃ saṃtyajya varavarṇini /
analyzed: bhāryām vṛddhām parityajya tvām eva eṣa bhajiṣyati  kaḥ hi rūpam idam śreṣṭham saṃtyajya varavarṇini
translated: O you of excellent complexion, which wise man,

original: mānuṣeṣu varārohe kuryād bhāvaṃ vicakṣaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mānuṣeṣu varārohe kuryāt bhāvam vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: after abandoning this excellent beauty, O beautiful lady, would feel for human beings?

original: iti sā lakṣmaṇenoktā karālā nirṇatodarī /
analyzed: iti sā lakṣmaṇena uktā karālā nirṇata udarī
translated: Thus spoken to by Lakshmana, the ugly, flat-bellied one,

original: manyate tad vacaḥ satyaṃ parihāsāvicakṣaṇā // / / //🔽sā rāmaṃ parṇaśālāyām upaviṣṭaṃ paraṃtapam /
analyzed: manyate tat vacaḥ satyam parihāsa avicakṣaṇā  sā rāmam parṇa śālāyām upaviṣṭam paraṃtapam
translated: not knowing how to laugh, considered his words to be true.🔽She, infatuated by love, spoke to Rama, the scorcher of enemies,

original: sītayā saha durdharṣam abravīt kāmamohitā // / / //🔽imāṃ virūpām asatīṃ karālāṃ nirṇatodarīm /
analyzed: sītayā saha durdharṣam abravīt kāma mohitā  imām virūpām asatīm karālām nirṇatodarīm
translated: seated with Sita in the leaf-hut, the invincible one:🔽Abandoning this ugly, unchaste, terrible, flat-bellied old wife,

original: vṛddhāṃ bhāryām avaṣṭabhya na māṃ tvaṃ bahu manyase // / / //
analyzed: vṛddhām bhāryām avaṣṭabhya na mām tvam bahu manyase
translated: you do not value me much.

original: adyemāṃ bhakṣayiṣyāmi paśyatas tava mānuṣīm /
analyzed: adyā imām bhakṣayiṣyāmi paśyataḥ tava mānuṣīm
translated: Today, in your presence, I will devour this human woman,

original: tvayā saha cariṣyāmi niḥsapatnā yathāsukham // / / //
analyzed: tvayā saha cariṣyāmi niḥsapatnā yathāsukham
translated: and I will roam with you, free from rivals, as I please.

original: ity uktvā mṛgaśāvākṣīm alātasadṛśekṣaṇā /
analyzed: iti uktvā mṛgaśāvākṣīm alāta sadṛśa īkṣaṇā
translated: Having said this to the deer-eyed one, the one with eyes like a whirling firebrand,

original: abhyadhāvat susaṃkruddhā maholkā rohiṇīm iva // / / //
analyzed: abhyadhāvat su saṃkruddhā mahā ulkā rohiṇīm iva
translated: she rushed at her in great anger, like a great meteor at Rohini.

original: tāṃ mṛtyupāśapratimām āpatantīṃ mahābalaḥ /
analyzed: tām mṛtyu pāśa pratimām āpatantīm mahā balaḥ
translated: The greatly powerful one, seeing her, who was like the noose of Death, rushing at him,

original: nigṛhya rāmaḥ kupitas tato lakṣmaṇam abravīt // / / //🔽krūrair anāryaiḥ saumitre parihāsaḥ kathaṃcana /
analyzed: nigṛhya rāmaḥ kupitaḥ tatas lakṣmaṇam abravīt  krūraiḥ anāryaiḥ saumitre parihāsaḥ kathaṃcana
translated: Rama, angry, seized her and then spoke to Lakshmana.🔽O Saumitra, one should never joke with cruel and ignoble people.

original: na kāryaḥ paśya vaidehīṃ kathaṃcit saumya jīvatīm // / / //
analyzed: na kāryaḥ paśya vaidehīm kathaṃcid saumya jīvatīm
translated: Look, O gentle one, Vaidehi is somehow alive.

original: imāṃ virūpām asatīm atimattāṃ mahodarīm /
analyzed: imām virūpām asatīm ati mattām mahā udarīm
translated: This ugly, unchaste, extremely intoxicated, big-bellied demoness,

original: rākṣasīṃ puruṣavyāghra virūpayitum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: rākṣasīm puruṣa vyāghra virūpayitum arhasi
translated: O tiger among men, it is proper for you to disfigure her.

original: ity ukto lakṣmaṇas tasyāḥ kruddho rāmasya paśyataḥ /🔽uddhṛtya khaḍgaṃ cicheda karṇanāsaṃ mahābalaḥ // / / //🔽nikṛttakarṇanāsā tu visvaraṃ sā vinadya ca /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ lakṣmaṇaḥ tasyāḥ kruddhaḥ rāmasya paśyataḥ  uddhṛtya khaḍgam cicheda karṇa nāsam mahā balaḥ  nikṛtta karṇa nāsā tu visvaram sā vinadya ca
translated: Thus addressed, the greatly powerful Lakshmana, in the presence of Rama,🔽angry, raised his sword and cut off her nose and ears.🔽With her ears and nose cut off, she screamed in a distorted voice

original: yathāgataṃ pradudrāva ghorā śūrpaṇakhā vanam // / / //
analyzed: yathāgatam pradudrāva ghorā śūrpaṇakhā vanam
translated: and fled as she had come, the terrible Shurpanakha, to the forest.

original: sā virūpā mahāghorā rākṣasī śoṇitokṣitā /
analyzed: sā virūpā mahā ghorā rākṣasī śoṇita ukṣitā
translated: That disfigured, extremely terrible demoness, covered in blood,

original: nanāda vividhān nādān yathā prāvṛṣi toyadaḥ // / / //
analyzed: nanāda vividhān nādān yathā prāvṛṣi toyadaḥ
translated: roared various roars, like a cloud in the rainy season.

original: sā vikṣarantī rudhiraṃ bahudhā ghoradarśanā /
analyzed: sā vikṣarantī rudhiram bahudhā ghora darśanā
translated: She, bleeding profusely and looking terrible,

original: pragṛhya bāhū garjantī praviveśa mahāvanam // / / //
analyzed: pragṛhya bāhū garjantī praviveśa mahā vanam
translated: Raising her arms and roaring, entered the great forest.

original: tatas tu sā rākṣasasaṃghasaṃvṛtaṃ kharaṃ janasthānagataṃ virūpitā /
analyzed: tatas tu sā rākṣasa saṃgha saṃvṛtam kharam janasthāna gatam virūpitā
translated: Then, the disfigured one, surrounded by a group of demons, approached her brother Khara, who was in Janasthana,

original: upetya taṃ bhrātaram ugratejasaṃ papāta bhūmau gaganād yathāśaniḥ // / / //🔽tataḥ sabhāryaṃ bhayamohamūrchitā salakṣmaṇaṃ rāghavam āgataṃ vanam /
analyzed: upetya tam bhrātaram ugra tejasam papāta bhūmau gaganāt yathā aśaniḥ  tatas sa bhāryam bhaya moha mūrchitā sa lakṣmaṇam rāghavam āgatam vanam
translated: And fell on the ground like a thunderbolt from the sky, near her brother of fierce energy.🔽Then, overcome by fear and delusion, she told Khara everything - how Raghava, along with his wife and Lakshmana, had come to the forest,

original: virūpaṇaṃ cātmani śoṇitokṣitā śaśaṃsa sarvaṃ bhaginī kharasya sā // / / //
analyzed: virūpaṇam ca ātmani śoṇita ukṣitā śaśaṃsa sarvam bhaginī kharasya sā
translated: And how she, covered in blood, had been disfigured.

original: tāṃ tathā patitāṃ dṛṣṭvā virūpāṃ śoṇitokṣitām /
analyzed: tām tathā patitām dṛṣṭvā virūpām śoṇita ukṣitām
translated: Seeing her fallen in that state, disfigured and covered in blood,

original: bhaginīṃ krodhasaṃtaptaḥ kharaḥ papraccha rākṣasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhaginīm krodha saṃtaptaḥ kharaḥ papraccha rākṣasaḥ
translated: Khara, the demon, burning with anger, asked his sister.

original: balavikramasampannā kāmagā kāmarūpiṇī /
analyzed: bala vikrama sampannā kāmagā kāmarūpiṇī
translated: Endowed with strength and valor, able to go anywhere at will, able to assume any form at will,

original: imām avasthāṃ nītā tvaṃ kenāntakasamā gatā // / / //
analyzed: imām avasthām nītā tvam kena antaka samā gatā
translated: Who has reduced you to this state, as if you have met your end?

original: devagandharvabhūtānām ṛṣīṇāṃ ca mahātmanām /
analyzed: deva gandharva bhūtānām ṛṣīṇām ca mahātmanām
translated: Of the gods, gandharvas, spirits, and the great-souled sages,

original: ko 'yam evaṃ mahāvīryas tvāṃ virūpāṃ cakāra ha // / / //
analyzed: kaḥ yam evam mahā vīryaḥ tvām virūpām cakāra ha
translated: Who is this one of great prowess who has disfigured you?

original: na hi paśyāmy ahaṃ loke yaḥ kuryān mama vipriyam /
analyzed: na hi paśyāmi aham loke yaḥ kuryāt mama vipriyam
translated: I do not see anyone in the world who can do me an injury,

original: antarena sahasrākṣaṃ mahendraṃ pākaśāsanam // / / //
analyzed: antarena sahasrākṣam mahā indram pākaśāsanam
translated: except the thousand-eyed great Indra, the chastiser of Paka.

original: adyāhaṃ mārgaṇaiḥ prāṇān ādāsye jīvitāntakaiḥ /
analyzed: adya aham mārgaṇaiḥ prāṇān ādāsye jīvita antakaiḥ
translated: Today, with my arrows that end life, I will take away the life-breaths of that one.

original: salile kṣīram āsaktaṃ niṣpibann iva sārasaḥ // / / //🔽nihatasya mayā saṃkhye śarasaṃkṛttamarmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: salile kṣīram āsaktam niṣpiban iva sārasaḥ  nihatasya mayā saṃkhye śara saṃkṛtta marmaṇaḥ
translated: Like a crane drinking milk mixed with water, I will drink the blood of that one.

original: saphenaṃ rudhiraṃ raktaṃ medinī kasya pāsyati // / / //🔽kasya pattrarathāḥ kāyān māṃsam utkṛtya saṃgatāḥ /
analyzed: sa phenam rudhiram raktam medinī kasya pāsyati  kasya pattrarathāḥ kāyāt māṃsam utkṛtya saṃgatāḥ
translated: The blood of that one, whose vital organs will be torn by my arrows, will flow forth with foam. Whose mouth will it enter?

original: prahṛṣṭā bhakṣayiṣyanti nihatasya mayā raṇe // / / //
analyzed: prahṛṣṭāḥ bhakṣayiṣyanti nihatasya mayā raṇe
translated: Whose body will the vultures, tearing off the flesh, assemble and joyfully devour, when he is killed by me in battle?

original: taṃ na devā na gandharvā na piśācā na rākṣasāḥ /
analyzed: tam na devāḥ na gandharvāḥ na piśācāḥ na rākṣasāḥ
translated: Neither the gods, nor the Gandharvas, nor the Pishachas, nor the Rakshasas,

original: mayāpakṛṣṭaṃ kṛpaṇaṃ śaktās trātuṃ mahāhave // / / //
analyzed: mayā apakṛṣṭam kṛpaṇam śaktāḥ trātum mahā āhave
translated: are able to save that wretched one, who will be killed by me in the great battle.

original: upalabhya śanaiḥ saṃjñāṃ taṃ me śaṃsitum arhasi /
analyzed: upalabhya śanais saṃjñām tam me śaṃsitum arhasi
translated: Having slowly regained consciousness, it behoves you to tell me,

original: yena tvaṃ durvinītena vane vikramya nirjitā // / / //
analyzed: yena tvam durvinītena vane vikramya nirjitā
translated: by whom you have been overpowered and defeated in the forest, by that wicked one.

original: iti bhrātur vacaḥ śrutvā kruddhasya ca viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: iti bhrātuḥ vacaḥ śrutvā kruddhasya ca viśeṣataḥ
translated: Having heard these words of her brother, who was especially angry,

original: tataḥ śūrpaṇakhā vākyaṃ sabāṣpam idam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: tatas śūrpaṇakhā vākyam sa bāṣpam idam abravīt
translated: then Shurpanakha, with tears in her eyes, spoke these words:🔽O brother, listen to my words, which are for your own good.

original: taruṇau rūpasampannau sukumārau mahābalau /
analyzed: taruṇau rūpa sampannau sukumārau mahā balau
translated: They were young, endowed with beauty, delicate, and greatly strong.

original: puṇḍarīkaviśālākṣau cīrakṛṣṇājināmbarau // / / //
analyzed: puṇḍarīka viśāla akṣau cīra kṛṣṇa ajina ambarau
translated: Their eyes were large like lotus flowers, and they were clad in bark garments and black antelope skins.

original: gandharvarājapratimau pārthivavyañjanānvitau /
analyzed: gandharvarāja pratimau pārthiva vyañjana anvitau
translated: They were like the king of the Gandharvas, and bore the marks of kings.

original: devau vā mānuṣau vā tau na tarkayitum utsahe // / / //🔽taruṇī rūpasampannā sarvābharaṇabhūṣitā /
analyzed: devau vā mānuṣau vā tau na tarkayitum utsahe  taruṇī rūpa sampannā sarva ābharaṇa bhūṣitā
translated: I dare not conjecture whether they were gods or men.🔽I saw there a young woman, endowed with beauty, adorned with all ornaments,

original: dṛṣṭā tatra mayā nārī tayor madhye sumadhyamā // / / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭā tatra mayā nārī tayoḥ madhye sumadhyamā
translated: standing between them, with a slender waist.

original: tābhyām ubhābhyāṃ sambhūya pramadām adhikṛtya tām /
analyzed: tābhyām ubhābhyām sambhūya pramadām adhikṛtya tām
translated: United with those two, regarding that woman,

original: imām avasthāṃ nītāhaṃ yathānāthāsatī tathā // / / //
analyzed: imām avasthām nītā aham yathā anāthā asatī tathā
translated: I have been reduced to this state, as if I were a helpless unchaste woman.

original: tasyāś cānṛjuvṛttāyās tayoś ca hatayor aham /
analyzed: tasyāḥ ca anṛju vṛttāyāḥ tayoḥ ca hatayoḥ aham
translated: And of that crooked-natured one, and of those two slain,

original: saphenaṃ pātum icchāmi rudhiraṃ raṇamūrdhani // / / //
analyzed: sa phenam pātum icchāmi rudhiram raṇa mūrdhani
translated: I desire to drink blood with foam on the battlefield.

original: eṣa me prathamaḥ kāmaḥ kṛtas tāta tvayā bhavet /
analyzed: eṣa me prathamaḥ kāmaḥ kṛtaḥ tāta tvayā bhavet
translated: Let this first desire of mine be fulfilled by you, O father.

original: tasyās tayoś ca rudhiraṃ pibeyam aham āhave // / / //🔽iti tasyāṃ bruvāṇāyāṃ caturdaśa mahābalān /
analyzed: tasyāḥ tayoḥ ca rudhiram pibeyam aham āhave  iti tasyām bruvāṇāyām caturdaśa mahā balān
translated: In the battle, I shall drink the blood of her and of those two.

original: vyādideśa kharaḥ kruddho rākṣasān antakopamān // / / //
analyzed: vyādideśa kharaḥ kruddhaḥ rākṣasān antaka upamān
translated: When she was speaking thus, the angry Khara ordered fourteen very powerful demons, resembling Death himself,

original: mānuṣau śastrasampannau cīrakṛṣṇājināmbarau /🔽praviṣṭau daṇḍakāraṇyaṃ ghoraṃ pramadayā saha // / / //
analyzed: mānuṣau śastra sampannau cīra kṛṣṇa ajina ambarau  praviṣṭau daṇḍaka araṇyam ghoram pramadayā saha
translated: They are human, well-armed, wearing bark garments and black antelope skins.🔽They have entered the terrible Dandaka forest with a woman.

original: tau hatvā tāṃ ca durvṛttām upāvartitum arhatha /
analyzed: tau hatvā tām ca durvṛttām upāvartitum arhatha
translated: Having killed them and that wicked one, you should return.

original: iyaṃ ca rudhiraṃ teṣāṃ bhaginī mama pāsyati // / / //
analyzed: iyam ca rudhiram teṣām bhaginī mama pāsyati
translated: This sister of mine will drink their blood.

original: manoratho 'yam iṣṭo 'syā bhaginyā mama rākṣasāḥ /
analyzed: manorathaḥ yam iṣṭaḥ syāḥ bhaginyāḥ mama rākṣasāḥ
translated: O Rakshasas, this is the cherished desire of my sister.

original: śīghraṃ saṃpadyatāṃ gatvā tau pramathya svatejasā // / / //
analyzed: śīghram saṃpadyatām gatvā tau pramathya sva tejasā
translated: Having gone there quickly, fulfill it by crushing them with your own prowess.

original: iti pratisamādiṣṭā rākṣasās te caturdaśa /
analyzed: iti pratisamādiṣṭāḥ rākṣasāḥ te caturdaśa
translated: Thus commanded, those fourteen Rakshasas,

original: tatra jagmus tayā sārdhaṃ ghanā vāteritā yathā // / / //
analyzed: tatra jagmuḥ tayā sārdham ghanāḥ vāta īritāḥ yathā
translated: went there with her, like clouds driven by the wind.

original: ataḥ śūrpaṇakhā ghorā rāghavāśramam āgatā /
analyzed: atas śūrpaṇakhā ghorā rāghava āśramam āgatā
translated: Then the terrible Shurpanakha came to the hermitage of the Raghavas,

original: rakṣasām ācacakṣe tau bhrātarau saha sītayā // / / //
analyzed: rakṣasām ācacakṣe tau bhrātarau saha sītayā
translated: and described to the Rakshasas those two brothers with Sita.

original: te rāmaṃ parṇaśālāyām upaviṣṭaṃ mahābalam /
analyzed: te rāmam parṇa śālāyām upaviṣṭam mahā balam
translated: They saw the greatly powerful Rama seated in the leaf-hut,

original: dadṛśuḥ sītayā sārdhaṃ vaidehyā lakṣmaṇena ca // / / //
analyzed: dadṛśuḥ sītayā sārdham vaidehyā lakṣmaṇena ca
translated: together with Sita, the princess of Videha, and Lakshmana.

original: tān dṛṣṭvā rāghavaḥ śrīmān āgatāṃ tāṃ ca rākṣasīm /
analyzed: tān dṛṣṭvā rāghavaḥ śrīmān āgatām tām ca rākṣasīm
translated: Seeing them and that Rakshasi who had come, the prosperous Rama,

original: abravīd bhrātaraṃ rāmo lakṣmaṇaṃ dīptatejasam // / / //
analyzed: abravīt bhrātaram rāmaḥ lakṣmaṇam dīpta tejasam
translated: spoke to his brother Lakshmana, who was blazing with splendor:

original: muhūrtaṃ bhava saumitre sītāyāḥ pratyanantaraḥ /
analyzed: muhūrtam bhava saumitre sītāyāḥ pratyanantaraḥ
translated: O son of Sumitra, stay here for a moment, close to Sita.

original: imān asyā vadhiṣyāmi padavīm āgatān iha // / / //
analyzed: imān asyāḥ vadhiṣyāmi padavīm āgatān iha
translated: I will kill these who have come within the range of my vision here.

original: vākyam etat tataḥ śrutvā rāmasya viditātmanaḥ /
analyzed: vākyam etat tatas śrutvā rāmasya vidita ātmanaḥ
translated: Having heard these words of Rama, who knew his own self,

original: tatheti lakṣmaṇo vākyaṃ rāmasya pratyapūjayat // / / //
analyzed: tathā iti lakṣmaṇaḥ vākyam rāmasya pratyapūjayat
translated: Lakshmana replied to Rama's words, saying, So be it.

original: rāghavo 'pi mahac cāpaṃ cāmīkaravibhūṣitam /
analyzed: rāghavaḥ pi mahat cāpam cāmīkara vibhūṣitam
translated: Raghava also, the righteous one, strung his great bow, adorned with gold,

original: cakāra sajyaṃ dharmātmā tāni rakṣāṃsi cābravīt // / / //
analyzed: cakāra sajyam dharma ātmā tāni rakṣāṃsi ca abravīt
translated: and spoke to those demons, saying,

original: putrau daśarathasyāvāṃ bhrātarau rāmalakṣmaṇau /
analyzed: putrau daśarathasya āvām bhrātarau rāma lakṣmaṇau
translated: We are the two sons of Dasharatha, the brothers Rama and Lakshmana,

original: praviṣṭau sītayā sārdhaṃ duścaraṃ daṇḍakāvanam // / / //
analyzed: praviṣṭau sītayā sārdham duścaram daṇḍaka vanam
translated: who have entered the impassable Dandaka forest along with Sita.

original: phalamūlāśanau dāntau tāpasau dharmacāriṇau /
analyzed: phala mūla aśanau dāntau tāpasau dharma cāriṇau
translated: Subsisting on fruits and roots, self-controlled, ascetics, following dharma,

original: vasantau daṇḍakāraṇye kimartham upahiṃsatha // / / //🔽yuṣmān pāpātmakān hantuṃ viprakārān mahāvane /
analyzed: vasantau daṇḍaka araṇye kimartham upahiṃsatha  yuṣmān pāpa ātmakān hantum viprakārān mahā vane
translated: dwelling in the Dandaka forest, why do you harm us?🔽I have come here with my bow and arrows, on the order of the sages,

original: ṛṣīṇāṃ tu niyogena prāpto 'haṃ saśarāsanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ṛṣīṇām tu niyogena prāptaḥ ham sa śarāsanaḥ
translated: to kill you evil-minded ones who are causing trouble in this great forest.

original: tiṣṭhataivātra saṃtuṣṭā nopasarpitum arhatha /
analyzed: tiṣṭhata eva atra saṃtuṣṭāḥ na upasarpitum arhatha
translated: Stay here content, you should not approach me.

original: yadi prāṇair ihārtho vo nivartadhvaṃ niśācarāḥ // / / //
analyzed: yadi prāṇaiḥ iha arthaḥ vaḥ nivartadhvam niśācarāḥ
translated: If you value your lives here, turn back, O wanderers of the night.

original: tasya tadvacanaṃ śrutvā rākṣasās te caturdaśa /
analyzed: tasya tat vacanam śrutvā rākṣasāḥ te caturdaśa
translated: Hearing his words, those fourteen Rakshasas,

original: ūcur vācaṃ susaṃkruddhā brahmaghnāḥ śūlapāṇayaḥ // / / //🔽saṃraktanayanā ghorā rāmaṃ raktāntalocanam /
analyzed: ūcuḥ vācam su saṃkruddhāḥ brahma ghnāḥ śūla pāṇayaḥ  saṃrakta nayanāḥ ghorāḥ rāmam rakta anta locanam
translated: the slayers of Brahmanas, armed with spears, spoke in great anger.🔽With eyes reddened in wrath, terrible, with eyes red at the corners,

original: paruṣāmadhurābhāṣaṃ hṛṣṭā dṛṣṭaparākramam // / / //
analyzed: paruṣa amadhura ābhāṣam hṛṣṭāḥ dṛṣṭa parākramam
translated: sweet-speeched, delighted, their prowess seen,

original: krodham utpādya no bhartuḥ kharasya sumahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: krodham utpādya naḥ bhartuḥ kharasya su mahātmanaḥ
translated: having excited the wrath of our lord, the great Khara,

original: tvam eva hāsyase prāṇān adyāsmābhir hato yudhi // / / //
analyzed: tvam eva hāsyase prāṇān adya asmābhiḥ hataḥ yudhi
translated: you will today lose your life, slain by us in battle.

original: kā hi te śaktir ekasya bahūnāṃ raṇamūrdhani /
analyzed: kā hi te śaktiḥ ekasya bahūnām raṇa mūrdhani
translated: What power have you, alone, in the midst of many, on the field of battle?

original: asmākam agrataḥ sthātuṃ kiṃ punar yoddhum āhave // / / //
analyzed: asmākam agratas sthātum kim punar yoddhum āhave
translated: How much less can you stand before us, much less fight in battle?

original: ebhir bāhuprayuktair naḥ parighaiḥ śūlapaṭṭiśaiḥ /
analyzed: ebhiḥ bāhu prayuktaiḥ naḥ parighaiḥ śūla paṭṭiśaiḥ
translated: With these iron clubs, spears and axes, hurled by our arms,

original: prāṇāṃs tyakṣyasi vīryaṃ ca dhanuś ca karapīḍitam // / / //
analyzed: prāṇān tyakṣyasi vīryam ca dhanuḥ ca kara pīḍitam
translated: you will give up your life, your prowess and your bow, pressed by our hands.

original: ity evam uktvā saṃrabdhā rākṣasās te caturdaśa /🔽udyatāyudhanistriṃśā rāmam evābhidudruvuḥ /
analyzed: iti evam uktvā saṃrabdhāḥ rākṣasāḥ te caturdaśa  udyata āyudha nistriṃśāḥ rāmam eva abhidudruvuḥ
translated: Having spoken thus, those fourteen enraged Rakshasas,🔽with uplifted weapons and swords, rushed towards Rama.

original: cikṣipus tāni śūlāni rāghavaṃ prati durjayam // / / //
analyzed: cikṣipuḥ tāni śūlāni rāghavam prati durjayam
translated: They hurled those spears at the invincible Raghava.

original: tāni śūlāni kākutsthaḥ samastāni caturdaśa /
analyzed: tāni śūlāni kākutsthaḥ samastāni caturdaśa
translated: Kakutstha (Rama) destroyed all those fourteen spears,

original: tāvadbhir eva cicheda śaraiḥ kāñcanabhūṣaṇaiḥ // / / //🔽tataḥ paścān mahātejā nārācān sūryasaṃnibhān /
analyzed: tāvadbhiḥ eva cicheda śaraiḥ kāñcana bhūṣaṇaiḥ  tatas paścāt mahā tejāḥ nārācān sūrya saṃnibhān
translated: with as many arrows adorned with gold.🔽Then, the greatly energetic one, extremely angry,

original: jagrāha paramakruddhaś caturdaśa śilāśitān // / / //🔽gṛhītvā dhanur āyamya lakṣyān uddiśya rākṣasān /
analyzed: jagrāha parama kruddhaḥ caturdaśa śilā śitān  gṛhītvā dhanuḥ āyamya lakṣyān uddiśya rākṣasān
translated: took fourteen iron arrows sharpened on stone, resembling the sun.🔽Taking the bow and aiming at the demons as the target,

original: mumoca rāghavo bāṇān vajrān iva śatakratuḥ // / / //
analyzed: mumoca rāghavaḥ bāṇān vajrān iva śatakratuḥ
translated: Raghava released the arrows like Shatakratu (Indra) with his thunderbolt.

original: rukmapuṅkhāś ca viśikhāḥ pradīptā hemabhūṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: rukma puṅkhāḥ ca viśikhāḥ pradīptāḥ hema bhūṣaṇāḥ
translated: The gold-tufted arrows, blazing and adorned with gold,

original: antarikṣe maholkānāṃ babhūvus tulyavarcasaḥ // / / //🔽te bhittvā rakṣasāṃ vegād vakṣāṃsi rudhirāplutāḥ /
analyzed: antarikṣe mahā ulkānām babhūvuḥ tulya varcasaḥ  te bhittvā rakṣasām vegāt vakṣāṃsi rudhira āplutāḥ
translated: in the sky had the same radiance as the great meteors.🔽Having pierced the chests of the demons with force, covered in blood,

original: viniṣpetus tadā bhūmau nyamajjantāśanisvanāḥ // / / //🔽te bhinnahṛdayā bhūmau chinnamūlā iva drumāḥ /
analyzed: viniṣpetuḥ tadā bhūmau nyamajjanta aśani svanāḥ  te bhinna hṛdayāḥ bhūmau chinna mūlāḥ iva drumāḥ
translated: they then fell down on the ground, sinking with the sound of thunder.🔽With their hearts pierced, they fell on the ground like trees with their roots cut,

original: nipetuḥ śoṇitārdrāṅgā vikṛtā vigatāsavaḥ // / / //🔽tān bhūmau patitān dṛṣṭvā rākṣasī krodhamūrchitā /🔽paritrastā punas tatra vyasṛjad bhairavaṃ ravam // / / //
analyzed: nipetuḥ śoṇita ārdra aṅgāḥ vikṛtāḥ vigata asavaḥ  tān bhūmau patitān dṛṣṭvā rākṣasī krodha mūrchitā  paritrastā punar tatra vyasṛjat bhairavam ravam
translated: their bodies wet with blood, disfigured, and devoid of life.🔽Seeing them fallen on the ground, the demoness, beside herself with rage,🔽terrified, again let out a terrible cry.

original: sā nadantī mahānādaṃ javāc chūrpaṇakhā punaḥ /
analyzed: sā nadantī mahā nādam javāt śūrpaṇakhā punar
translated: Roaring that great roar, Shurpanakha again quickly,

original: upagamya kharaṃ sā tu kiṃcit saṃśuṣkaśoṇitā /
analyzed: upagamya kharam sā tu kiṃcid saṃśuṣka śoṇitā
translated: Approaching Khara, she, with a little blood dried up,

original: papāta punar evārtā saniryāseva vallarī // / / //
analyzed: papāta punar eva ārtā sa niryāsā iva vallarī
translated: fell down again, afflicted, like a creeper with its juice oozing out.

original: nipātitān prekṣya raṇe tu rākṣasān pradhāvitā śūrpaṇakhā punas tataḥ /
analyzed: nipātitān prekṣya raṇe tu rākṣasān pradhāvitā śūrpaṇakhā punar tatas
translated: Seeing the demons fallen in the battle, Shurpanakha again ran (to Khara).

original: vadhaṃ ca teṣāṃ nikhilena rakṣasāṃ śaśaṃsa sarvaṃ bhaginī kharasya sā // / / //🔽sa punaḥ patitāṃ dṛṣṭvā krodhāc chūrpaṇakhāṃ kharaḥ /
analyzed: vadham ca teṣām nikhilena rakṣasām śaśaṃsa sarvam bhaginī kharasya sā  sa punar patitām dṛṣṭvā krodhāt śūrpaṇakhām kharaḥ
translated: And she, Khara's sister, told him in detail the killing of all the demons.

original: uvāca vyaktayā vācā tām anarthārtham āgatām // / / //🔽mayā tv idānīṃ śūrās te rākṣasā rudhirāśanāḥ /
analyzed: uvāca vyaktayā vācā tām anartha artham āgatām  mayā tu idānīm śūrāḥ te rākṣasāḥ rudhira aśanāḥ
translated: Khara, seeing Shurpanakha fallen again, spoke to her, who had come for her own destruction, with a distinct voice out of anger.

original: tvatpriyārthaṃ vinirdiṣṭāḥ kimarthaṃ rudyate punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tvad priya artham vinirdiṣṭāḥ kimartham rudyate punar
translated: But now, for your sake, I have ordered those heroic demons, who live on blood, (to kill Rama and Lakshmana). Why do you weep again?

original: bhaktāś caivānuraktāś ca hitāś ca mama nityaśaḥ /
analyzed: bhaktāḥ ca eva anuraktāḥ ca hitāḥ ca mama nityaśas
translated: They are devoted to me, attached to me, and always beneficial to me.

original: ghnanto 'pi na nihantavyā na na kuryur vaco mama // / / //
analyzed: ghnantaḥ pi na nihantavyāḥ na na kuryuḥ vacaḥ mama
translated: Even if they kill (Rama and Lakshmana), they should not be killed. They should not disobey my words.

original: kim etac chrotum icchāmi kāraṇaṃ yatkṛte punaḥ /
analyzed: kim etat śrotum icchāmi kāraṇam yad kṛte punar
translated: I wish to hear the reason for which you are weeping again, saying, Alas, my lord!

original: hā nātheti vinardantī sarpavad veṣṭase kṣitau // / / //
analyzed: hā nātha iti vinardantī sarpa vat veṣṭase kṣitau
translated: And are writhing on the ground like a snake.

original: anāthavad vilapasi kiṃ nu nāthe mayi sthite /
analyzed: anātha vat vilapasi kim nu nāthe mayi sthite
translated: Why do you lament like one without a protector, when I, your protector, am here?

original: uttiṣṭhottiṣṭha mā bhaiṣīr vaiklavyaṃ tyajyatām iha // / / //🔽ity evam uktā durdharṣā khareṇa parisāntvitā /
analyzed: uttiṣṭha uttiṣṭha mā bhaiṣīḥ vaiklavyam tyajyatām iha  iti evam uktā durdharṣā khareṇa parisāntvitā
translated: Arise, arise, do not be afraid, let this dejection be cast off.🔽Thus addressed by Khara, the invincible one, consoled by Khara,

original: vimṛjya nayane sāsre kharaṃ bhrātaram abravīt // / / //
analyzed: vimṛjya nayane sa asre kharam bhrātaram abravīt
translated: wiping her tearful eyes, spoke to her brother Khara.

original: preṣitāś ca tvayā śūrā rākṣasās te caturdaśa /
analyzed: preṣitāḥ ca tvayā śūrāḥ rākṣasāḥ te caturdaśa
translated: And those fourteen terrible demons, sent by you,

original: nihantuṃ rāghavaṃ ghorā matpriyārthaṃ salakṣmaṇam // / / //🔽te tu rāmeṇa sāmarṣāḥ śūlapaṭṭiśapāṇayaḥ /
analyzed: nihantum rāghavam ghorāḥ mad priya artham sa lakṣmaṇam  te tu rāmeṇa sa amarṣāḥ śūla paṭṭiśa pāṇayaḥ
translated: for my sake, to kill Raghava along with Lakshmana,🔽they, filled with rage, with spears and axes in their hands,

original: samare nihatāḥ sarve sāyakair marmabhedibhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: samare nihatāḥ sarve sāyakaiḥ marma bhedibhiḥ
translated: all were killed in battle by Rama with his arrows that penetrate the vital parts.

original: tān bhūmau patitān dṛṣṭvā kṣaṇenaiva mahābalān /🔽rāmasya ca mahat karma mahāṃs trāso 'bhavan mama // / / //
analyzed: tān bhūmau patitān dṛṣṭvā kṣaṇena eva mahā balān  rāmasya ca mahat karma mahān trāsaḥ bhavan mama
translated: Seeing those greatly powerful ones fallen on the ground in an instant,🔽and seeing Rama's great deed, great fear arose in me.

original: sāsmi bhītā samudvignā viṣaṇṇā ca niśācara /
analyzed: sā asmi bhītā samudvignā viṣaṇṇā ca niśācara
translated: I am afraid, anxious, and distressed, O demon of the night,

original: śaraṇaṃ tvāṃ punaḥ prāptā sarvato bhayadarśinī // / / //🔽viṣādanakrādhyuṣite paritrāsormimālini /
analyzed: śaraṇam tvām punar prāptā sarvatas bhaya darśinī  viṣāda nakra adhyuṣite paritrāsa ūrmi mālini
translated: again seeking refuge in you, seeing danger on all sides.🔽In this vast ocean of grief, full of crocodiles of sorrow, with a garland of waves of terror,

original: kiṃ māṃ na trāyase magnāṃ vipule śokasāgare // / / //
analyzed: kim mām na trāyase magnām vipule śoka sāgare
translated: why do you not save me who is sinking?

original: ete ca nihatā bhūmau rāmeṇa niśitaiḥ śaraiḥ /
analyzed: ete ca nihatāḥ bhūmau rāmeṇa niśitaiḥ śaraiḥ
translated: And these, killed on the ground by Rama with sharp arrows,

original: ye ca me padavīṃ prāptā rākṣasāḥ piśitāśanāḥ // / / //
analyzed: ye ca me padavīm prāptāḥ rākṣasāḥ piśita aśanāḥ
translated: And those demons and flesh-eaters who have come under my sway,

original: mayi te yady anukrośo yadi rakṣaḥsu teṣu ca /
analyzed: mayi te yadi anukrośaḥ yadi rakṣaḥsu teṣu ca
translated: If you have any compassion for me, and for those demons,

original: rāmeṇa yadi śaktis te tejo vāsti niśācara /
analyzed: rāmeṇa yadi śaktiḥ te tejaḥ vā asti niśācara
translated: If you have the power, O night-wanderer, and the energy,

original: daṇḍakāraṇyanilayaṃ jahi rākṣasakaṇṭakam // / / //
analyzed: daṇḍaka araṇya nilayam jahi rākṣasa kaṇṭakam
translated: Destroy the thorn of the demons dwelling in the Dandaka forest.

original: yadi rāmaṃ mamāmitram adya tvaṃ na vadhiṣyasi /
analyzed: yadi rāmam mama amitram adya tvam na vadhiṣyasi
translated: If you will not kill Rama, my enemy, today,

original: tava caivāgrataḥ prāṇāṃs tyakṣyāmi nirapatrapā // / / //
analyzed: tava ca eva agratas prāṇān tyakṣyāmi nirapatrapā
translated: I will cast off my life in front of you, without shame.

original: buddhyāham anupaśyāmi na tvaṃ rāmasya saṃyuge /
analyzed: buddhyā aham anupaśyāmi na tvam rāmasya saṃyuge
translated: I see with my intellect that you are not able to stand before Rama,

original: sthātuṃ pratimukhe śaktaḥ sacāpasya mahāraṇe // / / //
analyzed: sthātum pratimukhe śaktaḥ sa cāpasya mahā raṇe
translated: With his bow, in the great battle.

original: śūramānī na śūras tvaṃ mithyāropitavikramaḥ /
analyzed: śūra mānī na śūraḥ tvam mithyā āropita vikramaḥ
translated: You are not a hero, though you think yourself one, your valor falsely assumed,

original: mānuṣau yan na śaknoṣi hantuṃ tau rāmalakṣmaṇau // / / //
analyzed: mānuṣau yat na śaknoṣi hantum tau rāma lakṣmaṇau
translated: Since you cannot kill those two humans, Rama and Lakshmana.

original: apayāhi janasthānāt tvaritaḥ sahabāndhavaḥ /
analyzed: apayāhi janasthānāt tvaritaḥ sahabāndhavaḥ
translated: Depart quickly from Janasthana with your relatives,

original: niḥsattvasyālpavīryasya vāsas te kīdṛśas tv iha // / / //
analyzed: niḥsattvasya alpa vīryasya vāsaḥ te kīdṛśaḥ tu iha
translated: What kind of dwelling can you have here, being devoid of courage and having little valor?

original: rāmatejo'bhibhūto hi tvaṃ kṣipraṃ vinaśiṣyasi /
analyzed: rāma tejaḥ abhibhūtaḥ hi tvam kṣipram vinaśiṣyasi
translated: For you will soon be destroyed, overwhelmed by Rama's splendor.

original: sa hi tejaḥsamāyukto rāmo daśarathātmajaḥ /
analyzed: sa hi tejaḥ samāyuktaḥ rāmaḥ daśaratha ātmajaḥ
translated: Rama, Dasharatha's son, is endowed with energy,

original: bhrātā cāsya mahāvīryo yena cāsmi virūpitā // / / //
analyzed: bhrātā ca asya mahā vīryaḥ yena ca asmi virūpitā
translated: And his brother, who is very powerful, by whom I have been disfigured.

original: evam ādharṣitaḥ śūraḥ śūrpaṇakhyā kharas tadā /
analyzed: evam ādharṣitaḥ śūraḥ śūrpaṇakhyā kharaḥ tadā
translated: Thus insulted by Shurpanakha, the brave Khara,

original: uvāca rakṣasāṃ madhye kharaḥ kharataraṃ vacaḥ // / / //
analyzed: uvāca rakṣasām madhye kharaḥ kharataram vacaḥ
translated: in the midst of the demons, spoke harsh words:

original: tavāpamānaprabhavaḥ krodho 'yam atulo mama /
analyzed: tava apamāna prabhavaḥ krodhaḥ yam atulaḥ mama
translated: This incomparable anger of mine arises from your insult.

original: na śakyate dhārayituṃ lavaṇāmbha ivotthitam // / / //
analyzed: na śakyate dhārayitum lavaṇa ambhaḥ iva utthitam
translated: It cannot be contained, like water rising from the salt ocean.

original: na rāmaṃ gaṇaye vīryān mānuṣaṃ kṣīṇajīvitam /
analyzed: na rāmam gaṇaye vīryāt mānuṣam kṣīṇa jīvitam
translated: I do not consider Rama to be a human of exhausted life.

original: ātmā duścaritaiḥ prāṇān hato yo 'dya vimokṣyati // / / //
analyzed: ātmā duścaritaiḥ prāṇān hataḥ yaḥ vimokṣyati
translated: He will today give up his life, killed by his own misdeeds.

original: bāṣpaḥ saṃhriyatām eṣa sambhramaś ca vimucyatām /
analyzed: bāṣpaḥ saṃhriyatām eṣa sambhramaḥ ca vimucyatām
translated: Let this tear be wiped away and this agitation be cast off.

original: ahaṃ rāmaṃ saha bhrātrā nayāmi yamasādanam // / / //🔽paraśvadhahatasyādya mandaprāṇasya bhūtale /
analyzed: aham rāmam saha bhrātrā nayāmi yama sādanam  paraśvadha hatasya adya manda prāṇasya bhū tale
translated: I will send Rama along with his brother to Yama's abode.

original: rāmasya rudhiraṃ raktam uṣṇaṃ pāsyasi rākṣasi // / / //🔽sā prahṛṣṭā vacaḥ śrutvā kharasya vadanāc cyutam /
analyzed: rāmasya rudhiram raktam uṣṇam pāsyasi rākṣasi  sā prahṛṣṭā vacaḥ śrutvā kharasya vadanāt cyutam
translated: Today, O demoness, you will drink the warm blood of Rama, whose life is feeble, struck down by the axe on the ground.🔽Having heard those words of joy issuing from Khara's mouth,

original: praśaśaṃsa punar maurkhyād bhrātaraṃ rakṣasāṃ varam // / / //
analyzed: praśaśaṃsa punar maurkhyāt bhrātaram rakṣasām varam
translated: she again praised her brother, the best of the demons, out of foolishness.

original: tayā paruṣitaḥ pūrvaṃ punar eva praśaṃsitaḥ /
analyzed: tayā paruṣitaḥ pūrvam punar eva praśaṃsitaḥ
translated: Having been insulted before, and then praised again,

original: abravīd dūṣaṇaṃ nāma kharaḥ senāpatiṃ tadā // / / //
analyzed: abravīt dūṣaṇam nāma kharaḥ senāpatim tadā
translated: And spoke to Dushana, named Khara, the commander then:

original: caturdaśa sahasrāṇi mama cittānuvartinām /
analyzed: caturdaśa sahasrāṇi mama citta anuvartinām
translated: I have fourteen thousand followers who obey my commands,

original: rakṣasāṃ bhīmavegānāṃ samareṣv anivartinām // / / //
analyzed: rakṣasām bhīma vegānām samareṣu anivartinām
translated: Rakshasas of terrible speed, who never retreat from battle.

original: nīlajīmūtavarṇānāṃ ghorāṇāṃ krūrakarmaṇām /
analyzed: nīla jīmūta varṇānām ghorāṇām krūra karmaṇām
translated: They are the color of dark rain clouds, terrible, of cruel deeds,

original: lokahiṃsāvihārāṇāṃ balinām ugratejasām // / / //
analyzed: loka hiṃsā vihārāṇām balinām ugra tejasām
translated: Who delight in injuring people, powerful, of fierce splendor.

original: teṣāṃ śārdūladarpāṇāṃ mahāsyānāṃ mahaujasām /
analyzed: teṣām śārdūla darpāṇām mahā āsyānām mahā ojasām
translated: They are proud as tigers, with large mouths, great strength,

original: sarvodyogam udīrṇānāṃ rakṣasāṃ saumya kāraya // / / //
analyzed: sarva udyogam udīrṇānām rakṣasām saumya kāraya
translated: And are ready to make every effort, O gentle one, of the Rakshasas.

original: upasthāpaya me kṣipraṃ rathaṃ saumya dhanūṃṣi ca /
analyzed: upasthāpaya me kṣipram ratham saumya dhanūṃṣi ca
translated: Quickly prepare for me, O gentle one, the chariot, the bows,

original: śarāṃś ca citrān khaḍgāṃś ca śaktīś ca vividhāḥ śitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: śarān ca citrān khaḍgān ca śaktīḥ ca vividhāḥ śitāḥ
translated: And various sharp arrows, swords and spears.

original: agre niryātum icchāmi paulastyānāṃ mahātmanām /
analyzed: agre niryātum icchāmi paulastyānām mahātmanām
translated: I wish to go out in front of the great-souled descendants of Pulastya,

original: vadhārthaṃ durvinītasya rāmasya raṇakovidaḥ // / / //🔽iti tasya bruvāṇasya sūryavarṇaṃ mahāratham /
analyzed: vadha artham durvinītasya rāmasya raṇa kovidaḥ  iti tasya bruvāṇasya sūrya varṇam mahā ratham
translated: To kill the ill-behaved Rama, skilled in battle.🔽When he said this, Dushana described to him the great chariot of the color of the sun,

original: sadaśvaiḥ śabalair yuktam ācacakṣe 'tha dūṣaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sat aśvaiḥ śabalaiḥ yuktam ācacakṣe tha dūṣaṇaḥ
translated: Yoked with dappled excellent horses.

original: taṃ meruśikharākāraṃ taptakāñcanabhūṣaṇam /
analyzed: tam meru śikhara ākāram tapta kāñcana bhūṣaṇam
translated: He, who was like the peak of Mount Meru, adorned with molten gold,

original: hemacakram asaṃbādhaṃ vaidūryamayakūbaram // / / //
analyzed: hema cakram asaṃbādham vaidūrya maya kūbaram
translated: With golden wheels, unobstructed, with a pole made of lapis lazuli.

original: matsyaiḥ puṣpair drumaiḥ śailaiś candrasūryaiś ca kāñcanaiḥ /🔽māṅgalyaiḥ pakṣisaṃghaiś ca tārābhiś ca samāvṛtam // / / //
analyzed: matsyaiḥ puṣpaiḥ drumaiḥ śailaiḥ candra sūryaiḥ ca kāñcanaiḥ  māṅgalyaiḥ pakṣi saṃghaiḥ ca tārābhiḥ ca samāvṛtam
translated: With fish, flowers, trees, mountains, the golden moon and sun,🔽Surrounded by auspicious flocks of birds and stars.

original: dhvajanistriṃśasampannaṃ kiṅkiṇīkavibhūṣitam /
analyzed: dhvaja nistriṃśa sampannam kiṅkiṇīka vibhūṣitam
translated: Equipped with flags and swords, adorned with tinkling bells,

original: sadaśvayuktaṃ so 'marṣād āruroha rathaṃ kharaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sat aśva yuktam saḥ marṣāt āruroha ratham kharaḥ
translated: Khara, out of impatience, mounted the chariot yoked with good horses.

original: niśāmya taṃ rathagataṃ rākṣasā bhīmavikramāḥ /
analyzed: niśāmya tam ratha gatam rākṣasāḥ bhīma vikramāḥ
translated: Seeing him on the chariot, the demons of terrible prowess,

original: tasthuḥ saṃparivāryainaṃ dūṣaṇaṃ ca mahābalam // / / //🔽kharas tu tān maheṣvāsān ghoracarmāyudhadhvajān /
analyzed: tasthuḥ saṃparivārya enam dūṣaṇam ca mahā balam  kharaḥ tu tān mahā iṣvāsān ghora carma āyudha dhvajān
translated: Stood surrounding him and the greatly powerful Dushana.🔽But Khara, seeing all those demons with terrible armor, weapons and flags,

original: niryātety abravīd dṛṣṭvā rathasthaḥ sarvarākṣasān // / / //
analyzed: niryāta iti abravīt dṛṣṭvā ratha sthaḥ sarva rākṣasān
translated: Standing on the chariot, said, Go out!

original: tatas tad rākṣasaṃ sainyaṃ ghoracarmāyudhadhvajam /
analyzed: tatas tat rākṣasam sainyam ghora carma āyudha dhvajam
translated: Then that demon army with terrible armor, weapons and flags,

original: nirjagāma janasthānān mahānādaṃ mahājavam // / / //🔽mudgaraiḥ paṭṭiśaiḥ śūlaiḥ sutīkṣṇaiś ca paraśvadhaiḥ /
analyzed: nirjagāma janasthānāt mahā nādam mahā javam  mudgaraiḥ paṭṭiśaiḥ śūlaiḥ su tīkṣṇaiḥ ca paraśvadhaiḥ
translated: With a loud roar and great speed, went out of Janasthana.🔽With hammers, axes, spears and very sharp axes,

original: khaḍgaiś cakraiś ca hastasthair bhrājamānaiś ca tomaraiḥ // / / //
analyzed: khaḍgaiḥ cakraiḥ ca hasta sthaiḥ bhrājamānaiḥ ca tomaraiḥ
translated: With swords, discuses in hand, and shining lances.

original: śaktibhiḥ parighair ghorair atimātraiś ca kārmukaiḥ /
analyzed: śaktibhiḥ parighaiḥ ghoraiḥ atimātraiḥ ca kārmukaiḥ
translated: With spears, terrible iron clubs, and extremely large bows,

original: gadāsimusalair vajrair gṛhītair bhīmadarśanaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: gadā asi musalaiḥ vajraiḥ gṛhītaiḥ bhīma darśanaiḥ
translated: With maces, swords, pestles, and thunderbolts held in their hands, and with a terrible appearance,

original: rākṣasānāṃ sughorāṇāṃ sahasrāṇi caturdaśa /
analyzed: rākṣasānām su ghorāṇām sahasrāṇi caturdaśa
translated: There were fourteen thousand extremely terrible demons,

original: niryātāni janasthānāt kharacittānuvartinām // / / //
analyzed: niryātāni janasthānāt khara citta anuvartinām
translated: Who had left Janasthana, following Khara's mind.

original: tāṃs tv abhidravato dṛṣṭvā rākṣasān bhīmavikramān /
analyzed: tān tu abhidravataḥ dṛṣṭvā rākṣasān bhīma vikramān
translated: Seeing those demons of terrible prowess rushing towards him,

original: kharasyāpi rathaḥ kiṃcij jagāma tadanantaram // / / //🔽tatas tāñ śabalān aśvāṃs taptakāñcanabhūṣitān /
analyzed: kharasya api rathaḥ kiṃcid jagāma tad anantaram  tatas tām śabalān aśvān tapta kāñcana bhūṣitān
translated: Khara's chariot also went a little way after them.

original: kharasya matam ājñāya sārathiḥ samacodayat // / / //
analyzed: kharasya matam ājñāya sārathiḥ samacodayat
translated: Then, knowing Khara's intention, the charioteer urged those dappled horses adorned with burnished gold.

original: sa codito rathaḥ śīghraṃ kharasya ripughātinaḥ /
analyzed: sa coditaḥ rathaḥ śīghram kharasya ripu ghātinaḥ
translated: The chariot of Khara, the slayer of enemies, thus urged,

original: śabdenāpūrayām āsa diśaḥ pratidiśas tathā // / / //🔽pravṛddhamanyus tu kharaḥ kharasvano ripor vadhārthaṃ tvarito yathāntakaḥ /
analyzed: śabdena āpūrayām āsa diśaḥ pratidiśaḥ tathā  pravṛddha manyuḥ tu kharaḥ khara svanaḥ ripoḥ vadha artham tvaritaḥ yathā antakaḥ
translated: Filled the directions and the intermediate directions with its sound.🔽But Khara, his anger increased, with a harsh voice, quickly like Death for the sake of killing his enemy,

original: acūcudat sārathim unnadan punar mahābalo megha ivāśmavarṣavān // / / //
analyzed: acūcudat sārathim unnadan punar mahā balaḥ meghaḥ iva aśma varṣavān
translated: Urged his charioteer again with a roar, the greatly powerful one like a cloud raining stones.

original: tat prayātaṃ balaṃ ghoram aśivaṃ śoṇitodakam /
analyzed: tat prayātam balam ghoram aśivam śoṇita udakam
translated: That terrible army, inauspicious, with blood for water,

original: abhyavarṣan mahāmeghas tumulo gardabhāruṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: abhyavarṣat mahā meghaḥ tumulaḥ gardabha aruṇaḥ
translated: A tumultuous and terrible cloud rained down.

original: nipetus turagās tasya rathayuktā mahājavāḥ /
analyzed: nipetuḥ turagāḥ tasya ratha yuktāḥ mahā javāḥ
translated: The horses yoked to his chariot, of great speed, fell down.

original: same puṣpacite deśe rājamārge yadṛcchayā // / / //🔽śyāmaṃ rudhiraparyantaṃ babhūva pariveṣaṇam /
analyzed: same puṣpa cite deśe rājamārge yadṛcchayā  śyāmam rudhira paryantam babhūva pariveṣaṇam
translated: On the even and flower-strewn ground, on the royal road, by chance...🔽The halo around the sun became dark, with blood at the edges.

original: alātacakrapratimaṃ pratigṛhya divākaram // / / //🔽tato dhvajam upāgamya hemadaṇḍaṃ samucchritam /
analyzed: alāta cakra pratimam pratigṛhya divākaram  tatas dhvajam upāgamya hema daṇḍam samucchritam
translated: Accepting the sun, which was like a whirling firebrand...🔽Then, approaching the flagstaff with a raised golden staff,

original: samākramya mahākāyas tasthau gṛdhraḥ sudāruṇaḥ // / / //🔽janasthānasamīpe ca samākramya kharasvanāḥ /
analyzed: samākramya mahā kāyaḥ tasthau gṛdhraḥ su dāruṇaḥ  janasthāna samīpe ca samākramya khara svanāḥ
translated: the huge and terrible vulture, having mounted it, stood there...🔽And near Janasthana, the flesh-eating animals and birds, with harsh cries,

original: visvarān vividhāṃś cakrur māṃsādā mṛgapakṣiṇaḥ // / / //🔽vyājahruś ca pradīptāyāṃ diśi vai bhairavasvanam /🔽aśivaṃ yātudhānānāṃ śivā ghorā mahāsvanāḥ // / / //
analyzed: visvarān vividhān cakruḥ māṃsādāḥ mṛga pakṣiṇaḥ  vyājahruḥ ca pradīptāyām diśi vai bhairava svanam  aśivam yātudhānānām śivāḥ ghorāḥ mahā svanāḥ
translated: made various inharmonious sounds...🔽And in the burning direction, the terrible and fearful jackals, with loud cries,🔽howled inauspiciously for the demons...

original: prabhinnagirisaṃkāśās toyaśoṣitadhāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: prabhinna giri saṃkāśāḥ toya śoṣita dhāriṇaḥ
translated: The terrible clouds, resembling mountains with clefts, with their streams dried up by the water,

original: ākāśaṃ tad anākāśaṃ cakrur bhīmā balāhakāḥ // / / //
analyzed: ākāśam tat an ākāśam cakruḥ bhīmāḥ balāhakāḥ
translated: made that sky, which was not sky, with their loud roars...

original: babhūva timiraṃ ghoram uddhataṃ romaharṣaṇam /
analyzed: babhūva timiram ghoram uddhatam roma harṣaṇam
translated: A terrible darkness arose, making the hair stand on end.

original: diśo vā vidiśo vāpi suvyaktaṃ na cakāśire // / / //
analyzed: diśaḥ vā vidiśaḥ vā api su vyaktam na cakāśire
translated: The directions and the intermediate directions did not shine clearly.

original: kṣatajārdrasavarṇābhā saṃdhyākālaṃ vinā babhau /
analyzed: kṣataja ārdra savarṇa ābhā saṃdhyā kālam vinā babhau
translated: The evening twilight appeared as if wet with blood, even without the proper time.

original: kharasyābhimukhaṃ nedus tadā ghorā mṛgāḥ khagāḥ // / / //🔽nityāśivakarā yuddhe śivā ghoranidarśanāḥ /
analyzed: kharasya abhimukham neduḥ tadā ghorāḥ mṛgāḥ khagāḥ  nitya aśiva karāḥ yuddhe śivāḥ ghora nidarśanāḥ
translated: At that time, terrible beasts and birds howled in the direction of Khara.

original: nedur balasyābhimukhaṃ jvālodgāribhir ānanaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: neduḥ balasya abhimukham jvālā udgāribhiḥ ānanaiḥ
translated: The jackals, always inauspicious, howled in the direction of Bala, with faces emitting flames, foreboding terrible omens.

original: kabandhaḥ parighābhāso dṛśyate bhāskarāntike /🔽jagrāha sūryaṃ svarbhānur aparvaṇi mahāgrahaḥ // / / //🔽pravāti mārutaḥ śīghraṃ niṣprabho 'bhūd divākaraḥ /
analyzed: kabandhaḥ parigha ābhāsaḥ dṛśyate bhāskara antike  jagrāha sūryam svarbhānuḥ aparvaṇi mahā grahaḥ  pravāti mārutaḥ śīghram niṣprabhaḥ bhūt divākaraḥ
translated: A headless torso, resembling an iron bar, was seen near the sun.🔽Rahu, the great planet, swallowed the sun at a time other than an eclipse.🔽A strong wind blew, and the sun lost its radiance.

original: utpetuś ca vinā rātriṃ tārāḥ khadyotasaprabhāḥ // / / //🔽saṃlīnamīnavihagā nalinyaḥ puṣpapaṅkajāḥ /
analyzed: utpetuḥ ca vinā rātrim tārāḥ khadyota saprabhāḥ  saṃlīna mīna vihagāḥ nalinyaḥ puṣpa paṅkajāḥ
translated: Stars shining like fireflies appeared in the sky even without night.🔽The lotuses with flowers and mud, and the birds and fish, became still.

original: tasmin kṣaṇe babhūvuś ca vinā puṣpaphalair drumāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmin kṣaṇe babhūvuḥ ca vinā puṣpa phalaiḥ drumāḥ
translated: At that moment, the trees became devoid of flowers and fruits.

original: uddhūtaś ca vinā vātaṃ reṇur jaladharāruṇaḥ /🔽vīcīkūcīti vāśyanto babhūvus tatra sārikāḥ // / / //
analyzed: uddhūtaḥ ca vinā vātam reṇuḥ jaladhara aruṇaḥ  vīcīkūcī iti vāśyantaḥ babhūvuḥ tatra sārikāḥ
translated: Dust, red like rain clouds, was raised by the wind even without it.🔽The myna birds there cried out in a shrill voice.

original: ulkāś cāpi sanirghoṣā nipetur ghoradarśanāḥ /
analyzed: ulkāḥ ca api sa nirghoṣāḥ nipetuḥ ghora darśanāḥ
translated: Meteors fell with a loud noise, appearing terrible.

original: pracacāla mahī cāpi saśailavanakānanā // / / //🔽kharasya ca rathasthasya nardamānasya dhīmataḥ /
analyzed: pracacāla mahī ca api sa śaila vana kānanā  kharasya ca ratha sthasya nardamānasya dhīmataḥ
translated: And the earth trembled with its mountains, forests and groves.🔽And as the wise Khara, stationed on his chariot, was roaring,

original: prākampata bhujaḥ savyaḥ kharaś cāsyāvasajjata // / / //
analyzed: prākampata bhujaḥ savyaḥ kharaḥ ca asya avasajjata
translated: his left arm trembled and Khara became agitated.

original: sāsrā saṃpadyate dṛṣṭiḥ paśyamānasya sarvataḥ /
analyzed: sa asrā saṃpadyate dṛṣṭiḥ paśyamānasya sarvatas
translated: And his vision became filled with tears as he looked around.

original: lalāṭe ca rujā jātā na ca mohān nyavartata // / / //
analyzed: lalāṭe ca rujā jātā na ca mohāt nyavartata
translated: And pain arose on his forehead, but he did not turn back due to delusion.

original: tān samīkṣya mahotpātān utthitān romaharṣaṇān /
analyzed: tān samīkṣya mahā utpātān utthitān roma harṣaṇān
translated: Seeing those great portents arisen, causing the hair to stand on end,

original: abravīd rākṣasān sarvān prahasan sa kharas tadā // / / //
analyzed: abravīt rākṣasān sarvān prahasan sa kharaḥ tadā
translated: Khara, laughing, spoke to all the demons then.

original: mahotpātān imān sarvān utthitān ghoradarśanān /
analyzed: mahā utpātān imān sarvān utthitān ghora darśanān
translated: I do not worry about all these great portents arisen, of a terrible appearance,

original: na cintayāmy ahaṃ vīryād balavān durbalān iva // / / //
analyzed: na cintayāmi aham vīryāt balavān durbalān iva
translated: due to my valor, like a strong person towards the weak.

original: tārā api śarais tīkṣṇaiḥ pātayeyaṃ nabhastalāt /
analyzed: tārāḥ api śaraiḥ tīkṣṇaiḥ pātayeyam nabhastalāt
translated: I would even bring down the stars from the sky with sharp arrows,

original: mṛtyuṃ maraṇadharmeṇa saṃkruddho yojayāmy aham // / / //🔽rāghavaṃ taṃ balotsiktaṃ bhrātaraṃ cāpi lakṣmaṇam /
analyzed: mṛtyum maraṇa dharmeṇa saṃkruddhaḥ yojayāmi aham  rāghavam tam bala utsiktam bhrātaram ca api lakṣmaṇam
translated: and in anger, I would join death with one subject to death.

original: ahatvā sāyakais tīkṣṇair nopāvartitum utsahe // / / //
analyzed: a hatvā sāyakaiḥ tīkṣṇaiḥ na upāvartitum utsahe
translated: I do not dare to return without slaying with sharp arrows that Rāghava, intoxicated with strength, and his brother Lakṣmaṇa.

original: sakāmā bhaginī me 'stu pītvā tu rudhiraṃ tayoḥ /
analyzed: sa kāmā bhaginī me stu pītvā tu rudhiram tayoḥ
translated: Let my sister's desire be fulfilled by drinking their blood.

original: yannimittaṃ tu rāmasya lakṣmaṇasya viparyayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yat nimittam tu rāmasya lakṣmaṇasya viparyayaḥ
translated: For whose sake there is this calamity to Rama and Lakshmana.

original: na kvacit prāptapūrvo me saṃyugeṣu parājayaḥ /
analyzed: na kvacid prāpta pūrvaḥ me saṃyugeṣu parājayaḥ
translated: I have never before suffered defeat in battle anywhere.

original: yuṣmākam etat pratyakṣaṃ nānṛtaṃ kathayāmy aham // / / //
analyzed: yuṣmākam etat pratyakṣam na anṛtam kathayāmi aham
translated: I am telling you this truthfully, not falsely.

original: devarājam api kruddho mattairāvatayāyinam /
analyzed: devarājam api kruddhaḥ matta airāvata yāyinam
translated: Even in anger, I could kill the king of the gods riding on his intoxicated Airāvata,

original: vajrahastaṃ raṇe hanyāṃ kiṃ punas tau ca mānuṣau // / / //
analyzed: vajra hastam raṇe hanyām kim punar tau ca mānuṣau
translated: with the thunderbolt in his hand in battle, let alone those two humans.

original: sā tasya garjitaṃ śrutvā rākṣasasya mahācamūḥ /
analyzed: sā tasya garjitam śrutvā rākṣasasya mahā camūḥ
translated: Having heard the roar of that demon,🔽the great army of demons, bound by the noose of death,

original: praharṣam atulaṃ lebhe mṛtyupāśāvapāśitā // / / //
analyzed: praharṣam atulam lebhe mṛtyu pāśa avapāśitā
translated: obtained incomparable delight.

original: sameyuś ca mahātmāno yuddhadarśanakāṅkṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: sameyuḥ ca mahātmānaḥ yuddha darśana kāṅkṣiṇaḥ
translated: And the magnanimous ones assembled, desirous of witnessing the battle,

original: ṛṣayo devagandharvāḥ siddhāś ca saha cāraṇaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ deva gandharvāḥ siddhāḥ ca saha cāraṇaiḥ
translated: the sages, gods, gandharvas, siddhas, and the celestial nymphs.

original: sametya cocuḥ sahitās te 'nyonyaṃ puṇyakarmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: sametya ca ūcuḥ sahitāḥ te nyonyam puṇya karmaṇaḥ
translated: And having assembled, those virtuous ones said to each other:

original: svasti gobrāhmaṇebhyo 'stu lokānāṃ ye ca saṃmatāḥ // / / //
analyzed: svasti go brāhmaṇebhyaḥ stu lokānām ye ca saṃmatāḥ
translated: May there be well-being to cows and Brahmins, and to those who are revered by the worlds.

original: jayatāṃ rāghavo yuddhe paulastyān rajanīcarān /
analyzed: jayatām rāghavaḥ yuddhe paulastyān rajanīcarān
translated: May Raghava be victorious in battle over the night-stalkers of Pulastya's lineage,

original: cakrahasto yathā yuddhe sarvān asurapuṃgavān // / / //
analyzed: cakra hastaḥ yathā yuddhe sarvān asura puṃgavān
translated: like the one with the discus in his hand was victorious over all the great asuras in battle.

original: etac cānyac ca bahuśo bruvāṇāḥ paramarṣayaḥ /
analyzed: etat ca anyat ca bahuśas bruvāṇāḥ parama ṛṣayaḥ
translated: The supreme sages spoke this and many other things,🔽and having spoken thus,

original: dadṛśur vāhinīṃ teṣāṃ rākṣasānāṃ gatāyuṣām // / / //
analyzed: dadṛśuḥ vāhinīm teṣām rākṣasānām gata āyuṣām
translated: saw the army of the long-lived Rākṣasas.

original: rathena tu kharo vegāt sainyasyāgrād viniḥsṛtaḥ /
analyzed: rathena tu kharaḥ vegāt sainyasya agrāt viniḥsṛtaḥ
translated: But Khara, on his chariot, quickly emerged from the front of the army.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā rākṣasaṃ bhūyo rākṣasāś ca viniḥsṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā rākṣasam bhūyas rākṣasāḥ ca viniḥsṛtāḥ
translated: Seeing that Rākṣasa, the Rākṣasas also emerged again.

original: śyenagāmī pṛthugrīvo yajñaśatrur vihaṃgamaḥ /
translated: Śyenagāmin, Pṛthuग्रीव, Yajñaśatru, Vihaṅgama,

original: durjayaḥ karavīrākṣaḥ paruṣaḥ kālakārmukaḥ // / / //
translated: Durjaya, Karavīrāksha, Pāruṣa, Kālakarmuka,

original: meghamālī mahāmālī sarpāsyo rudhirāśanaḥ /
translated: Meghamāli, Mahāmāli, Sarpāsya, Rudhirāshana -

original: dvādaśaite mahāvīryāḥ pratasthur abhitaḥ kharam // / / //
analyzed: dvādaśā ete mahā vīryāḥ pratasthuḥ abhitas kharam
translated: these twelve greatly valorous ones set out surrounding Khara.

original: mahākapālaḥ sthūlākṣaḥ pramāthī triśirās tathā /
translated: Mahākāpala, Sthūlākṣa, Pramāthin, and Triśiras -

original: catvāra ete senāgryā dūṣaṇaṃ pṛṣṭhato 'nvayuḥ // / / //
analyzed: catvāraḥ ete senā agryāḥ dūṣaṇam pṛṣṭhatas nvayuḥ
translated: these four, the leaders of the army, followed Dūṣaṇa from behind.

original: sā bhīmavegā samarābhikāmā sudāruṇā rākṣasavīrasenā /
analyzed: sā bhīma vegā samara abhikāmā su dāruṇā rākṣasa vīra senā
translated: That terrible army of Rākṣasa heroes, eager for battle and moving with terrible speed,

original: tau rājaputrau sahasābhyupetā mālā grahāṇām iva candrasūryau // / / //
analyzed: tau rāja putrau sahasā abhyupetā mālā grahāṇām iva candra sūryau
translated: suddenly approached those two princes, like the sun and moon approaching the planets.

original: āśramaṃ pratiyāte tu khare kharaparākrame /
analyzed: āśramam pratiyāte tu khare khara parākrame
translated: When Khara, whose valor was like that of a donkey, left for the hermitage,

original: tān evautpātikān rāmaḥ saha bhrātrā dadarśa ha // / / //
analyzed: tān eva autpātikān rāmaḥ saha bhrātrā dadarśa ha
translated: Rāma, along with his brother, saw those very inauspicious omens.

original: tān utpātān mahāghorān utthitān romaharṣaṇān /
analyzed: tān utpātān mahā ghorān utthitān roma harṣaṇān
translated: Seeing those extremely terrible portents arisen, causing the hair to stand on end,

original: prajānām ahitān dṛṣṭvā vākyaṃ lakṣmaṇam abravīt // / / //🔽imān paśya mahābāho sarvabhūtāpahāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: prajānām ahitān dṛṣṭvā vākyam lakṣmaṇam abravīt  imān paśya mahā bāho sarva bhūta apahāriṇaḥ
translated: and seeing them as harmful to the people, he spoke these words to Lakshmana.🔽Look at these, O mighty-armed one, destroying all beings,

original: samutthitān mahotpātān saṃhartuṃ sarvarākṣasān // / / //🔽amī rudhiradhārās tu visṛjantaḥ kharasvanān /
analyzed: samutthitān mahā utpātān saṃhartum sarva rākṣasān  amī rudhira dhārāḥ tu visṛjantaḥ khara svanān
translated: these great portents arisen to destroy all the Rakshasas.🔽These clouds in the sky, emitting blood-red streams with a harsh sound,

original: vyomni meghā vivartante paruṣā gardabhāruṇāḥ // / / //
analyzed: vyomni meghāḥ vivartante paruṣāḥ gardabha aruṇāḥ
translated: are whirling about, tawny like a she-ass.

original: sadhūmāś ca śarāḥ sarve mama yuddhābhinandinaḥ /
analyzed: sa dhūmāḥ ca śarāḥ sarve mama yuddha abhinandinaḥ
translated: And all my arrows, delighting in battle, are smoky,

original: rukmapṛṣṭhāni cāpāni viveṣṭante ca lakṣmaṇa // / / //
analyzed: rukma pṛṣṭhāni cāpāni viveṣṭante ca lakṣmaṇa
translated: and the bows with golden backs are trembling, O Lakshmana.

original: yādṛśā iha kūjanti pakṣiṇo vanacāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: yādṛśāḥ iha kūjanti pakṣiṇaḥ vana cāriṇaḥ
translated: As these forest-roaming birds are cawing here,

original: agrato no bhayaṃ prāptaṃ saṃśayo jīvitasya ca // / / //
analyzed: agratas naḥ bhayam prāptam saṃśayaḥ jīvitasya ca
translated: we will face danger ahead, and there is doubt about our survival.

original: samprahāras tu sumahān bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: samprahāraḥ tu su mahān bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
translated: There will undoubtedly be a great battle.🔽This arm of mine, throbbing again and again,

original: ayam ākhyāti me bāhuḥ sphuramāṇo muhur muhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: ayam ākhyāti me bāhuḥ sphuramāṇaḥ muhur muhur
translated: announces this to me.

original: saṃnikarṣe tu naḥ śūra jayaṃ śatroḥ parājayam /
analyzed: saṃnikarṣe tu naḥ śūra jayam śatroḥ parājayam
translated: O hero, in our proximity, victory for us and defeat for the enemy,

original: suprabhaṃ ca prasannaṃ ca tava vaktraṃ hi lakṣyate // / / //
analyzed: su prabham ca prasannam ca tava vaktram hi lakṣyate
translated: and your face is seen to be very bright and cheerful.

original: udyatānāṃ hi yuddhārthaṃ yeṣāṃ bhavati lakṣmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: udyatānām hi yuddha artham yeṣām bhavati lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: For those who have Lakshmana as their mark in battle,

original: niṣprabhaṃ vadanaṃ teṣāṃ bhavaty āyuḥparikṣayaḥ // / / //🔽anāgatavidhānaṃ tu kartavyaṃ śubham icchatā /
analyzed: niṣprabham vadanam teṣām bhavati āyuḥ parikṣayaḥ  anāgata vidhānam tu kartavyam śubham icchatā
translated: O Lakshmana! Those whose faces become lustreless when they are ready for battle, their life is at its end.🔽One who desires his own welfare should make provisions for the future.

original: āpadaṃ śaṅkamānena puruṣeṇa vipaścitā // / / //
analyzed: āpadam śaṅkamānena puruṣeṇa vipaścitā
translated: A wise man should be apprehensive of danger.

original: tasmād gṛhītvā vaidehīṃ śarapāṇir dhanurdharaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt gṛhītvā vaidehīm śara pāṇiḥ dhanuḥ dharaḥ
translated: Therefore, taking Vaidehi, with arrows in hand, and holding a bow,

original: guhām āśraya śailasya durgāṃ pādapasaṃkulām // / / //
analyzed: guhām āśraya śailasya durgām pādapa saṃkulām
translated: take shelter in a cave in the mountain, difficult to access and filled with trees.

original: pratikūlitum icchāmi na hi vākyam idaṃ tvayā /
analyzed: pratikūlitum icchāmi na hi vākyam idam tvayā
translated: I do not wish to disobey your words.

original: śāpito mama pādābhyāṃ gamyatāṃ vatsa māciram // / / //
analyzed: śāpitaḥ mama pādābhyām gamyatām vatsa māciram
translated: Cursed by my feet, go, my child, without delay.

original: evam uktas tu rāmeṇa lakṣmaṇaḥ saha sītayā /
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tu rāmeṇa lakṣmaṇaḥ saha sītayā
translated: Thus addressed by Rama, Lakshmana, together with Sita,

original: śarān ādāya cāpaṃ ca guhāṃ durgāṃ samāśrayat // / / //
analyzed: śarān ādāya cāpam ca guhām durgām samāśrayat
translated: took up his arrows and bow and entered the inaccessible cave.

original: tasmin praviṣṭe tu guhāṃ lakṣmaṇe saha sītayā /
analyzed: tasmin praviṣṭe tu guhām lakṣmaṇe saha sītayā
translated: When Lakshmana had entered the cave with Sita,

original: hanta niryuktam ity uktvā rāmaḥ kavacam āviśat // / / //
analyzed: hanta niryuktam iti uktvā rāmaḥ kavacam āviśat
translated: Rama said, Alas! It is improper, and put on his armor.

original: sa tenāgninikāśena kavacena vibhūṣitaḥ /
analyzed: sa tena agni nikāśena kavacena vibhūṣitaḥ
translated: Adorned with that armor shining like fire,

original: babhūva rāmas timire vidhūmo 'gnir ivotthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: babhūva rāmaḥ timire vidhūmaḥ gniḥ iva utthitaḥ
translated: Rama appeared in the darkness like a smokeless fire rising up.

original: sa cāpam udyamya mahac charān ādāya vīryavān /
analyzed: sa cāpam udyamya mahat śarān ādāya vīryavān
translated: And that powerful one, raising his great bow and taking arrows,

original: babhūvāvasthitas tatra jyāsvanaiḥ pūrayan diśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: babhūva avasthitaḥ tatra jyā svanaiḥ pūrayan diśaḥ
translated: stood there filling the directions with the twang of his bowstring.

original: tato devāḥ sagandharvāḥ siddhāś ca saha cāraṇaiḥ /
analyzed: tatas devāḥ sa gandharvāḥ siddhāḥ ca saha cāraṇaiḥ
translated: Then the gods, together with the gandharvas, the siddhas, and the charanas,

original: ūcuḥ paramasaṃtrastā guhyakāś ca parasparam // / / //
analyzed: ūcuḥ parama saṃtrastāḥ guhyakāḥ ca parasparam
translated: and the guhyakas, extremely frightened, spoke to each other.

original: caturdaśa sahasrāṇi rakṣasāṃ bhīmakarmaṇām /
analyzed: caturdaśa sahasrāṇi rakṣasām bhīma karmaṇām
translated: There are fourteen thousand rakshasas of terrible deeds,

original: ekaś ca rāmo dharmātmā kathaṃ yuddhaṃ bhaviṣyati // / / //🔽tato gambhīranirhrādaṃ ghoravarmāyudhadhvajam /
analyzed: ekaḥ ca rāmaḥ dharma ātmā katham yuddham bhaviṣyati  tatas gambhīra nirhrādam ghora varma āyudha dhvajam
translated: and only one righteous Rama. How will the battle unfold?

original: anīkaṃ yātudhānānāṃ samantāt pratyadṛśyata // / / //
analyzed: anīkam yātudhānānām samantāt pratyadṛśyata
translated: Then an army of yatudhanas was seen all around, with a deep roar, terrible armor, weapons, and standards.

original: siṃhanādaṃ visṛjatām anyonyam abhigarjatām /🔽cāpāni visphārayatāṃ jṛmbhatāṃ cāpy abhīkṣṇaśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: siṃhanādam visṛjatām anyonyam abhigarjatām  cāpāni visphārayatām jṛmbhatām ca api abhīkṣṇaśas
translated: Of those who let out lion roars, roared at each other,🔽stretched their bows, yawned repeatedly,

original: vipraghuṣṭasvanānāṃ ca dundubhīṃś cāpi nighnatām /🔽teṣāṃ sutumulaḥ śabdaḥ pūrayāmāsa tad vanam // / / //
analyzed: vipraghuṣṭa svanānām ca dundubhīn ca api nighnatām  teṣām su tumulaḥ śabdaḥ pūrayāmāsa tat vanam
translated: and shouted and beat their drums,🔽their tumultuous sound filled that forest.

original: tena śabdena vitrastāḥ śvāpadā vanacāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: tena śabdena vitrastāḥ śvāpadāḥ vana cāriṇaḥ
translated: Terrified by that sound, the beasts of prey that roamed the forest

original: dudruvur yatra niḥśabdaṃ pṛṣṭhato nāvalokayan // / / //
analyzed: dudruvuḥ yatra niḥśabdam pṛṣṭhatas na avalokayan
translated: ran where there was no sound, not looking back.

original: tat tv anīkaṃ mahāvegaṃ rāmaṃ samupasarpata /
analyzed: tat tu anīkam mahā vegam rāmam samupasarpata
translated: That army, with great speed, approached Rama,

original: dhṛtanānāpraharaṇaṃ gambhīraṃ sāgaropamam // / / //
analyzed: dhṛta nānā praharaṇam gambhīram sāgara upamam
translated: holding various weapons, deep like the ocean.

original: rāmo 'pi cārayaṃś cakṣuḥ sarvato raṇapaṇḍitaḥ /🔽dadarśa kharasainyaṃ tad yuddhābhimukham udyatam // / / //
analyzed: cārayan cakṣuḥ sarvatas raṇa paṇḍitaḥ  dadarśa khara sainyam tat yuddha abhimukham udyatam
translated: Rama, skilled in battle, looking around in all directions,🔽saw Khara's army ready to fight, facing him.

original: vitatya ca dhanur bhīmaṃ tūṇyāś coddhṛtya sāyakān /
analyzed: vitatya ca dhanuḥ bhīmam tūṇyāḥ ca uddhṛtya sāyakān
translated: Stretching his terrible bow and drawing arrows from his quiver,

original: krodham āhārayat tīvraṃ vadhārthaṃ sarvarakṣasām // / / //
analyzed: krodham āhārayat tīvram vadha artham sarva rakṣasām
translated: he aroused intense anger for the sake of killing all the demons.

original: duṣprekṣyaḥ so 'bhavat kruddho yugāntāgnir iva jvalan /
analyzed: duṣprekṣyaḥ saḥ bhavat kruddhaḥ yugānta agniḥ iva jvalan
translated: He became difficult to look at in his anger, blazing like the fire at the end of an era.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā tejasāviṣṭaṃ prāvyathan vanadevatāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā tejasā āviṣṭam prāvyathan vana devatāḥ
translated: Seeing him possessed by energy, the forest deities trembled.

original: tasya kruddhasya rūpaṃ tu rāmasya dadṛśe tadā /
analyzed: tasya kruddhasya rūpam tu rāmasya dadṛśe tadā
translated: The form of Rama, filled with anger, was seen then,

original: dakṣasyeva kratuṃ hantum udyatasya pinākinaḥ // / / //🔽avaṣṭabdhadhanuṃ rāmaṃ kruddhaṃ ca ripughātinam /🔽dadarśāśramam āgamya kharaḥ saha puraḥsaraiḥ // / / //
analyzed: dakṣasya iva kratum hantum udyatasya pinākinaḥ  avaṣṭabdha dhanum rāmam kruddham ca ripu ghātinam  dadarśa āśramam āgamya kharaḥ saha puraḥsaraiḥ
translated: like that of the wielder of the Pinaka, ready to destroy Daksha's sacrifice.🔽Khara, having come to the hermitage, saw Rama,🔽angry and ready to kill the enemy, with his bow drawn.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā saguṇaṃ cāpam udyamya kharaniḥsvanam /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā sa guṇam cāpam udyamya khara niḥsvanam
translated: Seeing him with his bow drawn, making a harsh sound,

original: rāmasyābhimukhaṃ sūtaṃ codyatām ity acodayat // / / //
analyzed: rāmasya abhimukham sūtam codyatām iti acodayat
translated: And urged the charioteer to drive towards Rama.

original: sa kharasyājñayā sūtas turagān samacodayat /
analyzed: sa kharasya ājñayā sūtaḥ turagān samacodayat
translated: At Khara's command, the charioteer urged the horses

original: yatra rāmo mahābāhur eko dhunvan dhanuḥ sthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yatra rāmaḥ mahā bāhuḥ ekaḥ dhunvan dhanuḥ sthitaḥ
translated: To where the mighty-armed Rama stood alone, twanging his bow.

original: taṃ tu niṣpatitaṃ dṛṣṭvā sarve te rajanīcarāḥ /
analyzed: tam tu niṣpatitam dṛṣṭvā sarve te rajanīcarāḥ
translated: Seeing him emerge, all those night-walkers

original: nardamānā mahānādaṃ sacivāḥ paryavārayan // / / //
analyzed: nardamānāḥ mahā nādam sacivāḥ paryavārayan
translated: Roared loudly and surrounded him, their advisers.

original: sa teṣāṃ yātudhānānāṃ madhye rato gataḥ kharaḥ /
analyzed: sa teṣām yātudhānānām madhye rataḥ gataḥ kharaḥ
translated: Khara, having gone to the midst of those demons,

original: babhūva madhye tārāṇāṃ lohitāṅga ivoditaḥ // / / //
analyzed: babhūva madhye tārāṇām lohitāṅgaḥ iva uditaḥ
translated: Appeared like the rising red-bodied one in the midst of the stars.

original: tatas taṃ bhīmadhanvānaṃ kruddhāḥ sarve niśācarāḥ /
analyzed: tatas tam bhīma dhanvānam kruddhāḥ sarve niśācarāḥ
translated: Then all those angry night-walkers,

original: rāmaṃ nānāvidhaiḥ śastrair abhyavarṣanta durjayam // / / //
analyzed: rāmam nānāvidhaiḥ śastraiḥ abhyavarṣanta durjayam
translated: Showered Rama, the invincible one with a terrible bow, with various weapons.

original: mudgarair āyasaiḥ śūlaiḥ prāsaiḥ khaḍgaiḥ paraśvadhaiḥ /
analyzed: mudgaraiḥ āyasaiḥ śūlaiḥ prāsaiḥ khaḍgaiḥ paraśvadhaiḥ
translated: With iron hammers, spears, javelins, swords and axes,

original: rākṣasāḥ samare rāmaṃ nijaghnū roṣatatparāḥ // / / //
analyzed: rākṣasāḥ samare rāmam nijaghnuḥ roṣa tatparāḥ
translated: The demons, intent on anger, struck Rama in the battle.

original: te balāhakasaṃkāśā mahānādā mahābalāḥ /
analyzed: te balāhaka saṃkāśāḥ mahā nādāḥ mahā balāḥ
translated: Those cloud-like ones, with great roars and great strength,

original: abhyadhāvanta kākutsthaṃ rāmaṃ yuddhe jighāṃsavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: abhyadhāvanta kākutstham rāmam yuddhe jighāṃsavaḥ
translated: Attacked Kakutstha Rama, desiring to kill him in the battle.

original: te rāme śaravarṣāṇi vyasṛjan rakṣasāṃ guṇāḥ /
analyzed: te rāme śara varṣāṇi vyasṛjan rakṣasām guṇāḥ
translated: Those demons of Rama released showers of arrows,

original: śailendram iva dhārābhir varṣamāṇā balāhakāḥ // / / //
analyzed: śaila indram iva dhārābhiḥ varṣamāṇāḥ balāhakāḥ
translated: Like clouds raining on a great mountain.

original: sa taiḥ parivṛto ghorai rāghavo rakṣasāṃ gaṇaiḥ /
analyzed: sa taiḥ parivṛtaḥ ghoraiḥ rāghavaḥ rakṣasām gaṇaiḥ
translated: Surrounded by those terrible hordes of demons, Raghava,

original: tithiṣv iva mahādevo vṛtaḥ pāriṣadāṃ gaṇaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: tithiṣu iva mahādevaḥ vṛtaḥ pāriṣadām gaṇaiḥ
translated: Like Mahadeva surrounded by his attendants on the lunar days,

original: tāni muktāni śastrāṇi yātudhānaiḥ sa rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: tāni muktāni śastrāṇi yātudhānaiḥ sa rāghavaḥ
translated: That descendant of Raghu, with his body pierced by the arrows of the demons,

original: pratijagrāha viśikhair nadyoghān iva sāgaraḥ // / / //🔽sa taiḥ praharaṇair ghorair bhinnagātro na vivyathe /
analyzed: pratijagrāha viśikhaiḥ nadī oghān iva sāgaraḥ  sa taiḥ praharaṇaiḥ ghoraiḥ bhinna gātraḥ na vivyathe
translated: Did not waver, like the ocean receiving the rushing waves.🔽His body pierced by those terrible weapons, Rama did not suffer,

original: rāmaḥ pradīptair bahubhir vajrair iva mahācalaḥ // / / //
analyzed: rāmaḥ pradīptaiḥ bahubhiḥ vajraiḥ iva mahā acalaḥ
translated: Like a great mountain by many blazing thunderbolts.

original: sa viddhaḥ kṣatajādigdhaḥ sarvagātreṣu rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: sa viddhaḥ kṣataja ādigdhaḥ sarva gātreṣu rāghavaḥ
translated: Raghava, pierced and smeared with blood all over his body,

original: babhūva rāmaḥ saṃdhyābhrair divākara ivāvṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: babhūva rāmaḥ saṃdhyā abhraiḥ divākaraḥ iva āvṛtaḥ
translated: Appeared like the sun covered by evening clouds.

original: viṣedur devagandharvāḥ siddhāś ca paramarṣayaḥ /
analyzed: viṣeduḥ deva gandharvāḥ siddhāḥ ca parama ṛṣayaḥ
translated: The gods, gandharvas, siddhas and great sages

original: ekaṃ sahasrair bahubhis tadā dṛṣṭvā samāvṛtam // / / //
analyzed: ekam sahasraiḥ bahubhiḥ tadā dṛṣṭvā samāvṛtam
translated: Were distressed to see him alone surrounded by many thousands.

original: tato rāmaḥ susaṃkruddho maṇḍalīkṛtakārmukaḥ /
analyzed: tatas rāmaḥ su saṃkruddhaḥ maṇḍalīkṛta kārmukaḥ
translated: Then Rama, greatly enraged, his bow drawn into a circle,

original: sasarja niśitān bāṇāñ śataśo 'tha sahasraśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sasarja niśitān sahasraśas
translated: Shot sharp arrows by the hundreds and thousands.

original: durāvārān durviṣahān kālapāśopamān raṇe /
analyzed: durāvārān durviṣahān kāla pāśa upamān raṇe
translated: Difficult to resist and unbearable in battle, like the noose of Death,

original: mumoca līlayā rāmaḥ kaṅkapattrān ajihmagān // / / //
analyzed: mumoca līlayā rāmaḥ kaṅkapattrān a jihma gān
translated: Rama playfully released straight-flying arrows with heron feathers.

original: te śarāḥ śatrusainyeṣu muktā rāmeṇa līlayā /
analyzed: te śarāḥ śatru sainyeṣu muktāḥ rāmeṇa līlayā
translated: Those arrows, released by Rama playfully among the enemy troops,

original: ādadū rakṣasāṃ prāṇān pāśāḥ kālakṛtā iva // / / //
analyzed: ādaduḥ rakṣasām prāṇān pāśāḥ kāla kṛtāḥ iva
translated: Took away the lives of the demons, like nooses created by Death.

original: bhittvā rākṣasadehāṃs tāṃs te śarā rudhirāplutāḥ /
analyzed: bhittvā rākṣasa dehān tān te śarāḥ rudhira āplutāḥ
translated: Those arrows, drenched in blood, having pierced through the demon bodies,

original: antarikṣagatā rejur dīptāgnisamatejasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: antarikṣa gatāḥ rejuḥ dīpta agni sama tejasaḥ
translated: Shone in the sky, with the brilliance of a blazing fire.

original: asaṃkhyeyās tu rāmasya sāyakāś cāpamaṇḍalāt /
analyzed: asaṃkhyeyāḥ tu rāmasya sāyakāḥ cāpa maṇḍalāt
translated: Countless arrows from Rama's bow and circle of arms,

original: viniṣpetur atīvogrā rakṣaḥprāṇāpahāriṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: viniṣpetuḥ atīva ugrāḥ rakṣaḥ prāṇa apahāriṇaḥ
translated: Extremely fierce, departed, taking away the lives of the demons.

original: tair dhanūṃṣi dhvajāgrāṇi varmāṇi ca śirāṃsi ca /
analyzed: taiḥ dhanūṃṣi dhvaja agrāṇi varmāṇi ca śirāṃsi ca
translated: With those [arrows], bows, tips of standards, armours, and heads,

original: bahūn sahastābharaṇān ūrūn karikaropamān // / / //🔽tato nālīkanārācais tīkṣṇāgraiś ca vikarṇibhiḥ /
analyzed: bahūn sa hasta ābharaṇān ūrūn kari kara upamān  tatas nālīka nārācaiḥ tīkṣṇa agraiḥ ca vikarṇibhiḥ
translated: Many thousand-fold ornaments and thighs resembling elephant trunks,🔽Then with hollow-pointed arrows, iron arrows, and sharp-pointed razors,

original: bhīmam ārtasvaraṃ cakrur bhidyamānā niśācarāḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhīmam ārta svaram cakruḥ bhidyamānāḥ niśācarāḥ
translated: The demons, being pierced, made a terrible and piteous sound.

original: tat sainyaṃ niśitair bāṇair arditaṃ marmabhedibhiḥ /
analyzed: tat sainyam niśitaiḥ bāṇaiḥ arditam marma bhedibhiḥ
translated: That army, afflicted by sharp arrows piercing the vital parts,

original: rāmeṇa na sukhaṃ lebhe śuṣkaṃ vanam ivāgninā // / / //
analyzed: rāmeṇa na sukham lebhe śuṣkam vanam iva agninā
translated: Did not find happiness with Rama, like a dry forest with fire.

original: kecid bhīmabalāḥ śūrāḥ śūlān khaḍgān paraśvadhān /
analyzed: kecid bhīma balāḥ śūrāḥ śūlān khaḍgān paraśvadhān

analyzed: tān sarvān punar ādāya samāśvāsya ca dūṣaṇaḥ

analyzed: tat drumāṇām śilānām ca varṣam prāṇa haram mahat
translated: That great shower of trees and rocks, which was fatal to life,

analyzed: vajra aśani sama sparśam para gopura dāraṇam

analyzed: tasya abhipatamānasya dūṣaṇasya sa rāghavaḥ
translated: As Dushana was rushing at him, Raghava

analyzed: etasmin antare kruddhāḥ trayaḥ senā agra yāyinaḥ

analyzed: kṣaṇena tu mahā ghoram vanam nihata rākṣasam

analyzed: kharam tu rāma abhimukham prayāntam vāhinīpatiḥ
translated: As Khara was proceeding towards Rama, the general

analyzed: gaccha yudhya iti anujñātaḥ rāghava abhimukhaḥ yayau

translated: Seeing the rakshasa Trishira coming, Raghava

analyzed: tatas triśirasā bāṇaiḥ lalāṭe tāḍitaḥ tribhiḥ
translated: Then, struck on the forehead by Trishira with three arrows,

analyzed: amarṣī kupitaḥ rāmaḥ saṃrabdham idam abravīt

translated: Having said this, the enraged one,🔽angry, struck Triśiras' chest with fourteen arrows resembling venomous serpents.🔽With four straight arrows,

analyzed: nyapātayata tejasvī caturaḥ tasya vājinaḥ
translated: the energetic one brought down his four horses.

analyzed: aṣṭabhiḥ sāyakaiḥ sūtam rathopasthe nyapātayat
translated: With eight arrows, he brought down the charioteer on the chariot platform,

analyzed: rāmaḥ cicheda bāṇena dhvajam ca asya samucchritam

analyzed: tatas hatarathāt tasmāt utpatantam niśācaram
translated: Then, as the night-wanderer jumped down from his chariot,
