original: nirābādho hariṣyāmi rāhuś candraprabhām iva // / / //
analyzed: nirābādhaḥ hariṣyāmi rāhuḥ candra prabhām iva
translated: I will carry away Sita without hindrance, like Rahu seizing the light of the moon.

original: tataḥ paścāt sukhaṃ rāme bhāryāharaṇakarśite /
analyzed: tatas paścāt sukham rāme bhāryā haraṇa karśite
translated: Then, later, when Rama is afflicted by the abduction of his wife,

original: viśrabdhaḥ prahariṣyāmi kṛtārthenāntarātmanā // / / //
analyzed: viśrabdhaḥ prahariṣyāmi kṛtārthena antarātmanā
translated: I will strike with confidence, my mind at ease, having accomplished my purpose.

original: tasya rāmakathāṃ śrutvā mārīcasya mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: tasya rāma kathām śrutvā mārīcasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: Hearing that story of Rama from the great Maricha,

original: śuṣkaṃ samabhavad vaktraṃ paritrasto babhūva ca // / / //
analyzed: śuṣkam samabhavat vaktram paritrastaḥ babhūva ca
translated: his mouth became dry and he became frightened.

original: sa rāvaṇaṃ trastaviṣaṇṇacetā mahāvane rāmaparākramajñaḥ /
analyzed: sa rāvaṇam trasta viṣaṇṇa cetāḥ mahā vane rāma parākrama jñaḥ
translated: He, knowing Rama's prowess, with a frightened and dejected mind,

original: kṛtāñjalis tattvam uvāca vākyaṃ hitaṃ ca tasmai hitam ātmanaś ca // / / //
analyzed: kṛtāñjaliḥ tattvam uvāca vākyam hitam ca tasmai hitam ātmanaḥ ca
translated: with folded hands spoke words of truth, beneficial to him and to himself.

original: tac chrutvā rākṣasendrasya vākyaṃ vākyaviśāradaḥ /
analyzed: tat śrutvā rākṣasa indrasya vākyam vākya viśāradaḥ
translated: Having heard the words of the lord of the Rakshasas, the eloquent one,

original: pratyuvāca mahāprājño mārīco rākṣaseśvaram // / / //
analyzed: pratyuvāca mahā prājñaḥ mārīcaḥ rākṣaseśvaram
translated: the greatly wise Maricha replied to the lord of the Rakshasas.

original: sulabhāḥ puruṣā rājan satataṃ priyavādinaḥ /
analyzed: sulabhāḥ puruṣāḥ rājan satatam priya vādinaḥ
translated: Men are easily found, O king, who always speak pleasant words,

original: apriyasya ca pathyasya vaktā śrotā ca durlabhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: apriyasya ca pathyasya vaktā śrotā ca durlabhaḥ
translated: but a speaker and listener of unpleasant but beneficial advice are rare.

original: na nūnaṃ budhyase rāmaṃ mahāvīryaṃ guṇonnatam /
analyzed: na nūnam budhyase rāmam mahā vīryam guṇa unnatam
translated: You do not seem to understand Rama, who is greatly valorous and exalted by virtues,

original: ayuktacāraś capalo mahendravaruṇopamam // / / //
analyzed: a yukta cāraḥ capalaḥ mahā indra varuṇa upamam
translated: who is not engaged in improper conduct, who is restless, and who is like the great Indra and Varuna.

original: api svasti bhavet tāta sarveṣāṃ bhuvi rakṣasām /
analyzed: api svasti bhavet tāta sarveṣām bhuvi rakṣasām
translated: O father, may there be well-being for all the Rakshasas on earth,

original: api rāmo na saṃkruddhaḥ kuryāl lokam arākṣasam // / / //
analyzed: api rāmaḥ na saṃkruddhaḥ kuryāt lokam arākṣasam
translated: may not the angry Rama make the world devoid of Rakshasas,

original: api te jīvitāntāya notpannā janakātmajā /
analyzed: api te jīvita antāya nā utpannā janakātmajā
translated: has not the daughter of Janaka been born for the destruction of your life?

original: api sītā nimittaṃ ca na bhaved vyasanaṃ mahat // / / //
analyzed: api sītā nimittam ca na bhavet vyasanam mahat
translated: Has not a great calamity befallen you on account of Sita?

original: api tvām īśvaraṃ prāpya kāmavṛttaṃ niraṅkuśam /
analyzed: api tvām īśvaram prāpya kāma vṛttam niraṅkuśam
translated: Having obtained you as the lord, acting as you please, unrestrained,

original: na vinaśyet purī laṅkā tvayā saha sarākṣasā // / / //
analyzed: na vinaśyet purī laṅkā tvayā saha sa rākṣasā
translated: The city of Lanka, along with you and the demons, will not be destroyed.

original: tvadvidhaḥ kāmavṛtto hi duḥśīlaḥ pāpamantritaḥ /
analyzed: tvadvidhaḥ kāma vṛttaḥ hi duḥśīlaḥ pāpa mantritaḥ
translated: One like you, who acts out of desire, is of bad conduct, and has evil counsel,

original: ātmānaṃ svajanaṃ rāṣṭraṃ sa rājā hanti durmatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: ātmānam sva janam rāṣṭram sa rājā hanti durmatiḥ
translated: That unwise king destroys himself, his own people, and the kingdom.

original: na ca pitrā parityakto nāmaryādaḥ kathaṃcana /
analyzed: na ca pitrā parityaktaḥ na amaryādaḥ kathaṃcana
translated: And he was never abandoned by his father, nor was he ever beyond the bounds of morality.

original: na lubdho na ca duḥśīlo na ca kṣatriyapāṃsanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na lubdhaḥ na ca duḥśīlaḥ na ca kṣatriya pāṃsanaḥ
translated: He was not greedy, nor of bad conduct, nor was he a disgrace to the Kshatriyas.

original: na ca dharmaguṇair hīnaḥ kausalyānandavardhanaḥ /
analyzed: na ca dharma guṇaiḥ hīnaḥ kausalyā ānanda vardhanaḥ
translated: And he was not devoid of the qualities of righteousness, the enhancer of Kausalya's joy.

original: na ca tīkṣṇo hi bhūtānāṃ sarveṣāṃ ca hite rataḥ // / / //
analyzed: na ca tīkṣṇaḥ hi bhūtānām sarveṣām ca hite rataḥ
translated: And he was not harsh towards any being, but was engaged in the welfare of all.

original: vañcitaṃ pitaraṃ dṛṣṭvā kaikeyyā satyavādinam /
analyzed: vañcitam pitaram dṛṣṭvā kaikeyyā satya vādinam
translated: Having seen his truthful father deceived by Kaikeyi,

original: kariṣyāmīti dharmātmā tataḥ pravrajito vanam // / / //
analyzed: kariṣyāmi iti dharma ātmā tatas pravrajitaḥ vanam
translated: The righteous one left for the forest, saying, I will do (what is proper).

original: kaikeyyāḥ priyakāmārthaṃ pitur daśarathasya ca /
analyzed: kaikeyyāḥ priya kāma artham pituḥ daśarathasya ca
translated: For the sake of pleasing Kaikeyi and his father Dasharatha,

original: hitvā rājyaṃ ca bhogāṃś ca praviṣṭo daṇḍakāvanam // / / //
analyzed: hitvā rājyam ca bhogān ca praviṣṭaḥ daṇḍaka vanam
translated: He abandoned the kingdom and pleasures and entered the Dandaka forest.

original: na rāmaḥ karkaśas tāta nāvidvān nājitendriyaḥ /
analyzed: na rāmaḥ karkaśaḥ tāta na a vidvān na ajita indriyaḥ
translated: O father, Rama is not harsh, nor is he ignorant, nor is he one who has not conquered his senses.

original: anṛtaṃ na śrutaṃ caiva naiva tvaṃ vaktum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: anṛtam na śrutam ca eva na eva tvam vaktum arhasi
translated: You should not speak a falsehood, nor should you speak what has not been heard.

original: rāmo vigrahavān dharmaḥ sādhuḥ satyaparākramaḥ /
analyzed: rāmaḥ vigrahavān dharmaḥ sādhuḥ satya parākramaḥ
translated: Rama is embodiment of Dharma, a virtuous man, and his prowess is truth.

original: rājā sarvasya lokasya devānām iva vāsavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: rājā sarvasya lokasya devānām iva vāsavaḥ
translated: He is the king of the entire world, like Indra of the gods.

original: kathaṃ tvaṃ tasya vaidehīṃ rakṣitāṃ svena tejasā /🔽icchasi prasabhaṃ hartuṃ prabhām iva vivasvataḥ // / / //
analyzed: katham tvam tasya vaidehīm rakṣitām svena tejasā  icchasi prasabham hartum prabhām iva vivasvataḥ
translated: How can you desire to forcibly abduct Vaidehi, protected by her own radiance,🔽like one trying to seize the light of the sun?

original: śarārciṣam anādhṛṣyaṃ cāpakhaḍgendhanaṃ raṇe /
analyzed: śara arciṣam anādhṛṣyam cāpa khaḍga indhanam raṇe
translated: In battle, he is unassailable, with arrows as his flames, and bow and sword as his fuel.

original: rāmāgniṃ sahasā dīptaṃ na praveṣṭuṃ tvam arhasi // / / //🔽dhanurvyāditadīptāsyaṃ śarārciṣam amarṣaṇam /
analyzed: rāma agnim sahasā dīptam na praveṣṭum tvam arhasi  dhanuḥ vyādita dīpta āsyam śara arciṣam amarṣaṇam
translated: You should not suddenly enter the blazing fire of Rama.🔽With his bow drawn as his gaping mouth, arrows as his flames, and intolerant,

original: cāpabāṇadharaṃ vīraṃ śatrusenāpahāriṇam // / / //
analyzed: cāpa bāṇa dharam vīram śatru senā apahāriṇam
translated: the hero holding bow and arrows, the destroyer of enemy armies,

original: rājyaṃ sukhaṃ ca saṃtyajya jīvitaṃ ceṣṭam ātmanaḥ /
analyzed: rājyam sukham ca saṃtyajya jīvitam ca iṣṭam ātmanaḥ
translated: having abandoned his kingdom, happiness, and his own cherished life,

original: nātyāsādayituṃ tāta rāmāntakam ihārhasi // / / //
analyzed: na atyāsādayitum tāta rāma antakam iha arhasi
translated: you should not, my son, provoke Rama, the bringer of death.

original: aprameyaṃ hi tattejo yasya sā janakātmajā /
analyzed: aprameyam hi tat tejaḥ yasya sā janakātmajā
translated: For immeasurable is the radiance of him whose Sita is the daughter of Janaka.

original: na tvaṃ samarthas tāṃ hartuṃ rāmacāpāśrayāṃ vane // / / //
analyzed: na tvam samarthaḥ tām hartum rāma cāpa āśrayām vane
translated: You are not able to abduct her in the forest, protected by Rama's bow.

original: prāṇebhyo 'pi priyatarā bhāryā nityam anuvratā /
analyzed: prāṇebhyaḥ pi priyatarā bhāryā nityam anuvratā
translated: A wife who is always devoted, dearer than life itself,

original: dīptasyeva hutāśasya śikhā sītā sumadhyamā // / / //
analyzed: dīptasya iva hutāśasya śikhā sītā sumadhyamā
translated: Sita, the slender-waisted one, is like the flame of a blazing fire.

original: kim udyamaṃ vyartham imaṃ kṛtvā te rākṣasādhipa /
analyzed: kim udyamam vyartham imam kṛtvā te rākṣasa adhipa
translated: O lord of the Rakshasas, what is the use of making this useless exertion?

original: dṛṣṭaś cet tvaṃ raṇe tena tadantaṃ tava jīvitam /
analyzed: dṛṣṭaḥ ced tvam raṇe tena tad antam tava jīvitam
translated: If you are seen by him in battle, then your life will come to an end.

original: jīvitaṃ ca sukhaṃ caiva rājyaṃ caiva sudurlabham // / / //
analyzed: jīvitam ca sukham ca eva rājyam ca eva su durlabham
translated: Life, happiness and kingdom are very difficult to obtain.

original: sa sarvaiḥ sacivaiḥ sārdhaṃ vibhīṣaṇapuraskṛtaiḥ /
analyzed: sa sarvaiḥ sacivaiḥ sārdham vibhīṣaṇa puraskṛtaiḥ
translated: Together with all his ministers, headed by Vibhishana,

original: mantrayitvā tu dharmiṣṭhaiḥ kṛtvā niścayam ātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mantrayitvā tu dharmiṣṭhaiḥ kṛtvā niścayam ātmanaḥ
translated: Having consulted with the righteous ones and made up his mind,

original: doṣāṇāṃ ca guṇānāṃ ca sampradhārya balābalam /
analyzed: doṣāṇām ca guṇānām ca sampradhārya balābalam
translated: Having considered the strengths and weaknesses of the faults and virtues,

original: ātmanaś ca balaṃ jñātvā rāghavasya ca tattvataḥ /
analyzed: ātmanaḥ ca balam jñātvā rāghavasya ca tattvataḥ
translated: Having known the true strength of himself and Raghava,

original: hitaṃ hi tava niścitya kṣamaṃ tvaṃ kartum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: hitam hi tava niścitya kṣamam tvam kartum arhasi
translated: Having decided what is beneficial for you, you should do what is possible.

original: ahaṃ tu manye tava na kṣamaṃ raṇe samāgamaṃ kosalarājasūnunā /
analyzed: aham tu manye tava na kṣamam raṇe samāgamam kosala rāja sūnunā
translated: But I think it is not possible for you to engage in battle with the son of the king of Kosala.

original: idaṃ hi bhūyaḥ śṛṇu vākyam uttamaṃ kṣamaṃ ca yuktaṃ ca niśācarādhipa // / / //
analyzed: idam hi bhūyas śṛṇu vākyam uttamam kṣamam ca yuktam ca niśācara adhipa
translated: Listen again to these excellent words, which are possible and proper, O lord of the night-wanderers.

original: kadācid apy ahaṃ vīryāt paryaṭan pṛthivīm imām /🔽balaṃ nāgasahasrasya dhārayan parvatopamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kadācid api aham vīryāt paryaṭan pṛthivīm imām  balam nāga sahasrasya dhārayan parvata upamaḥ
translated: Sometimes, out of my own prowess, I wander over this earth,🔽Possessing the strength of a thousand elephants, resembling a mountain.

original: nīlajīmūtasaṃkāśas taptakāñcanakuṇḍalaḥ /
analyzed: nīla jīmūta saṃkāśaḥ tapta kāñcana kuṇḍalaḥ
translated: Resembling a dark cloud, wearing earrings of molten gold,

original: bhayaṃ lokasya janayan kirīṭī parighāyudhaḥ /
analyzed: bhayam lokasya janayan kirīṭī parigha āyudhaḥ
translated: The diademed one, with a mace as his weapon, causing fear to the world,

original: vyacaraṃ daṇḍakāraṇyam ṛṣimāṃsāni bhakṣayan // / / //
analyzed: vyacaram daṇḍaka araṇyam ṛṣi māṃsāni bhakṣayan
translated: roamed in the Dandaka forest, devouring the flesh of sages.

original: viśvāmitro 'tha dharmātmā madvitrasto mahāmuniḥ /
analyzed: viśvāmitraḥ tha dharma ātmā mad vitrastaḥ mahā muniḥ
translated: Then the righteous great sage Vishvamitra, terrified of me,

original: svayaṃ gatvā daśarathaṃ narendram idam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: svayam gatvā daśaratham narendram idam abravīt
translated: himself went to King Dasharatha and said this:

original: ayaṃ rakṣatu māṃ rāmaḥ parvakāle samāhitaḥ /
analyzed: ayam rakṣatu mām rāmaḥ parva kāle samāhitaḥ
translated: Let this Rama protect me, focused, on the day of the new moon.

original: mārīcān me bhayaṃ ghoraṃ samutpannaṃ nareśvara // / / //
analyzed: mārīcāt me bhayam ghoram samutpannam nareśvara
translated: A terrible fear of Maricha has arisen in me, O lord of men.

original: ity evam ukto dharmātmā rājā daśarathas tadā /
analyzed: iti evam uktaḥ dharma ātmā rājā daśarathaḥ tadā
translated: Thus addressed, the righteous King Dasharatha

original: pratyuvāca mahābhāgaṃ viśvāmitraṃ mahāmunim // / / //
analyzed: pratyuvāca mahābhāgam viśvāmitram mahā munim
translated: replied to the greatly fortunate great sage Vishvamitra:

original: ūnaṣoḍaśavarṣo 'yam akṛtāstraś ca rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: ūna ṣoḍaśa varṣaḥ yam a kṛta astraḥ ca rāghavaḥ
translated: This Raghava is less than sixteen years old and has not yet learned the use of weapons.

original: kāmaṃ tu mama yat sainyaṃ mayā saha gamiṣyati /
analyzed: kāmam tu mama yat sainyam mayā saha gamiṣyati
translated: But if my army wishes to go with me,

original: vadhiṣyāmi muniśreṣṭha śatruṃ tava yathepsitam // / / //
analyzed: vadhiṣyāmi muni śreṣṭha śatrum tava yathā īpsitam
translated: I will slay your enemy, O best of sages, as you desire.

original: ity evam uktaḥ sa munī rājānaṃ punar abravīt /
analyzed: iti evam uktaḥ sa muniḥ rājānam punar abravīt
translated: Thus addressed, the sage again spoke to the king:

original: rāmān nānyad balaṃ loke paryāptaṃ tasya rakṣasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: rāmāt na anyat balam loke paryāptam tasya rakṣasaḥ
translated: There is no other army in the world sufficient to counter that demon, except Rama.

original: bālo 'py eṣa mahātejāḥ samarthas tasya nigrahe /
analyzed: bālaḥ pi eṣa mahā tejāḥ samarthaḥ tasya nigrahe
translated: Even though he is a child, this one of great splendor is capable of restraining him.

original: gamiṣye rāmam ādāya svasti te 'stu paraṃtapa // / / //🔽ity evam uktvā sa munis tam ādāya nṛpātmajam /
analyzed: gamiṣye rāmam ādāya svasti te stu paraṃtapa  iti evam uktvā sa muniḥ tam ādāya nṛpa ātmajam
translated: I shall go, taking Rama with me. May good betide you, O scorcher of foes.🔽Having said this, the sage, Vishvamitra, highly pleased, took the prince

original: jagāma paramaprīto viśvāmitraḥ svam āśramam // / / //🔽taṃ tadā daṇḍakāraṇye yajñam uddiśya dīkṣitam /
analyzed: jagāma parama prītaḥ viśvāmitraḥ svam āśramam  tam tadā daṇḍaka araṇye yajñam uddiśya dīkṣitam
translated: and went to his own hermitage.🔽Rama, who was then initiated for the sacrifice in the Dandaka forest,

original: babhūvāvasthito rāmaś citraṃ visphārayan dhanuḥ // / / //
analyzed: babhūva avasthitaḥ rāmaḥ citram visphārayan dhanuḥ
translated: stood there, stretching his wonderful bow.

original: ajātavyañjanaḥ śrīmān bālaḥ śyāmaḥ śubhekṣaṇaḥ /
analyzed: ajāta vyañjanaḥ śrīmān bālaḥ śyāmaḥ śubha īkṣaṇaḥ
translated: The prosperous one, though not yet invested with the sacred thread, was a boy, dark, and of auspicious eyes.

original: ekavastradharo dhanvī śikhī kanakamālayā // / / //
analyzed: eka vastra dharaḥ dhanvī śikhī kanaka mālayā
translated: Wearing a single garment, with a bow, a tuft of hair on the crown of the head, and a golden garland,

original: śobhayan daṇḍakāraṇyaṃ dīptena svena tejasā /
analyzed: śobhayan daṇḍaka araṇyam dīptena svena tejasā
translated: he was illuminating the Dandaka forest with his own blazing splendour.

original: adṛśyata tadā rāmo bālacandra ivoditaḥ // / / //
analyzed: adṛśyata tadā rāmaḥ bāla candraḥ iva uditaḥ
translated: Rama was then seen, like the rising moon in the sky.

original: tato 'haṃ meghasaṃkāśas taptakāñcanakuṇḍalaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ham megha saṃkāśaḥ tapta kāñcana kuṇḍalaḥ
translated: Then I, resembling a cloud, with earrings of heated gold,

original: balī dattavaro darpād ājagāma tadāśramam // / / //🔽tena dṛṣṭaḥ praviṣṭo 'haṃ sahasaivodyatāyudhaḥ /
analyzed: balī datta varaḥ darpāt ājagāma tad āśramam  tena dṛṣṭaḥ praviṣṭaḥ ham sahasā eva udyata āyudhaḥ
translated: powerful, proud, and having received a boon, came to that hermitage.🔽Seeing me enter suddenly with my weapon raised,

original: māṃ tu dṛṣṭvā dhanuḥ sajyam asambhrāntaś cakāra ha // / / //
analyzed: mām tu dṛṣṭvā dhanuḥ sajyam asambhrāntaḥ cakāra ha
translated: he, without any fear, strung his bow.

original: avajānann ahaṃ mohād bālo 'yam iti rāghavam /
analyzed: avajānan aham mohāt bālaḥ yam iti rāghavam
translated: Out of delusion, I disregarded Raghava, thinking him a boy,

original: viśvāmitrasya tāṃ vedim adhyadhāvaṃ kṛtatvaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: viśvāmitrasya tām vedim adhyadhāvam kṛta tvaraḥ
translated: I quickly ran towards Vishvamitra's altar.

original: tena muktas tato bāṇaḥ śitaḥ śatrunibarhaṇaḥ /
analyzed: tena muktaḥ tatas bāṇaḥ śitaḥ śatru nibarhaṇaḥ
translated: The sharp arrow, the destroyer of enemies, was released by him.

original: tenāhaṃ tāḍitaḥ kṣiptaḥ samudre śatayojane // / / //
analyzed: tena aham tāḍitaḥ kṣiptaḥ samudre śata yojane
translated: I was struck by it and thrown into the ocean, a hundred yojanas away.

original: rāmasya śaravegena nirasto bhrāntacetanaḥ /
analyzed: rāmasya śara vegena nirastaḥ bhrānta cetanaḥ
translated: By the force of Rama's arrow, I was knocked down, my senses confused.

original: pātito 'haṃ tadā tena gambhīre sāgarāmbhasi /
analyzed: pātitaḥ ham tadā tena gambhīre sāgara ambhasi
translated: I was then thrown by him into the deep waters of the ocean.

original: prāpya saṃjñāṃ cirāt tāta laṅkāṃ prati gataḥ purīm // / / //
analyzed: prāpya saṃjñām cirāt tāta laṅkām prati gataḥ purīm
translated: After a long time, I regained consciousness, my child, and returned to the city of Lanka.

original: evam asmi tadā muktaḥ sahāyās te nipātitāḥ /
analyzed: evam asmi tadā muktaḥ sahāyāḥ te nipātitāḥ
translated: Thus I was released then, but my companions were brought down.

original: akṛtāstreṇa rāmeṇa bālenākliṣṭakarmaṇā // / / //
analyzed: a kṛta astreṇa rāmeṇa bālena akliṣṭa karmaṇā
translated: By the youthful Rama, whose deeds are unsullied, who was not skilled in weapons.

original: tan mayā vāryamāṇas tvaṃ yadi rāmeṇa vigraham /
analyzed: tat mayā vāryamāṇaḥ tvam yadi rāmeṇa vigraham
translated: If, despite my warning, you engage in a conflict with Rama,

original: kariṣyasy āpadaṃ ghorāṃ kṣipraṃ prāpya naśiṣyasi // / / //
analyzed: kariṣyasi āpadam ghorām kṣipram prāpya naśiṣyasi
translated: you will quickly encounter terrible calamity and perish.

original: krīḍāratividhijñānāṃ samājotsavaśālinām /
analyzed: krīḍā rati vidhi jñānām samāja utsava śālinām
translated: For the demons who know the ways of play and enjoyment, who have festive gatherings,

original: rakṣasāṃ caiva saṃtāpam anarthaṃ cāhariṣyasi // / / //🔽harmyaprāsādasambādhāṃ nānāratnavibhūṣitām /
analyzed: rakṣasām ca eva saṃtāpam anartham ca āhariṣyasi  harmya prāsāda sambādhām nānā ratna vibhūṣitām
translated: you will bring grief and misfortune.🔽You will see the city of Lanka, crowded with palaces and mansions, adorned with various jewels,

original: drakṣyasi tvaṃ purīṃ laṅkāṃ vinaṣṭāṃ maithilīkṛte // / / //
analyzed: drakṣyasi tvam purīm laṅkām vinaṣṭām maithilī kṛte
translated: destroyed for the sake of Maithili.

original: akurvanto 'pi pāpāni śucayaḥ pāpasaṃśrayāt /
analyzed: a kurvantaḥ pi pāpāni śucayaḥ pāpa saṃśrayāt
translated: The pure, even though not committing sins, are destroyed by association with sinners,

original: parapāpair vinaśyanti matsyā nāgahrade yathā // / / //
analyzed: para pāpaiḥ vinaśyanti matsyāḥ nāga hrade yathā
translated: like fish in a lake of serpents, due to the sins of others.

original: divyacandanadigdhāṅgān divyābharaṇabhūṣitān /
analyzed: divya candana digdha aṅgān divya ābharaṇa bhūṣitān
translated: You will see the demons, whose bodies are smeared with divine sandalwood paste, adorned with divine ornaments,

original: drakṣyasy abhihatān bhūmau tava doṣāt tu rākṣasān // / / //🔽hṛtadārān sadārāṃś ca daśa vidravato diśaḥ /
analyzed: drakṣyasi abhihatān bhūmau tava doṣāt tu rākṣasān  hṛta dārān sa dārān ca daśa vidravataḥ diśaḥ
translated: slain on the ground, due to your fault, O demon.

original: hataśeṣān aśaraṇān drakṣyasi tvaṃ niśācarān // / / //🔽śarajālaparikṣiptām agnijvālāsamāvṛtām /
analyzed: hata śeṣān aśaraṇān drakṣyasi tvam niśācarān  śara jāla parikṣiptām agni jvālā samāvṛtām
translated: You will see the remaining demons, who have lost their wives and have no refuge, fleeing in the ten directions,🔽their wives taken away.

original: pradagdhabhavanāṃ laṅkāṃ drakṣyasi tvam asaṃśayam // / / //
analyzed: pradagdha bhavanām laṅkām drakṣyasi tvam asaṃśayam
translated: You will undoubtedly see Lanka, its houses burned, surrounded by a net of arrows and covered with flames of fire.

original: pramadānāṃ sahasrāṇi tava rājan parigrahaḥ /
analyzed: pramadānām sahasrāṇi tava rājan parigrahaḥ
translated: O king, your possession is thousands of women.

original: bhava svadāranirataḥ svakulaṃ rakṣa rākṣasa // / / //🔽mānaṃ vṛddhiṃ ca rājyaṃ ca jīvitaṃ ceṣṭam ātmanaḥ /
analyzed: bhava sva dāra nirataḥ sva kulam rakṣa rākṣasa  mānam vṛddhim ca rājyam ca jīvitam ca iṣṭam ātmanaḥ
translated: Be devoted to your own wife, O demon, protect your own family.🔽If you desire to enjoy for a long time your honor, prosperity, kingdom and life,

original: yadīcchasi ciraṃ bhoktuṃ mā kṛthā rāmavipriyam // / / //
analyzed: yadi icchasi ciram bhoktum mā kṛthāḥ rāma vipriyam
translated: do not offend Rama.

original: nivāryamāṇaḥ suhṛdā mayā bhṛśaṃ prasahya sītāṃ yadi dharṣayiṣyasi /
analyzed: nivāryamāṇaḥ suhṛdā mayā bhṛśam prasahya sītām yadi dharṣayiṣyasi
translated: If, being strongly restrained by me, your friend, you will forcibly violate Sita,

original: gamiṣyasi kṣīṇabalaḥ sabāndhavo yamakṣayaṃ rāmaśarāttajīvitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: gamiṣyasi kṣīṇa balaḥ sa bāndhavaḥ yama kṣayam rāma śara ātta jīvitaḥ
translated: You will go to Yama's abode, your strength exhausted, along with your relatives, your life taken by Rama's arrows.

original: evam asmi tadā muktaḥ kathaṃcit tena saṃyuge /
analyzed: evam asmi tadā muktaḥ kathaṃcid tena saṃyuge
translated: Thus, I was somehow released by him in that battle.

original: idānīm api yad vṛttaṃ tac chṛṇuṣva yad uttaram // / / //🔽rākṣasābhyām ahaṃ dvābhyām anirviṇṇas tathā kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: idānīm api yat vṛttam tat śṛṇuṣva yat uttaram  rākṣasābhyām aham dvābhyām anirviṇṇaḥ tathā kṛtaḥ
translated: Now listen to what happened later,🔽I was made hopeless by those two demons.

original: sahito mṛgarūpābhyāṃ praviṣṭo daṇḍakāvanam // / / //
analyzed: sahitaḥ mṛga rūpābhyām praviṣṭaḥ daṇḍaka vanam
translated: Together with those two deer-formed ones, I entered the Dāndaka forest.

original: dīptajihvo mahākāyas tīkṣṇaśṛṅgo mahābalaḥ /
analyzed: dīpta jihvaḥ mahā kāyaḥ tīkṣṇa śṛṅgaḥ mahā balaḥ
translated: With a flaming tongue, a huge body, sharp horns, and great strength,

original: vyacaraṃ daṇḍakāraṇyaṃ māṃsabhakṣo mahāmṛgaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vyacaram daṇḍaka araṇyam māṃsa bhakṣaḥ mahāmṛgaḥ
translated: I roamed the Dāndaka forest, a great deer eating flesh.

original: agnihotreṣu tīrtheṣu caityavṛkṣeṣu rāvaṇa /
analyzed: agnihotreṣu tīrtheṣu caitya vṛkṣeṣu rāvaṇa
translated: In the sacrificial fires, in the sacred fords, and in the sacred trees, O Rāvaṇa,

original: atyantaghoro vyacaraṃ tāpasāṃs tān pradharṣayan // / / //
analyzed: atyanta ghoraḥ vyacaram tāpasān tān pradharṣayan
translated: I roamed extremely fearsome, harassing those ascetics.

original: nihatya daṇḍakāraṇye tāpasān dharmacāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: nihatya daṇḍaka araṇye tāpasān dharma cāriṇaḥ
translated: Having killed the ascetics who follow dharma in the Dāndaka forest,

original: rudhirāṇi pibaṃs teṣāṃ tathā māṃsāni bhakṣayan // / / //
analyzed: rudhirāṇi piban teṣām tathā māṃsāni bhakṣayan
translated: Drinking their blood and devouring their flesh,

original: ṛṣimāṃsāśanaḥ krūras trāsayan vanagocarān /🔽tadā rudhiramatto 'haṃ vyacaraṃ daṇḍakāvanam // / / //
analyzed: ṛṣi māṃsa aśanaḥ krūraḥ trāsayan vana gocarān  tadā rudhira mattaḥ ham vyacaram daṇḍaka vanam
translated: O cruel one, eating the flesh of sages, terrifying the forest-dwellers,🔽intoxicated with blood, I roamed the Dāndaka forest.

original: tadāhaṃ daṇḍakāraṇye vicaran dharmadūṣakaḥ /
analyzed: tadā aham daṇḍaka araṇye vicaran dharma dūṣakaḥ
translated: Then, roaming in the Dāndaka forest, defiling dharma,

original: āsādayaṃ tadā rāmaṃ tāpasaṃ dharmam āśritam // / / //
analyzed: āsādayam tadā rāmam tāpasam dharmam āśritam
translated: Approaching Rama, who had taken to asceticism and was devoted to dharma,

original: vaidehīṃ ca mahābhāgāṃ lakṣmaṇaṃ ca mahāratham /
analyzed: vaidehīm ca mahābhāgām lakṣmaṇam ca mahā ratham
translated: And the greatly fortunate Vaidehi, and the great warrior Lakshmana,

original: tāpasaṃ niyatāhāraṃ sarvabhūtahite ratam // / / //
analyzed: tāpasam niyata āhāram sarva bhūta hite ratam
translated: The ascetic, who was restrained in diet and was engaged in the welfare of all beings,

original: so 'haṃ vanagataṃ rāmaṃ paribhūya mahābalam /
analyzed: saḥ ham vana gatam rāmam paribhūya mahā balam
translated: I, having disregarded the greatly powerful Rama who had gone to the forest,

original: tāpaso 'yam iti jñātvā pūrvavairam anusmaran // / / //🔽abhyadhāvaṃ susaṃkruddhas tīkṣṇaśṛṅgo mṛgākṛtiḥ /
analyzed: tāpasaḥ yam iti jñātvā pūrva vairam anusmaran  abhyadhāvam su saṃkruddhaḥ tīkṣṇa śṛṅgaḥ mṛga ākṛtiḥ
translated: Knowing him to be an ascetic and remembering the old enmity,🔽I, in the form of a deer with sharp antlers, ran towards him in great anger,

original: jighāṃsur akṛtaprajñas taṃ prahāram anusmaran // / / //
analyzed: jighāṃsuḥ a kṛta prajñaḥ tam prahāram anusmaran
translated: Desiring to kill him, being unwise and remembering that blow,

original: tena muktās trayo bāṇāḥ śitāḥ śatrunibarhaṇāḥ /
analyzed: tena muktāḥ trayaḥ bāṇāḥ śitāḥ śatru nibarhaṇāḥ
translated: Three sharp arrows, destroyers of enemies, were released by him.

original: vikṛṣya balavac cāpaṃ suparṇānilatulyagāḥ // / / //
analyzed: vikṛṣya balavat cāpam suparṇa anila tulya gāḥ
translated: Drawing the powerful bow, they flew like Suparna and the wind,

original: te bāṇā vajrasaṃkāśāḥ sughorā raktabhojanāḥ /
analyzed: te bāṇāḥ vajra saṃkāśāḥ su ghorāḥ rakta bhojanāḥ
translated: Those arrows, resembling thunderbolts, extremely terrible and feeding on blood,

original: ājagmuḥ sahitāḥ sarve trayaḥ saṃnataparvaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ājagmuḥ sahitāḥ sarve trayaḥ saṃnata parvaṇaḥ
translated: All three of them, with straight joints, came together,

original: parākramajño rāmasya śaṭho dṛṣṭabhayaḥ purā /
analyzed: parākrama jñaḥ rāmasya śaṭhaḥ dṛṣṭa bhayaḥ purā
translated: Knowing Rama's prowess, the deceitful one, having seen danger before,

original: samutkrāntas tato muktas tāv ubhau rākṣasau hatau // / / //
analyzed: samutkrāntaḥ tatas muktaḥ tau ubhau rākṣasau hatau
translated: Escaped then and was released, those two demons were killed,

original: śareṇa mukto rāmasya kathaṃcit prāpya jīvitam /
analyzed: śareṇa muktaḥ rāmasya kathaṃcid prāpya jīvitam
translated: Somehow released from Rama's arrow and having obtained life,

original: iha pravrājito yuktas tāpaso 'haṃ samāhitaḥ // / / //🔽vṛkṣe vṛkṣe hi paśyāmi cīrakṛṣṇājināmbaram /
analyzed: iha pravrājitaḥ yuktaḥ tāpasaḥ ham samāhitaḥ  vṛkṣe vṛkṣe hi paśyāmi cīra kṛṣṇa ajina ambaram
translated: I am a renunciant here, engaged, an ascetic, concentrated.🔽I see Rama, with a bow in his hand, like Death with a noose in his hand,

original: gṛhītadhanuṣaṃ rāmaṃ pāśahastam ivāntakam // / / //
analyzed: rāmam pāśa hastam iva antakam
translated: in every tree, wearing bark and black antelope skin.

original: api rāmasahasrāṇi bhītaḥ paśyāmi rāvaṇa /
analyzed: api rāma sahasrāṇi bhītaḥ paśyāmi rāvaṇa
translated: O Ravana, I see thousands of Ramas, frightened.

original: rāmabhūtam idaṃ sarvam araṇyaṃ pratibhāti me // / / //🔽rāmam eva hi paśyāmi rahite rākṣaseśvara /🔽dṛṣṭvā svapnagataṃ rāmam udbhramāmi vicetanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: rāma bhūtam idam sarvam araṇyam pratibhāti me  rāmam eva hi paśyāmi rahite rākṣasa īśvara  dṛṣṭvā svapna gatam rāmam udbhramāmi vicetanaḥ
translated: This entire forest appears to me as if filled with Rama.🔽O lord of demons, I see Rama alone, even in solitude.🔽Seeing Rama in my dream, I am agitated, senseless.

original: rakārādīni nāmāni rāmatrastasya rāvaṇa /
analyzed: rakāra ādīni nāmāni rāma trastasya rāvaṇa
translated: O Ravana, frightened by Rama, I see even names beginning with ra.

original: ratnāni ca rathāś caiva trāsaṃ saṃjanayanti me // / / //
analyzed: ratnāni ca rathāḥ ca eva trāsam saṃjanayanti me
translated: Jewels and chariots also generate fear in me.

original: ahaṃ tasya prabhāvajño na yuddhaṃ tena te kṣamam /
analyzed: aham tasya prabhāva jñaḥ na yuddham tena te kṣamam
translated: I know his power, a battle with him is not proper for you.

original: raṇe rāmeṇa yudhyasva kṣamāṃ vā kuru rākṣasa /
analyzed: raṇe rāmeṇa yudhyasva kṣamām vā kuru rākṣasa
translated: O demon, fight with Rama in battle or make peace with him.

original: na te rāmakathā kāryā yadi māṃ draṣṭum icchasi // / / //
analyzed: na te rāma kathā kāryā yadi mām draṣṭum icchasi
translated: If you wish to see me, you should not speak about Rama.

original: idaṃ vaco bandhuhitārthinā mayā yathocyamānaṃ yadi nābhipatsyase /
analyzed: idam vacaḥ bandhu hita arthinā mayā yathā ucyamānam yadi nā abhipatsyase
translated: If you do not accept these words spoken by me, desiring the welfare of my relatives,

original: sabāndhavas tyakṣyasi jīvitaṃ raṇe hato 'dya rāmeṇa śarair ajihmagaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa bāndhavaḥ tyakṣyasi jīvitam raṇe hataḥ dya rāmeṇa śaraiḥ a jihma gaiḥ
translated: You will give up your life in battle today, along with your relatives, struck down by Rama's straight-flying arrows.

original: mārīcena tu tad vākyaṃ kṣamaṃ yuktaṃ ca rāvaṇaḥ /
analyzed: mārīcena tu tat vākyam kṣamam yuktam ca rāvaṇaḥ
translated: But Ravana, though addressed with those appropriate and fitting words by Maricha,

original: ukto na pratijagrāha martukāma ivauṣadham // / / //🔽taṃ pathyahitavaktāraṃ mārīcaṃ rākṣasādhipaḥ /
analyzed: uktaḥ na pratijagrāha martu kāmaḥ iva auṣadham  tam pathya hita vaktāram mārīcam rākṣasa adhipaḥ
translated: did not accept them, like one desirous of death refusing medicine.

original: abravīt paruṣaṃ vākyam ayuktaṃ kālacoditaḥ // / / //🔽yat kilaitad ayuktārthaṃ mārīca mayi kathyate /
analyzed: abravīt paruṣam vākyam ayuktam kāla coditaḥ  yat kila etat ayukta artham mārīca mayi kathyate
translated: The lord of the rakshasas, urged on by fate, spoke harsh and improper words to Maricha, who spoke words beneficial and wholesome.🔽The words you speak to me, Maricha, are inappropriate and meaningless,

original: vākyaṃ niṣphalam atyarthaṃ bījam uptam ivoṣare // / / //
analyzed: vākyam niṣphalam atyartham bījam uptam iva ūṣare
translated: like a seed sown in a desert, utterly fruitless.

original: tvadvākyair na tu māṃ śakyaṃ bhettuṃ rāmasya saṃyuge /
analyzed: tvad vākyaiḥ na tu mām śakyam bhettum rāmasya saṃyuge
translated: But you are incapable of separating me from Rama in battle with your words,

original: pāpaśīlasya mūrkhasya mānuṣasya viśeṣataḥ // / / //
analyzed: pāpa śīlasya mūrkhasya mānuṣasya viśeṣataḥ
translated: especially from a sinful, foolish human.

original: yas tyaktvā suhṛdo rājyaṃ mātaraṃ pitaraṃ tathā /
analyzed: yaḥ tyaktvā suhṛdaḥ rājyam mātaram pitaram tathā
translated: He who abandoned his friends, kingdom, mother and father,

original: strīvākyaṃ prākṛtaṃ śrutvā vanam ekapade gataḥ // / / //🔽avaśyaṃ tu mayā tasya saṃyuge kharaghātinaḥ /
analyzed: strī vākyam prākṛtam śrutvā vanam eka pade gataḥ  avaśyam tu mayā tasya saṃyuge khara ghātinaḥ
translated: and immediately went to the forest on hearing the ordinary words of a woman.

original: prāṇaiḥ priyatarā sītā hartavyā tava saṃnidhau // / / //
analyzed: prāṇaiḥ priyatarā sītā hartavyā tava saṃnidhau
translated: But in your presence, I must certainly carry away Sita, who is dearer to him than his own life, in battle with the slayer of Khara.

original: evaṃ me niścitā buddhir hṛdi mārīca vartate /
analyzed: evam me niścitā buddhiḥ hṛdi mārīca vartate
translated: O Maricha! This is the firm resolve that is in my heart.

original: na vyāvartayituṃ śakyā sendrair api surāsuraiḥ // / / //
analyzed: na vyāvartayitum śakyā sa indraiḥ api sura asuraiḥ
translated: It cannot be turned away even by Indra, the gods and the demons together.

original: doṣaṃ guṇaṃ vā saṃpṛṣṭas tvam evaṃ vaktum arhasi /
analyzed: doṣam guṇam vā saṃpṛṣṭaḥ tvam evam vaktum arhasi
translated: When asked about a fault or a virtue, you should speak thus.

original: apāyaṃ vāpy upāyaṃ vā kāryasyāsya viniścaye // / / //
analyzed: apāyam vā api upāyam vā kāryasya asya viniścaye
translated: In determining this matter, you should speak about the danger or the means.

original: saṃpṛṣṭena tu vaktavyaṃ sacivena vipaścitā /
analyzed: saṃpṛṣṭena tu vaktavyam sacivena vipaścitā
translated: When asked, a wise minister should speak.

original: udyatāñjalinā rājño ya icched bhūtim ātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: udyata añjalinā rājñaḥ yaḥ icchet bhūtim ātmanaḥ
translated: One who desires his own prosperity should speak to the king with folded hands.

original: vākyam apratikūlaṃ tu mṛdupūrvaṃ śubhaṃ hitam /
analyzed: vākyam a pratikūlam tu mṛdupūrvam śubham hitam
translated: But one should speak words that are not contrary, gentle, auspicious, beneficial,

original: upacāreṇa yuktaṃ ca vaktavyo vasudhādhipaḥ // / / //
analyzed: upacāreṇa yuktam ca vaktavyaḥ vasudhādhipaḥ
translated: and accompanied by courtesy, to the lord of the earth.

original: sāvamardaṃ tu yad vākyaṃ mārīca hitam ucyate /
analyzed: sa avamardam tu yat vākyam mārīca hitam ucyate
translated: O Maricha! But if words that are contemptuous and beneficial are spoken,

original: nābhinandati tad rājā mānārho mānavarjitam // / / //
analyzed: na abhinandati tat rājā māna arhaḥ māna varjitam
translated: the king does not rejoice in them, being worthy of honor but devoid of honor.

original: pañcarūpāṇi rājāno dhārayanty amitaujasaḥ /
analyzed: pañca rūpāṇi rājānaḥ dhārayanti amita ojasaḥ
translated: Kings possess five forms of immeasurable energy,

original: agner indrasya somasya yamasya varuṇasya ca /
analyzed: agneḥ indrasya somasya yamasya varuṇasya ca
translated: of Agni, Indra, Soma, Yama and Varuna.

original: auṣṇyaṃ tathā vikramaṃ ca saumyaṃ daṇḍaṃ prasannatām // / / //
analyzed: auṣṇyam tathā vikramam ca saumyam daṇḍam prasanna tām
translated: Heat, valor, gentleness, punishment and serenity.

original: tasmāt sarvāsv avasthāsu mānyāḥ pūjyāś ca pārthivāḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt sarvāsu avasthāsu mānyāḥ pūjyāḥ ca pārthivāḥ
translated: Therefore, in all situations, kings should be honored and worshipped.

original: tvaṃ tu dharmam avijñāya kevalaṃ moham āsthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tvam tu dharmam a vijñāya kevalam moham āsthitaḥ
translated: But you, not knowing dharma, are resorting to delusion alone.

original: abhyāgataṃ māṃ daurātmyāt paruṣaṃ vadasīdṛśam /🔽guṇadoṣau na pṛcchāmi kṣamaṃ cātmani rākṣasa /
analyzed: abhyāgatam mām daurātmyāt paruṣam vadasi īdṛśam  guṇa doṣau na pṛcchāmi kṣamam ca ātmani rākṣasa
translated: Out of wickedness, you are speaking such harsh words to me who have come here.🔽O Rakshasa, I do not ask about your virtues and faults, but I am capable of judging myself.

original: asmiṃs tu sa bhavān kṛtye sāhāyyaṃ kartum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: asmin tu sa bhavān kṛtye sāhāyyam kartum arhasi
translated: In this matter, you should help me.

original: sauvarṇas tvaṃ mṛgo bhūtvā citro rajatabindubhiḥ /
analyzed: sauvarṇaḥ tvam mṛgaḥ bhūtvā citraḥ rajata bindubhiḥ
translated: Becoming a golden deer, variegated with silver spots,

original: pralobhayitvā vaidehīṃ yatheṣṭaṃ gantum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: pralobhayitvā vaidehīm yatheṣṭam gantum arhasi
translated: having tempted Vaidehi, you should go away as you wish.

original: tvāṃ tu māyāmṛgaṃ dṛṣṭvā kāñcanaṃ jātavismayā /
analyzed: tvām tu māyā mṛgam dṛṣṭvā kāñcanam jāta vismayā
translated: Seeing you, the illusory deer, golden, she will be amazed.

original: ānayainam iti kṣipraṃ rāmaṃ vakṣyati maithilī // / / //
analyzed: ānaya enam iti kṣipram rāmam vakṣyati maithilī
translated: Maithilee will quickly say, Bring him, to Rama.

original: apakrānte ca kākutsthe lakṣmaṇe ca yathāsukham /
analyzed: apakrānte ca kākutsthe lakṣmaṇe ca yathāsukham
translated: And when Kakutstha and Lakshmana have left, as they please,

original: ānayiṣyāmi vaidehīṃ sahasrākṣaḥ śacīm iva // / / //
analyzed: ānayiṣyāmi vaidehīm sahasrākṣaḥ śacīm iva
translated: I will bring Vaidehi, like the thousand-eyed one brings Shachi.

original: evaṃ kṛtvā tv idaṃ kāryaṃ yatheṣṭaṃ gaccha rākṣasa /
analyzed: evam kṛtvā tu idam kāryam yatheṣṭam gaccha rākṣasa
translated: Having done this task, go as you wish, O Rakshasa.

original: rājyasyārdhaṃ pradāsyāmi mārīca tava suvrata // / / //
analyzed: rājyasya ardham pradāsyāmi mārīca tava suvrata
translated: O Maricha, I will give you half of my kingdom, O one of good vows.

original: gaccha saumya śivaṃ mārgaṃ kāryasyāsya vivṛddhaye /
analyzed: gaccha saumya śivam mārgam kāryasya asya vivṛddhaye
translated: Go, my friend, on a safe path for the success of this task.

original: prāpya sītām ayuddhena vañcayitvā tu rāghavam /
analyzed: prāpya sītām ayuddhena vañcayitvā tu rāghavam
translated: Having obtained Sita without a fight and deceived Raghava,

original: laṅkāṃ prati gamiṣyāmi kṛtakāryaḥ saha tvayā // / / //
analyzed: laṅkām prati gamiṣyāmi kṛta kāryaḥ saha tvayā
translated: I will return to Lanka with my purpose accomplished, together with you.

original: etat kāryam avaśyaṃ me balād api kariṣyasi /
analyzed: etat kāryam avaśyam me balāt api kariṣyasi
translated: You will accomplish this task of mine, even by force.

original: rājño hi pratikūlastho na jātu sukham edhate // / / //
analyzed: rājñaḥ hi pratikūla sthaḥ na jātu sukham edhate
translated: For one who stands against the king never attains happiness.

original: āsādya taṃ jīvitasaṃśayas te mṛtyur dhruvo hy adya mayā virudhya /
analyzed: āsādya tam jīvita saṃśayaḥ te mṛtyuḥ dhruvaḥ hi adya mayā virudhya
translated: Having approached me, your life is in doubt. Death is certain for you today if you oppose me.

original: etad yathāvat parigṛhya buddhyā yad atra pathyaṃ kuru tat tathā tvam // / / //
analyzed: etat yathāvat parigṛhya buddhyā yat atra pathyam kuru tat tathā tvam
translated: Having fully understood this, do what is beneficial here, just as it should be done.

original: ājñapto rājavad vākyaṃ pratikūlaṃ niśācaraḥ /
analyzed: ājñaptaḥ rāja vat vākyam pratikūlam niśācaraḥ
translated: The night wanderer, instructed like a king, spoke contrary words.

original: abravīt paruṣaṃ vākyaṃ mārīco rākṣasādhipam // / / //🔽kenāyam upadiṣṭas te vināśaḥ pāpakarmaṇā /
analyzed: abravīt paruṣam vākyam mārīcaḥ rākṣasa adhipam  kena ayam upadiṣṭaḥ te vināśaḥ pāpa karmaṇā
translated: Maricha spoke harsh words to the lord of the demons.

original: saputrasya sarāṣṭrasya sāmātyasya niśācara // / / //
analyzed: sa putrasya sa rāṣṭrasya sa amātyasya niśācara
translated: By whom has this destruction been advised to you, O night wanderer, along with your sons, kingdom and ministers, O sinner?

original: kas tvayā sukhinā rājan nābhinandati pāpakṛt /
analyzed: kaḥ tvayā sukhinā rājan na abhinandati pāpa kṛt
translated: By whom is this evil-doer not delighted with you, O king, when you are happy?

original: kenedam upadiṣṭaṃ te mṛtyudvāram upāyataḥ // / / //
analyzed: kena idam upadiṣṭam te mṛtyu dvāram upāyataḥ
translated: By whom has this door of death been shown to you through a means?

original: śatravas tava suvyaktaṃ hīnavīryā niśācara /
analyzed: śatravaḥ tava su vyaktam hīna vīryāḥ niśācara
translated: O night wanderer, it is clear that your enemies, of little energy,🔽 have shown you this path of death, O lord of the demons.

original: icchanti tvāṃ vinaśyantam uparuddhaṃ balīyasā // / / //🔽kenedam upadiṣṭaṃ te kṣudreṇāhitavādinā /
analyzed: icchanti tvām vinaśyantam uparuddham balīyasā  kena idam upadiṣṭam te kṣudreṇa ahita vādinā
translated: They desire your destruction, when you are obstructed by a powerful one.🔽By whom was this advised to you, by a mean one who speaks unbeneficial things,

original: yas tvām icchati naśyantaṃ svakṛtena niśācara // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ tvām icchati naśyantam sva kṛtena niśācara
translated: O night wanderer, by whom do you desire your destruction, by your own doing?

original: vadhyāḥ khalu na hanyante sacivās tava rāvaṇa /
analyzed: vadhyāḥ khalu na hanyante sacivāḥ tava rāvaṇa
translated: Your ministers, O Ravana, who should be killed, are not killed.

original: ye tvām utpatham ārūḍhaṃ na nigṛhṇanti sarvaśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ye tvām utpatham ārūḍham na nigṛhṇanti sarvaśas
translated: They who do not restrain you in every way, who have mounted on a wrong path?

original: amātyaiḥ kāmavṛtto hi rājā kāpatham āśritaḥ /
analyzed: amātyaiḥ kāma vṛttaḥ hi rājā kāpatham āśritaḥ
translated: A king who acts according to his desires and resorts to a wrong path,

original: nigrāhyaḥ sarvathā sadbhir na nigrāhyo nigṛhyase // / / //🔽dharmam arthaṃ ca kāmaṃ ca yaśaś ca jayatāṃ vara /
analyzed: nigrāhyaḥ sarvathā sadbhiḥ na nigrāhyaḥ nigṛhyase  dharmam artham ca kāmam ca yaśaḥ ca jayatām vara
translated: should be restrained in every way by the virtuous, but you are not restrained.🔽O best among the victorious, ministers obtain righteousness, wealth, desire and fame,

original: svāmiprasādāt sacivāḥ prāpnuvanti niśācara // / / //
analyzed: svāmi prasādāt sacivāḥ prāpnuvanti niśācara
translated: through the grace of the lord, O night wanderer.

original: viparyaye tu tat sarvaṃ vyarthaṃ bhavati rāvaṇa /
analyzed: viparyaye tu tat sarvam vyartham bhavati rāvaṇa
translated: But in the opposite case, all that becomes futile, O Ravana.

original: vyasanaṃ svāmivaiguṇyāt prāpnuvantītare janāḥ // / / //
analyzed: vyasanam svāmi vaiguṇyāt prāpnuvanti itare janāḥ
translated: Other people attain misfortune due to the fault of the lord.

original: rājamūlo hi dharmaś ca jayaś ca jayatāṃ vara /
analyzed: rāja mūlaḥ hi dharmaḥ ca jayaḥ ca jayatām vara
translated: For righteousness and victory have their root in the king, O best among the victorious.

original: tasmāt sarvāsv avasthāsu rakṣitavyo narādhipaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt sarvāsu avasthāsu rakṣitavyaḥ narādhipaḥ
translated: Therefore, the king should be protected in all circumstances.

original: rājyaṃ pālayituṃ śakyaṃ na tīkṣṇena niśācara /
analyzed: rājyam pālayitum śakyam na tīkṣṇena niśācara
translated: A kingdom can be ruled, O night wanderer, not by one who is harsh,

original: na cāpi pratikūlena nāvinītena rākṣasa // / / //
analyzed: na ca api pratikūlena na avinītena rākṣasa
translated: Nor by one who is not well-disposed, nor by one who is not well-trained, O Rākṣasa.

original: ye tīkṣṇamantrāḥ sacivā bhajyante saha tena vai /
analyzed: ye tīkṣṇa mantrāḥ sacivāḥ bhajyante saha tena vai
translated: Those ministers who are of sharp counsel are destroyed along with him.

original: viṣameṣu rathāḥ śīghraṃ mandasārathayo yathā // / / //
analyzed: viṣameṣu rathāḥ śīghram manda sārathayaḥ yathā
translated: Like chariots on uneven ground, with a slow charioteer.

original: bahavaḥ sādhavo loke yuktadharmam anuṣṭhitāḥ /
analyzed: bahavaḥ sādhavaḥ loke yukta dharmam anuṣṭhitāḥ
translated: Many good people in the world, who follow the right dharma,

original: pareṣām aparādhena vinaṣṭāḥ saparicchadāḥ // / / //
analyzed: pareṣām aparādhena vinaṣṭāḥ sa paricchadāḥ
translated: Are destroyed along with their retinue due to the faults of others.

original: svāminā pratikūlena prajās tīkṣṇena rāvaṇa /
analyzed: svāminā pratikūlena prajāḥ tīkṣṇena rāvaṇa
translated: O Rāvaṇa, the subjects, when protected by an unsympathetic king,

original: rakṣyamāṇā na vardhante meṣā gomāyunā yathā // / / //
analyzed: rakṣyamāṇāḥ na vardhante meṣāḥ gomāyunā yathā
translated: Do not prosper, like sheep by a jackal.

original: avaśyaṃ vinaśiṣyanti sarve rāvaṇa rākṣasāḥ /
analyzed: avaśyam vinaśiṣyanti sarve rāvaṇa rākṣasāḥ
translated: O Rāvaṇa, all the Rākṣasas will certainly perish,

original: yeṣāṃ tvaṃ karkaśo rājā durbuddhir ajitendriyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yeṣām tvam karkaśaḥ rājā durbuddhiḥ ajita indriyaḥ
translated: Whose king you are, harsh, of evil intellect, with uncontrolled senses.

original: tad idaṃ kākatālīyaṃ ghoram āsāditaṃ tvayā /
analyzed: tat idam kākatālīyam ghoram āsāditam tvayā
translated: This terrible calamity has befallen you,

original: atra kiṃ śobhanaṃ yat tvaṃ sasainyo vinaśiṣyasi // / / //
analyzed: atra kim śobhanam yat tvam sa sainyaḥ vinaśiṣyasi
translated: What is good in this, that you will perish along with your army?

original: māṃ nihatya tu rāmo 'sau nacirāt tvāṃ vadhiṣyati /
analyzed: mām nihatya tu sau nacirāt tvām vadhiṣyati
translated: But having killed me, that Rāma will soon kill you.

original: anena kṛtakṛtyo 'smi mriye yad ariṇā hataḥ // / / //
analyzed: anena kṛtakṛtyaḥ smi mriye yat ariṇā hataḥ
translated: I am satisfied, that I die killed by an enemy.

original: darśanād eva rāmasya hataṃ mām upadhāraya /
analyzed: darśanāt eva rāmasya hatam mām upadhāraya
translated: Consider me already killed by merely seeing Rāma.

original: ātmānaṃ ca hataṃ viddhi hṛtvā sītāṃ sabāndhavam // / / //
analyzed: ātmānam ca hatam viddhi hṛtvā sītām sa bāndhavam
translated: And know that you and your relatives will be slain, having carried off Sita.

original: ānayiṣyāmi cet sītām āśramāt sahito mayā /
analyzed: ānayiṣyāmi ced sītām āśramāt sahitaḥ mayā
translated: If I were to bring Sita from the hermitage along with me,

original: naiva tvam asi naivāhaṃ naiva laṅkā na rākṣasāḥ // / / //
analyzed: na eva tvam asi na eva aham na eva laṅkāḥ na rākṣasāḥ
translated: then neither you, nor I, nor Lanka, nor the demons...

original: nivāryamāṇas tu mayā hitaiṣiṇā na mṛṣyase vākyam idaṃ niśācara /
analyzed: nivāryamāṇaḥ tu mayā hita eṣiṇā na mṛṣyase vākyam idam niśācara
translated: But you, a night-walker, are not patient with these words, though I, wishing your welfare, am restraining you.

original: paretakalpā hi gatāyuṣo narā hitaṃ na gṛhṇanti suhṛdbhir īritam // / / //
analyzed: pareta kalpāḥ hi gata āyuṣaḥ narāḥ hitam na gṛhṇanti suhṛdbhiḥ īritam
translated: For men whose life is over, as if they were ghosts, do not accept the advice given by well-wishers.

original: evam uktvā tu paruṣaṃ mārīco rāvaṇaṃ tataḥ /
analyzed: evam uktvā tu paruṣam mārīcaḥ rāvaṇam tatas
translated: Having spoken harshly to Ravana in this way, Maricha

original: gacchāvety abravīd dīno bhayād rātriṃcaraprabhoḥ // / / //
analyzed: gacchāva iti abravīt dīnaḥ bhayāt rātriṃcara prabhoḥ
translated: said in a distressed voice, Let us go, out of fear for the lord of the night-wanderers.

original: dṛṣṭaścāhaṃ punas tena śaracāpāsidhāriṇā /
analyzed: dṛṣṭaḥ ca aham punar tena śara cāpa asi dhāriṇā
translated: And I have been seen again by him, holding a bow, arrows and a sword.

original: madvidhodyataśastreṇa vinaṣṭaṃ jīvitaṃ ca me // / / //
analyzed: madvidha udyata śastreṇa vinaṣṭam jīvitam ca me
translated: My life is lost, for I am armed with weapons like him.

original: kiṃ tu kartuṃ mayā śakyam evaṃ tvayi durātmani /
analyzed: kim tu kartum mayā śakyam evam tvayi durātmani
translated: But what can I do for you, an evil-minded one like this?

original: eṣa gacchāmy ahaṃ tāta svasti te 'stu niśācara // / / //🔽prahṛṣṭas tv abhavat tena vacanena sa rākṣasaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa gacchāmi aham tāta svasti te stu niśācara  prahṛṣṭaḥ tu abhavat tena vacanena sa rākṣasaḥ
translated: I am going, dear brother. May you fare well, O night-walker.🔽But the demon was delighted by those words.

original: pariṣvajya susaṃśliṣṭam idaṃ vacanam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: pariṣvajya su saṃśliṣṭam idam vacanam abravīt
translated: Having embraced him closely, he spoke these words:

original: etac chauṇḍīryayuktaṃ te macchabdād iva bhāṣitam /
analyzed: etat śauṇḍīrya yuktam te mad śabdāt iva bhāṣitam
translated: This speech of yours, full of pride, is as if uttered by me.

original: idānīm asi mārīcaḥ pūrvam anyo niśācaraḥ // / / //🔽āruhyatām ayaṃ śīghraṃ khago ratnavibhūṣitaḥ /
analyzed: idānīm asi mārīcaḥ pūrvam anyaḥ niśācaraḥ  āruhyatām ayam śīghram kha gaḥ ratna vibhūṣitaḥ
translated: Now you are Maricha, earlier you were another night-walker.🔽Quickly ascend this bird-drawn chariot adorned with jewels.

original: mayā saha ratho yuktaḥ piśācavadanaiḥ kharaiḥ // / / //🔽tato rāvaṇamārīcau vimānam iva taṃ ratham /
analyzed: mayā saha rathaḥ yuktaḥ piśāca vadanaiḥ kharaiḥ  tatas rāvaṇa mārīcau vimānam iva tam ratham
translated: I have yoked it with asses having the faces of pishchas.🔽Then Ravana and Maricha, like ascending a celestial car,

original: āruhya yayatuḥ śīghraṃ tasmād āśramamaṇḍalāt // / / //
analyzed: āruhya yayatuḥ śīghram tasmāt āśrama maṇḍalāt
translated: mounted that chariot and quickly left that circle of hermitages.

original: tathaiva tatra paśyantau pattanāni vanāni ca /
analyzed: tathā eva tatra paśyantau pattanāni vanāni ca
translated: In the same way, seeing there cities, forests,

original: girīṃś ca saritaḥ sarvā rāṣṭrāṇi nagarāṇi ca // / / //🔽sametya daṇḍakāraṇyaṃ rāghavasyāśramaṃ tataḥ /
analyzed: girīn ca saritaḥ sarvāḥ rāṣṭrāṇi nagarāṇi ca  sametya daṇḍaka araṇyam rāghavasya āśramam tatas
translated: mountains, all rivers, kingdoms and towns,🔽having reached Dandakaranya, then Ravana, the lord of rakshasas,

original: dadarśa sahamarīco rāvaṇo rākṣasādhipaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dadarśa saha marīcaḥ rāvaṇaḥ rākṣasa adhipaḥ
translated: saw Raghava's hermitage with Maricha.

original: avatīrya rathāt tasmāt tataḥ kāñcanabhūṣaṇāt /
analyzed: avatīrya rathāt tasmāt tatas kāñcana bhūṣaṇāt
translated: Having descended from that golden-adorned chariot,

original: haste gṛhītvā mārīcaṃ rāvaṇo vākyam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: haste gṛhītvā mārīcam rāvaṇaḥ vākyam abravīt
translated: taking Maricha by the hand, Ravana spoke these words:

original: etad rāmāśramapadaṃ dṛśyate kadalīvṛtam /
analyzed: etat rāma āśrama padam dṛśyate kadalī vṛtam
translated: This is seen to be Rama's hermitage surrounded by plantain trees.

original: kriyatāṃ tat sakhe śīghraṃ yadarthaṃ vayam āgatāḥ // / / //
analyzed: kriyatām tat sakhe śīghram yad artham vayam āgatāḥ
translated: O friend, do that quickly for which we have come here.

original: sa rāvaṇavacaḥ śrutvā mārīco rākṣasas tadā /
analyzed: sa rāvaṇa vacaḥ śrutvā mārīcaḥ rākṣasaḥ tadā
translated: Hearing Ravana's words, the demon Maricha,

original: mṛgo bhūtvāśramadvāri rāmasya vicacāra ha // / / //🔽maṇipravaraśṛṅgāgraḥ sitāsitamukhākṛtiḥ /
analyzed: mṛgaḥ bhūtvā śrama dvāri rāmasya vicacāra ha  maṇi pravara śṛṅga agraḥ sita asita mukha ākṛtiḥ
translated: Assuming the form of a deer, roamed at the entrance to Rama's hermitage.🔽With horns of the finest gems, a face white and black,

original: raktapadmotpalamukha indranīlotpalaśravāḥ // / / //
analyzed: rakta padma utpala mukhaḥ indranīla utpala śravāḥ
translated: A face like a red lotus and blue lotus, ears like blue lotuses.

original: kiṃcid abhyunnatagrīva indranīlanibhodaraḥ /
analyzed: kiṃcid abhyunnata grīvaḥ indranīla nibha udaraḥ
translated: With a neck slightly raised, a belly like sapphire,

original: madhūkanibhapārśvaś ca kañjakiñjalkasaṃnibhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: madhūka nibha pārśvaḥ ca kañja kiñjalka saṃnibhaḥ
translated: With sides like madhuka flowers, resembling the filaments of a lotus.

original: vaiḍūryasaṃkāśakhuras tanujaṅghaḥ susaṃhataḥ /
analyzed: vaiḍūrya saṃkāśa khuraḥ tanu jaṅghaḥ su saṃhataḥ
translated: With hooves like lapis lazuli, slender legs, well-knit,

original: indrāyudhasavarṇena pucchenordhvaṃ virājitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: indrāyudha savarṇena pucchena ūrdhvam virājitaḥ
translated: Adorned above with a tail like a rainbow.

original: manoharasnigdhavarṇo ratnair nānāvidhair vṛtaḥ /
analyzed: manohara snigdha varṇaḥ ratnaiḥ nānāvidhaiḥ vṛtaḥ
translated: Charming, with a glossy coat, surrounded by various gems,

original: kṣaṇena rākṣaso jāto mṛgaḥ paramaśobhanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kṣaṇena rākṣasaḥ jātaḥ mṛgaḥ parama śobhanaḥ
translated: In an instant, the demon became a supremely beautiful deer.

original: vanaṃ prajvalayan ramyaṃ rāmāśramapadaṃ ca tat /
analyzed: vanam prajvalayan ramyam rāma āśrama padam ca tat
translated: Illuminating the beautiful forest and Rama's hermitage,

original: manoharaṃ darśanīyaṃ rūpaṃ kṛtvā sa rākṣasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: manoharam darśanīyam rūpam kṛtvā sa rākṣasaḥ
translated: The demon, assuming an enchanting and beautiful form,

original: pralobhanārthaṃ vaidehyā nānādhātuvicitritam /
analyzed: pralobhana artham vaidehyāḥ nānā dhātu vicitritam
translated: To tempt Vaidehi, variegated with various minerals,

original: vicaran gacchate samyak śādvalāni samantataḥ // / / //
analyzed: vicaran gacchate samyak śādvalāni samantataḥ
translated: Roaming properly, grazing all around.

original: rūpyabinduśataiś citro bhūtvā ca priyadarśanaḥ /🔽viṭapīnāṃ kisalayān bhaṅktvādan vicacāra ha // / / //
analyzed: rūpya bindu śataiḥ citraḥ bhūtvā ca priya darśanaḥ  kisalayān bhaṅktvā adan vicacāra ha
translated: Having become beautiful with hundreds of silver spots,🔽he wandered around, breaking the sprouts of the creepers and eating them.

original: kadalīgṛhakaṃ gatvā karṇikārān itas tataḥ /
analyzed: kadalīgṛhakam gatvā karṇikārān itas tatas
translated: Having gone to the plantain house, here and there to the karnikara trees,

original: samāśrayan mandagatiḥ sītāsaṃdarśanaṃ tadā // / / //🔽rājīvacitrapṛṣṭhaḥ sa virarāja mahāmṛgaḥ /
analyzed: samāśrayat manda gatiḥ sītā saṃdarśanam tadā  rājīva citra pṛṣṭhaḥ sa virarāja mahā mṛgaḥ
translated: he resorted to them with slow movements, then, desiring to see Sita.🔽That great deer shone with a back variegated with lotuses,

original: rāmāśramapadābhyāśe vicacāra yathāsukham // / / //🔽punar gatvā nivṛttaś ca vicacāra mṛgottamaḥ /
analyzed: rāma āśrama pada abhyāśe vicacāra yathāsukham  punar gatvā nivṛttaḥ ca vicacāra mṛga uttamaḥ
translated: he roamed as he pleased near the hermitage of Rama.🔽Again going and returning, that best of deer roamed,

original: gatvā muhūrtaṃ tvarayā punaḥ pratinivartate // / / //
analyzed: gatvā muhūrtam tvarayā punar pratinivartate
translated: going for a moment quickly and then returning again.

original: vikrīḍaṃś ca punar bhūmau punar eva niṣīdati /
analyzed: vikrīḍan ca punar bhūmau punar eva niṣīdati
translated: Playing on the ground again and again, he sat down.

original: āśramadvāram āgamya mṛgayūthāni gacchati // / / //
analyzed: āśrama dvāram āgamya mṛga yūthāni gacchati
translated: Coming to the entrance of the hermitage, he went to the herds of deer.

original: mṛgayūthair anugataḥ punar eva nivartate /
analyzed: mṛga yūthaiḥ anugataḥ punar eva nivartate
translated: Followed by the herds of deer, he returned again.

original: sītādarśanam ākāṅkṣan rākṣaso mṛgatāṃ gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: sītā darśanam ākāṅkṣan rākṣasaḥ mṛga tām gataḥ
translated: The demon, having taken the form of a deer, desiring to see Sita,

original: paribhramati citrāṇi maṇḍalāni viniṣpatan /
analyzed: paribhramati citrāṇi maṇḍalāni viniṣpatan
translated: roamed around, leaping in various circles.

original: samudvīkṣya ca sarve taṃ mṛgā ye 'nye vanecarāḥ // / / //
analyzed: samudvīkṣya ca sarve tam mṛgāḥ ye nye vanecarāḥ
translated: And all the other deer that roamed in the forest,

original: upagamya samāghrāya vidravanti diśo daśa /
analyzed: upagamya samāghrāya vidravanti diśaḥ daśa
translated: having seen him, approached, sniffed him, and ran in the ten directions.

original: rākṣasaḥ so 'pi tān vanyān mṛgān mṛgavadhe rataḥ // / / //
analyzed: rākṣasaḥ saḥ u pi tān vanyān mṛgān mṛga vadhe rataḥ
translated: And that demon, engaged in killing wild deer, also killed those deer.

original: pracchādanārthaṃ bhāvasya na bhakṣayati saṃspṛśan /
analyzed: pracchādana artham bhāvasya na bhakṣayati saṃspṛśan
translated: Without eating, he merely touched them to conceal his true nature.

original: tasminn eva tataḥ kāle vaidehī śubhalocanā // / / //
analyzed: tasmin eva tatas kāle vaidehī śubha locanā
translated: At that very time, Vaidehi, the one with beautiful eyes,

original: kusumāpacaye vyagrā pādapān atyavartata /🔽karṇikārān aśokāṃś ca cūtāṃś ca madirekṣaṇā // / / //
analyzed: kusuma apacaye vyagrā pādapān atyavartata  karṇikārān aśokān ca cūtān ca madirā īkṣaṇā
translated: was busy collecting flowers and passed by the trees.🔽The one with eyes like a tipsy woman,

original: kusumāny apacinvantī cacāra rucirānanā /🔽anarhāraṇyavāsasya sā taṃ ratnamayaṃ mṛgam /
analyzed: kusumāni apacinvantī cacāra rucira ānanā  anarhā araṇya vāsasya sā tam ratna mayam mṛgam
translated: was plucking flowers and wandering around with a beautiful face.🔽That supreme woman, who did not deserve to live in the forest, saw that jewel-made deer,

original: muktāmaṇivicitrāṅgaṃ dadarśa paramāṅganā // / / //🔽taṃ vai ruciradantauṣṭhaṃ rūpyadhātutanūruham /
analyzed: muktāmaṇi vicitra aṅgam dadarśa parama aṅganā  tam vai rucira danta oṣṭham rūpya dhātu tanūruham
translated: with limbs adorned with pearls and gems.🔽With eyes wide open in wonder, she lovingly gazed at him,

original: vismayotphullanayanā sasnehaṃ samudaikṣata // / / //
analyzed: vismaya utphulla nayanā sa sneham samudaikṣata
translated: whose teeth and lips were beautiful and whose body was covered with silver ore.

original: sa ca tāṃ rāmadayitāṃ paśyan māyāmayo mṛgaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca tām rāma dayitām paśyan māyā mayaḥ mṛgaḥ
translated: As that illusory deer, seeing Rama's beloved,

original: vicacāra tatas tatra dīpayann iva tad vanam // / / //
analyzed: vicacāra tatas tatra dīpayan iva tat vanam
translated: wandered there, it seemed to illuminate that forest.

original: adṛṣṭapūrvaṃ dṛṣṭvā taṃ nānāratnamayaṃ mṛgam /
analyzed: a dṛṣṭa pūrvam dṛṣṭvā tam nānā ratna mayam mṛgam
translated: Seeing that deer made of various jewels, never seen before,

original: vismayaṃ paramaṃ sītā jagāma janakātmajā // / / //
analyzed: vismayam paramam sītā jagāma janakātmajā
translated: Sita, the daughter of Janaka, was filled with great wonder.

original: sā taṃ samprekṣya suśroṇī kusumāni vicinvatī /🔽hemarājatavarṇābhyāṃ pārśvābhyām upaśobhitam // / / //
analyzed: sā tam samprekṣya su śroṇī kusumāni vicinvatī  hema rājata varṇābhyām pārśvābhyām upaśobhitam
translated: The one with beautiful hips, while gathering flowers, saw him.🔽Adorned with sides having the color of gold and silver.

original: prahṛṣṭā cānavadyāṅgī mṛṣṭahāṭakavarṇinī /
analyzed: prahṛṣṭā ca anavadya aṅgī mṛṣṭa hāṭaka varṇinī
translated: The one with a faultless body, having the color of polished gold, was delighted.

original: bhartāram api cākrandal lakṣmaṇaṃ caiva sāyudham // / / //
analyzed: bhartāram api ca akrandat lakṣmaṇam ca eva sa āyudham
translated: And she called out to her husband and Lakshmana, who had weapons.

original: tayāhūtau naravyāghrau vaidehyā rāmalakṣmaṇau /
analyzed: tayā āhūtau nara vyāghrau vaidehyāḥ rāma lakṣmaṇau
translated: Lakshmana and Rama, the best of men, were called by Vaidehi.

original: vīkṣamāṇau tu taṃ deśaṃ tadā dadṛśatur mṛgam // / / //
analyzed: vīkṣamāṇau tu tam deśam tadā dadṛśatuḥ mṛgam
translated: But while looking at that place, they saw the deer.

original: śaṅkamānas tu taṃ dṛṣṭvā lakṣmaṇo rāmam abravīt /
analyzed: śaṅkamānaḥ tu tam dṛṣṭvā lakṣmaṇaḥ rāmam abravīt
translated: Seeing him, Lakshmana suspected and said to Rama:

original: tam evainam ahaṃ manye mārīcaṃ rākṣasaṃ mṛgam // / / //🔽caranto mṛgayāṃ hṛṣṭā pāpenopādhinā vane /
analyzed: tam eva enam aham manye mārīcam rākṣasam mṛgam  carantaḥ mṛgayām hṛṣṭā pāpena upādhinā vane
translated: I think this is the demon Maricha in the form of a deer.🔽In the forest, under the pretext of hunting, we were happily roaming.

original: anena nihatā rāma rājānaḥ kāmarūpiṇā // / / //
analyzed: anena nihatāḥ rāma rājānaḥ kāmarūpiṇā
translated: O Rama, by this sinful one, assuming any form at will, kings were killed.

original: asya māyāvido māyā mṛgarūpam idaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: asya māyā vidaḥ māyā mṛga rūpam idam kṛtam
translated: This one, who is an illusionist, has created this illusion in the form of a deer.

original: bhānumatpuruṣavyāghra gandharvapurasaṃnibham // / / //🔽mṛgo hy evaṃvidho ratna vicitro nāsti rāghava /
analyzed: bhānumat puruṣa vyāghra gandharva pura saṃnibham  mṛgaḥ hi evaṃvidhaḥ ratna vicitraḥ nā asti rāghava
translated: O radiant one, O best of men, it resembles a city of the Gandharvas.🔽O Raghava, O lord of the earth, there is no such variegated jeweled deer in the world.

original: jagatyāṃ jagatīnātha māyaiṣā hi na saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: jagatyām jagatī nātha māyā eṣā hi na saṃśayaḥ
translated: This is undoubtedly an illusion.

original: evaṃ bruvāṇaṃ kākutsthaṃ prativārya śucismitā /
analyzed: evam bruvāṇam kākutstham prativārya śuci smitā
translated: Having thus spoken, the pure-smiling one stopped Kakutstha.

original: uvāca sītā saṃhṛṣṭā chadmanā hṛtacetanā // / / //
analyzed: uvāca sītā saṃhṛṣṭā chadmanā hṛta cetanā
translated: Having said this, the pure-smiling Sita, her heart captivated by the illusion, joyfully replied to Kakutstha, restraining him.

original: āryaputrābhirāmo 'sau mṛgo harati me manaḥ /
analyzed: ārya putra abhirāmaḥ sau mṛgaḥ harati me manaḥ
translated: O noble husband, this deer captivates my mind.

original: ānayainaṃ mahābāho krīḍārthaṃ no bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: ānaya enam mahā bāho krīḍā artham naḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Bring it here, O mighty-armed one. It will be our plaything.

original: ihāśramapade 'smākaṃ bahavaḥ puṇyadarśanāḥ /🔽mṛgāś caranti sahitāś camarāḥ sṛmarās tathā // / / //
analyzed: iha āśrama pade smākam bahavaḥ puṇya darśanāḥ  mṛgāḥ caranti sahitāḥ camarāḥ sṛmarāḥ tathā
translated: In this hermitage of ours, many auspicious deer are seen.🔽Deer, antelopes, and also chamaras and srimaras roam together.

original: ṛkṣāḥ pṛṣatasaṃghāś ca vānarāḥ kiṃnarās tathā /
analyzed: ṛkṣāḥ pṛṣata saṃghāḥ ca vānarāḥ kiṃnarāḥ tathā
translated: Bears, herds of spotted deer, monkeys, and kinnaras,

original: vicaranti mahābāho rūpaśreṣṭhā mahābalāḥ // / / //🔽na cāsya sadṛśo rājan dṛṣṭapūrvo mṛgaḥ purā /
analyzed: vicaranti mahā bāho rūpa śreṣṭhāḥ mahā balāḥ  na ca asya sadṛśaḥ rājan dṛṣṭa pūrvaḥ mṛgaḥ purā
translated: roam here, O mighty-armed one, of the best form and great strength.

original: tejasā kṣamayā dīptyā yathāyaṃ mṛgasattamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tejasā kṣamayā dīptyā yathā ayam mṛga sattamaḥ
translated: O king, such a deer as this best of deer, in splendor, forgiveness, and brilliance, has never been seen before by me.

original: nānāvarṇavicitrāṅgo ratnabindusamācitaḥ /
analyzed: nānā varṇa vicitra aṅgaḥ ratna bindu samācitaḥ
translated: With variegated limbs of various colors, adorned with jewel spots,

original: dyotayan vanam avyagraṃ śobhate śaśisaṃnibhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dyotayan vanam avyagram śobhate śaśi saṃnibhaḥ
translated: shining in the forest without anxiety, it is beautiful like the moon.

original: aho rūpam aho lakṣmīḥ svarasampac ca śobhanā /
analyzed: aho rūpam aho lakṣmīḥ svara sampad ca śobhanā
translated: Oh, what a form! Oh, what grace! What a beautiful voice!

original: mṛgo 'dbhuto vicitro 'sau hṛdayaṃ haratīva me // / / //
analyzed: mṛgaḥ dbhutaḥ vicitraḥ sau hṛdayam harati iva me
translated: This wonderful, variegated deer seems to captivate my heart.

original: yadi grahaṇam abhyeti jīvann eva mṛgas tava /
analyzed: yadi grahaṇam abhyeti jīvan eva mṛgaḥ tava
translated: If this deer comes within your grasp alive,

original: āścaryabhūtaṃ bhavati vismayaṃ janayiṣyati // / / //
analyzed: āścarya bhūtam bhavati vismayam janayiṣyati
translated: it will be a wonder and will cause amazement.

original: samāptavanavāsānāṃ rājyasthānāṃ ca naḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: samāpta vana vāsānām rājya sthānām ca naḥ punar
translated: And when we have completed our forest life and regained our kingdom,

original: antaḥpuravibhūṣārtho mṛga eṣa bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: antaḥpura vibhūṣā arthaḥ mṛgaḥ eṣa bhaviṣyati
translated: this deer will become an ornament for the inner apartments.

original: bharatasyāryaputrasya śvaśrūṇāṃ mama ca prabho /
analyzed: bharatasya arya putrasya śvaśrūṇām mama ca prabho
translated: For Bharata, the noble son, and for my mothers-in-law, O lord,

original: mṛgarūpam idaṃ divyaṃ vismayaṃ janayiṣyati // / / //
analyzed: mṛga rūpam idam divyam vismayam janayiṣyati
translated: this divine form of the deer will cause wonder.

original: jīvan na yadi te 'bhyeti grahaṇaṃ mṛgasattamaḥ /
analyzed: jīvan na yadi te bhyeti grahaṇam mṛga sattamaḥ
translated: If this best of deer does not come within your grasp alive,

original: ajinaṃ naraśārdūla ruciraṃ me bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: ajinam nara śārdūla ruciram me bhaviṣyati
translated: then, O tiger among men, its beautiful skin will be mine.

original: nihatasyāsya sattvasya jāmbūnadamayatvaci /
analyzed: nihatasya asya sattvasya jāmbūnada maya tvaci
translated: On the skin of this slain beast, made of gold,

original: śaṣpabṛsyāṃ vinītāyām icchāmy aham upāsitum // / / //
analyzed: śaṣpa bṛsyām vinītāyām icchāmi aham upāsitum
translated: I wish to sit on a well-prepared bed of grass.

original: kāmavṛttam idaṃ raudraṃ strīṇām asadṛśaṃ matam /
analyzed: kāma vṛttam idam raudram strīṇām a sadṛśam matam
translated: This lustful and terrible behavior of women is considered improper.

original: vapuṣā tv asya sattvasya vismayo janito mama // / / //🔽tena kāñcanaromnā tu maṇipravaraśṛṅgiṇā /
analyzed: vapuṣā tu asya sattvasya vismayaḥ janitaḥ mama  tena kāñcana romnā tu maṇi pravara śṛṅgiṇā
translated: But this form of the beast has caused wonder in me.🔽With golden hair, adorned with the best of gems on its horns,

original: taruṇādityavarṇena nakṣatrapathavarcasā /
analyzed: taruṇa āditya varṇena nakṣatra patha varcasā
translated: with a color like the rising sun, with the splendor of the path of stars,

original: babhūva rāghavasyāpi mano vismayam āgatam // / / //
analyzed: babhūva rāghavasya api manaḥ vismayam āgatam
translated: Rama's mind was also filled with wonder.

original: evaṃ sītāvacaḥ śrutvā dṛṣṭvā ca mṛgam adbhutam /
analyzed: evam sītā vacaḥ śrutvā dṛṣṭvā ca mṛgam adbhutam
translated: Having heard Sita's words and seen that wondrous deer,

original: uvāca rāghavo hṛṣṭo bhrātaraṃ lakṣmaṇaṃ vacaḥ // / / //
analyzed: uvāca rāghavaḥ hṛṣṭaḥ bhrātaram lakṣmaṇam vacaḥ
translated: Raghava joyfully spoke to his brother Lakshmana, saying:

original: paśya lakṣmaṇa vaidehyāḥ spṛhāṃ mṛgagatām imām /
analyzed: paśya lakṣmaṇa vaidehyāḥ spṛhām mṛga gatām imām
translated: Look, Lakshmana, Vaidehi's desire for this deer.

original: rūpaśreṣṭhatayā hy eṣa mṛgo 'dya na bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: rūpa śreṣṭha tayā hi eṣa mṛgaḥ na bhaviṣyati
translated: For this deer is the best in form, and today it will not exist.

original: na vane nandanoddeśe na caitrarathasaṃśraye /
analyzed: na vane nandana uddeśe na caitraratha saṃśraye
translated: Not in the Nandana grove, nor in the Chaitraratha grove,

original: kutaḥ pṛthivyāṃ saumitre yo 'sya kaścit samo mṛgaḥ // / / //🔽pratilomānulomāś ca rucirā romarājayaḥ /
analyzed: kutas pṛthivyām saumitre yaḥ sya kaścid samaḥ mṛgaḥ  pratiloma anulomāḥ ca rucirāḥ romarājayaḥ
translated: From where on earth, O Saumitri, is there any deer equal to this?🔽The beautiful rows of hair, against and with the grain,

original: śobhante mṛgam āśritya citrāḥ kanakabindubhiḥ // / / //🔽paśyāsya jṛmbhamāṇasya dīptām agniśikhopamām /
analyzed: śobhante mṛgam āśritya citrāḥ kanaka bindubhiḥ  paśya asya jṛmbhamāṇasya dīptām agni śikhā upamām
translated: Adorn the deer, variegated with golden spots.🔽Look at its yawning, with a tongue blazing like the flame of a fire,

original: jihvāṃ mukhān niḥsarantīṃ meghād iva śatahradām // / / //
analyzed: jihvām mukhāt niḥsarantīm meghāt iva śatahradām
translated: Emerging from its mouth like a hundred-rayed lightning from a cloud.

original: masāragalvarkamukhaḥ śaṅkhamuktānibhodaraḥ /🔽kasya nāmābhirūpo 'sau na mano lobhayen mṛgaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kasya nāma abhirūpaḥ sau na manaḥ lobhayet mṛgaḥ
translated: With a face like coral, emerald, and the sun, and a belly like a conch and pearls,🔽Whose mind would not this beautiful deer captivate?

original: kasya rūpam idaṃ dṛṣṭvā jāmbūnadamayaprabham /
analyzed: kasya rūpam idam dṛṣṭvā jāmbūnada maya prabham
translated: Whose mind would not be captivated by this deer, whose form is like the luster of gold,

original: nānāratnamayaṃ divyaṃ na mano vismayaṃ vrajet // / / //
analyzed: nānā ratna mayam divyam na manaḥ vismayam vrajet
translated: and the divine one made of various gems, the mind would not be amazed.

original: māṃsahetor api mṛgān vihārārthaṃ ca dhanvinaḥ /
analyzed: māṃsa hetoḥ api mṛgān vihāra artham ca dhanvinaḥ
translated: For the sake of meat and for sport, archers

original: ghnanti lakṣmaṇa rājāno mṛgayāyāṃ mahāvane // / / //
analyzed: ghnanti lakṣmaṇa rājānaḥ mṛgayāyām mahā vane
translated: kill deer in the great forest during hunting, O Lakshmana.

original: dhanāni vyavasāyena vicīyante mahāvane /
analyzed: dhanāni vyavasāyena vicīyante mahā vane
translated: Wealth is sought out with effort in the great forest,

original: dhātavo vividhāś cāpi maṇiratnasuvarṇinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dhātavaḥ vividhāḥ ca api maṇi ratna suvarṇinaḥ
translated: and various minerals, gems, jewels, and gold are also sought out.

original: tat sāram akhilaṃ nṝṇāṃ dhanaṃ nicayavardhanam /
analyzed: tat sāram akhilam nṝṇām dhanam nicaya vardhanam
translated: That is the essence of all men, wealth that increases with accumulation,

original: manasā cintitaṃ sarvaṃ yathā śukrasya lakṣmaṇa // / / //
analyzed: manasā cintitam sarvam yathā śukrasya lakṣmaṇa
translated: and everything thought of by the mind, just like Shukra's, O Lakshmana.

original: arthī yenārthakṛtyena saṃvrajaty avicārayan /
analyzed: arthī yena artha kṛtyena saṃvrajati a vicārayan
translated: By which one goes without hesitation for the sake of wealth,

original: tam artham arthaśāstrajñaḥ prāhur arthyāś ca lakṣmaṇa // / / //
analyzed: tam artham artha śāstra jñaḥ prāhuḥ arthyāḥ ca lakṣmaṇa
translated: that wealth, O Lakshmana, is said by those who know the science of wealth and by the wealthy.

original: etasya mṛgaratnasya parārdhye kāñcanatvaci /
analyzed: etasya mṛga ratnasya parārdhye kāñcana tvaci
translated: On the extremely valuable golden skin of this deer-jewel,

original: upavekṣyati vaidehī mayā saha sumadhyamā // / / //
analyzed: upavekṣyati vaidehī mayā saha sumadhyamā
translated: the slender-waisted Vaidehi will sit with me.

original: na kādalī na priyakī na praveṇī na cāvikī /
analyzed: na kādalī na priyakī na praveṇī na ca āvikī
translated: I think that neither a plantain, nor a priyaka, nor a praveni, nor a she-goat,

original: bhaved etasya sadṛśī sparśaneneti me matiḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhavet etasya sadṛśī sparśanena iti me matiḥ
translated: can be equal to this in touch.

original: eṣa caiva mṛgaḥ śrīmān yaś ca divyo nabhaścaraḥ /
analyzed: eṣa ca eva mṛgaḥ śrīmān yaḥ ca divyaḥ nabhaḥ caraḥ
translated: And this glorious deer, and the divine one that moves in the sky,

original: ubhāv etau mṛgau divyau tārāmṛgamahīmṛgau // / / //
analyzed: ubhau etau mṛgau divyau tārāmṛga mahīmṛgau
translated: Both these deer are celestial, the star-deer and the earth-deer.

original: yadi vāyaṃ tathā yan māṃ bhaved vadasi lakṣmaṇa /🔽māyaiṣā rākṣasasyeti kartavyo 'sya vadho mayā // / / //
analyzed: yadi vā ayam tathā yat mām bhavet vadasi lakṣmaṇa  māyā eṣā rākṣasasya iti kartavyaḥ sya vadhaḥ mayā
translated: If this is so, O Lakshmana, as you say,🔽this illusion of the Rakshasa should be destroyed by me.

original: etena hi nṛśaṃsena mārīcenākṛtātmanā /
analyzed: etena hi nṛśaṃsena mārīcena akṛtātmanā
translated: For, by this cruel and wicked Maricha,

original: vane vicaratā pūrvaṃ hiṃsitā munipuṃgavāḥ // / / //🔽utthāya bahavo yena mṛgayāyāṃ janādhipāḥ /
analyzed: vane vicaratā pūrvam hiṃsitāḥ muni puṃgavāḥ  utthāya bahavaḥ yena mṛgayāyām janādhipāḥ
translated: while wandering in the forest, the best of sages were formerly harmed.

original: nihatāḥ parameṣvāsās tasmād vadhyas tv ayaṃ mṛgaḥ // / / //
analyzed: nihatāḥ parama iṣvāsāḥ tasmāt vadhyaḥ tu ayam mṛgaḥ
translated: Many kings, great archers, were killed by him while rising up in hunting. Therefore, this deer should be killed.

original: purastād iha vātāpiḥ paribhūya tapasvinaḥ /
analyzed: purastāt iha vātāpiḥ paribhūya tapasvinaḥ
translated: In the past, Vatapi, having overpowered the ascetics,

original: udarastho dvijān hanti svagarbho 'śvatarīm iva // / / //
analyzed: udara sthaḥ dvijān hanti śvatarīm iva
translated: while in the belly, killed the Brahmins, like a mule in the womb.

original: sa kadācic cirāl loke āsasāda mahāmunim /
analyzed: sa kadācid cirāt loke āsasāda mahā munim
translated: He, after a long time, in this world, met the great sage

original: agastyaṃ tejasā yuktaṃ bhakṣyas tasya babhūva ha // / / //
analyzed: agastyam tejasā yuktam bhakṣyaḥ tasya babhūva ha
translated: Agastya, endowed with brilliance, and became his food.

original: samutthāne ca tadrūpaṃ kartukāmaṃ samīkṣya tam /
analyzed: samutthāne ca tad rūpam kartu kāmam samīkṣya tam
translated: And seeing him desirous of assuming that form at the time of rising up,

original: utsmayitvā tu bhagavān vātāpim idam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: utsmayitvā tu bhagavān vātāpim idam abravīt
translated: the illustrious one, smiling, said this to Vatapi:

original: tvayāvigaṇya vātāpe paribhūtāś ca tejasā /
analyzed: tvayā a vigaṇya vāta āpe paribhūtāḥ ca tejasā
translated: O Vatapi, you, disregarding the Brahmins, have been overpowered by me with my brilliance.

original: jīvaloke dvijaśreṣṭhās tasmād asi jarāṃ gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: jīva loke dvijaśreṣṭhāḥ tasmāt asi jarām gataḥ
translated: Therefore, O best of the twice-born, you have become old in the world of living beings.

original: evaṃ tan na bhaved rakṣo vātāpir iva lakṣmaṇa /
analyzed: evam tat na bhavet rakṣaḥ vātāpiḥ iva lakṣmaṇa
translated: Thus, that Rakshasa will not be, like Vatapi, O Lakshmana.

original: madvidhaṃ yo 'timanyeta dharmanityaṃ jitendriyam // / / //
analyzed: madvidham dharma nityam jita indriyam
translated: He who would despise one like me, ever devoted to virtue and having his senses under control.

original: bhaveddhato 'yaṃ vātāpir agastyeneva māṃ gatiḥ /
analyzed: bhavet hataḥ yam vātāpiḥ agastyena iva mām gatiḥ
translated: This one would be slain, like Vatapi, and my end would be like that of Agastya.

original: iha tvaṃ bhava saṃnaddho yantrito rakṣa maithilīm // / / //
analyzed: iha tvam bhava saṃnaddhaḥ yantritaḥ rakṣa maithilīm
translated: Here, you be ready, watchful, and protect Maithili.

original: asyām āyattam asmākaṃ yat kṛtyaṃ raghunandana /
analyzed: asyām āyattam asmākam yat kṛtyam raghunandana
translated: In this, O descendant of Raghu, what is to be done by us depends on her.

original: aham enaṃ vadhiṣyāmi grahīṣyāmy athavā mṛgam // / / //
analyzed: aham enam vadhiṣyāmi grahīṣyāmi athavā mṛgam
translated: I will kill this one, or I will catch the deer.

original: yāvad gacchāmi saumitre mṛgam ānayituṃ drutam /
analyzed: yāvat gacchāmi saumitre mṛgam ānayitum drutam
translated: As long as I go, O son of Sumitra, to bring the deer quickly.

original: paśya lakṣmaṇa vaidehīṃ mṛgatvaci gataspṛhām // / / //
analyzed: paśya lakṣmaṇa vaidehīm mṛga tvaci gata spṛhām
translated: See, O Lakshmana, Vaidehi, desirous of the deer's skin.

original: tvacā pradhānayā hy eṣa mṛgo 'dya na bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tvacā pradhānayā hi eṣa mṛgaḥ na bhaviṣyati
translated: For, with its principal skin, this deer will not exist today.

original: apramattena te bhāvyam āśramasthena sītayā // / / //🔽yāvat pṛṣatam ekena sāyakena nihanmy aham /
analyzed: apramattena te bhāvyam āśrama sthena sītayā  yāvat pṛṣatam ekena sāyakena nihanmi aham
translated: You should be heedful, staying in the hermitage with Sita.🔽As long as I kill this spotted deer with one arrow.

original: hatvaitac carma ādāya śīghram eṣyāmi lakṣmaṇa // / / //
analyzed: hatvā etat carma ādāya śīghram eṣyāmi lakṣmaṇa
translated: Having killed it and taken its skin, I will quickly come, O Lakshmana.

original: pradakṣiṇenātibalena pakṣiṇā jaṭāyuṣā buddhimatā ca lakṣmaṇa /
analyzed: pradakṣiṇena atibalena pakṣiṇā jaṭāyuṣā buddhimatā ca lakṣmaṇa
translated: By the powerful bird Jatayu, who is wise and is circumambulating (you), O Lakshmana,

original: bhavāpramattaḥ pratigṛhya maithilīṃ pratikṣaṇaṃ sarvata eva śaṅkitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhava apramattaḥ pratigṛhya maithilīm pratikṣaṇam sarvatas eva śaṅkitaḥ
translated: Be watchful and accept Maithili, always suspicious from all sides.

original: tathā tu taṃ samādiśya bhrātaraṃ raghunandanaḥ /
analyzed: tathā tu tam samādiśya bhrātaram raghunandanaḥ
translated: Having thus instructed his brother, the descendant of Raghu,

original: babandhāsiṃ mahātejā jāmbūnadamayatsarum // / / //
analyzed: babandha asim mahā tejāḥ jāmbūnada maya tsarum
translated: The greatly energetic one fastened his sword with a hilt made of gold.

original: tatas tryavanataṃ cāpam ādāyātmavibhūṣaṇam /
analyzed: tatas tri avanatam cāpam ādāya ātma vibhūṣaṇam
translated: Then taking up his bow, which was bent in three places and was his ornament,

original: ābadhya ca kalāpau dvau jagāmodagravikramaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ābadhya ca kalāpau dvau jagāma udagra vikramaḥ
translated: And fastening two quivers, he went forth with lofty prowess.

original: taṃ vañcayāno rājendram āpatantaṃ nirīkṣya vai /
analyzed: tam vañcayānaḥ rāja indram āpatantam nirīkṣya vai
translated: Trying to deceive the king, he saw him coming,

original: babhūvāntarhitas trāsāt punaḥ saṃdarśane 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: babhūva antarhitaḥ trāsāt punar saṃdarśane bhavat
translated: And out of fear, he disappeared, but again appeared before him.

original: baddhāsir dhanur ādāya pradudrāva yato mṛgaḥ /
analyzed: baddha asiḥ dhanuḥ ādāya pradudrāva yatas mṛgaḥ
translated: With his sword fastened and taking up his bow, he rushed towards where the deer was,

original: taṃ sa paśyati rūpeṇa dyotamānam ivāgrataḥ // / / //
analyzed: tam sa paśyati rūpeṇa dyotamānam iva agratas
translated: And he saw him shining in front, as if in form.

original: avekṣyāvekṣya dhāvantaṃ dhanuṣpāṇir mahāvane /
analyzed: avekṣya avekṣya dhāvantam dhanuṣpāṇiḥ mahā vane
translated: Seeing him running again and again, with a bow in his hand in the great forest,

original: ativṛttam iṣoḥ pātāl lobhayānaṃ kadācana // / / //
analyzed: ativṛttam iṣoḥ pātāt lobha yānam kadācana
translated: Sometimes tempting him beyond the range of the arrow.

original: śaṅkitaṃ tu samudbhrāntam utpatantam ivāmbare /
analyzed: śaṅkitam tu samudbhrāntam utpatantam iva ambare
translated: But he was suspicious, agitated, as if flying in the sky,

original: daśyamānam adṛśyaṃ ca navoddeśeṣu keṣucit // / / //
analyzed: daśyamānam adṛśyam ca nava uddeśeṣu keṣucid
